loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Fidelina G. es madre soltera de 3 hijos, ya todos mayores de edad. Logró salir adelante sola y con mucho esfuerzo.
 La misma comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de  Itá, labor que realizó durante 30 años. Dicha tarea era muy esforzada  debido a  que se trasladaba desde una de las compañías lejanas hasta la ciudad en transporte público cargando con sus mercaderías. Fue por eso que decidió abrir su propio negocio comercial en su domicilio y terminar de esa forma con tantos años de sacrificio.
Fidelina posee una despensa muy bien surtida de la que compran mercaderías todos los vecinos del lugar. Es una señora muy amable que gracias al buen trato y cortesía con que trata a sus clientes, ha logrado formar una muy buena clientela.
Necesita de un préstamo para ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercaderías tales como: bebidas y alimentos balanceados para animales ya que en la zona existe mucha gente que se dedica a la ganadería y cría de animales de granja y hay una gran demanda de estos productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fidelina Gammara is a single mother of 3 children, all of them are adults now. She was able to succeed by herself working very hard. She used to sell vegetables and fruits at the municipal market of the city of Ita for 30 years. This was very hard work because she used to commute from a very far away town to the city carrying on her supplies on public transportation. This is why she decided to open her store at home and stop this way with all those years of commuting. Fidelina has a very well stocked grocery store, and all her neighbors buy from her. She is a very gentle lady and her good manners have brought her a large number of customers. She needs a loan to increase her business buying beverages, good for animals as many people work on cattle raising around the area.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages and food for animals

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.en:
Members of the "Virgen D. las Mercedes" Village Bank live and meet in the town of Churcampa, in Huancavelica, a Department of central Peru. Churcampa is the provincial capital, and is located at 3300 meters above sea level. The zone is chilly, with rugged terrain. Churcampa trades heavily with the nearby city of Huancayo. Most of the community members are involved in commerce, while some farm and raise livestock. Farmers grow corn in Chucuampa’s low-elevation areas, and peas in higher elevation areas.

Felicitas and Cirila are two members of the "Virgen D. las Mercedes" group. Felicitas is married with five children: four of them are in their twenties, while the youngest is 13. Felicitas has a small restaurant, where she also sells sodas. She launched her business a year ago, when some local bank workers asked if she could cook them lunch. Felicitas’ business is going well; the only problem is that it is hard to find time to plant crops on her farm since she is so busy with the restaurant. Loans from FINCA have helped her buy utensils and offer a wider variety of meals and drinks to sell. She plans to use this loan of 500 soles to buy more dry goods (rice, flour sugar) and sodas. Felicitas’ goals for the future are to send her children to college and to expand her business even more. Cirila is married with four children, who are 28, 24, 21 and 17 years old. She has a small general store that she hopes to expand. She has been running her store for 15 years now, and supports her children with the money she earns. She says that when there was a lot of societal violence in the area (in the 1980s and 1990s, due to conflicts between the armed forces and the Shining Path) it was hard to run the store; she could only stay open until 5pm, since staying open later was unsafe and would make her vulnerable to robberies. She plans to use her loan of 400 soles to improve her business and buy more equipment. Her dreams for the future are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to open a wholesale dry goods business. Working with FINCA has helped her save money in her savings account, which she plans to use for any difficulties she may encounter in the future.

loans.use: Buy rice, flour, sugar, sodas, equipment

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido tiene 40 años de edad, está casado con Delia que tiene 32 años  y juntos han criado a 4 hijos que tienen 11, 10, 7 y 5 años respectivamente. Todos van a la escuela primaria. Guido comenta que también tuvo otros 3 hijos más con su pareja anterior que tienen entre 14 y 18 años pero que lastimosamente no viven con él , aunque siempre están en contacto.
Guido es de profesión fotógrafo, comenta que se inició a la edad de 15 años aprendiendo de un amigo todo lo que hoy día sabe. Comenzó como ayudante de su amigo repartiendo las fotos que éste sacaba en distintos acontecimientos hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de comprarse su propia cámara fotográfica e independizarse. 
Actualmente cuenta con buena clientela formada debido a que sus trabajos son de muy buena calidad. 
A la par de su trabajo como fotógrafo también se desempeña como peluquero, profesión que aprendió de su padre. Para ello cuenta con su propia peluquería que funciona en su casa propia. 
En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para completar el importe para la compra de una cámara fotográfica 
Sueña comprar algún día un terreno cercano a su casa de manera a ampliar la misma. 
Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante con esfuerzo y perseverancia.
texts.en:
Guido is 40 years old and is married with Delia who is 32 and they have 4 children who are 11, 10, 7 and 5 years old respectively. They all go to school. Guido also has 3 more children with his previous couple who are 14 and 18 years old although they don't live with him, they always keep on contact. Guido is a professional photographer, he started when he was 15 years old learning from a friend everything he knows today. He started delivering pictures his friend took at different events until one day he got the chance to buy his own camera and started working by himself. Currently he has a very good clientele because he takes very good quality pictures. He also works as a barber, as he learned this skill from his father. For this he has a small barber shop that he runs from his house. He needs a loan to complete the payment for a camera. He dreams about buying land next to his house in order to increase his house's size. He is a very hard working person who has been able to succeed with effort and perseverance.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a professional digital camera

loans.name: José Andrés

texts.es:
José Andrés tiene 57 años, es casado. Hace 28 años se unió a  Blásida que hoy tiene 45 años y con quien tuvo 4 hijos, tres de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y el último aún vive con ellos.
José se dedica a la faena de ganado, cuya carne vende en la carnicería que funciona en su casa. Al mismo tiempo cuenta con una despensa bien surtida que montó hace más de 25 años. Su esposa le ayuda con el negocio.
Él comenta que es de familia humilde y que junto con su padre anteriormente se dedicaba a la olería (fabricación de ladrillos) y que gracias a su sacrificio logró juntar un pequeño capital para montar la despensa junto con su señora.  Gracias a dicho negocio consiguió estabilidad económica y la posibilidad de sacar adelante a toda su familia y también poder construir su propia vivienda.
De acceder a un crédito, lo estaría invirtiendo en la compra de ganado en pie para engorde que posteriormente lo faenaría para vender la carne en su propia carnicería.
texts.en:
Jose Andres, 57 years old, is married. Twenty eight years ago he joined together with Blásida, now 45, with whom he has four children. Three of them are grown and the youngest still lives with them. Jose works slaughtering cattle, selling the meat in the butcher shop he runs in his home. At the same time he has a well-stocked store that he set up more than 25 years ago. His wife helps with the business. He says that he is from a humble family and with his father he previously worked making bricks. Thanks to their sacrifice he was able to put together a small capital to set up the store along with his wife. Thanks to this business he achieved economic stability and the possibility of moving forward with his entire family, and also being able to build his own home. Having access to credit, he would invest in the purchase of standing cattle to fatten up and later slaughter in order to sell the meat in his own butcher shop.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for fattening and slaughter

loans.name: San Miguel De Mayocc Group

texts.en:
Members of the San Miguel D. Mayocc Village Bank live and meet in the community of Mayocc, in Churcampa Province of Huancavelica Department, in central Peru. The town sits on the left bank of the Mantaro River at about 2,300 meters above sea level. The weather in the area is very warm.

Most of the community is involved in commerce or fruit production; the fruit is sold mainly in Huanta. There is also some livestock in the area, including a number of guinea pig farms.

Alberta and Candelaria are two members of the San Miguel D. Mayocc Village Bank. Alberta is married with four children, who are 20, 16, 14 and 10 years old. She raises and sells guinea pigs, a business she has been involved in for the past three years. At first, the business was difficult, since her guinea pigs had fleas, but now the problem is under control, thanks in part to loans from FINCA, which she used to buy medicine. She plans to use her current loan of 200 soles to fix the irrigation system for her alfalfa, which she grows to feed the guinea pigs. Her dreams for the future are for her children to graduate with professional degrees, and to have a large guinea pig farm.

Candelaria is married with five children, who are 25, 23, 20, 18 and 16 years old. She also has a guinea pig farm; she buys young animals and fattens them up to resell. Like Alberta, Candelaria had problems when she first started raising guinea pigs because they got sick and died and she didn’t know how to keep them healthy. She has learned a lot about the animals since then, and they don’t get sick any mO.. She plans to use her loan of 500 soles to buy supplements for her guinea pigs, so that she can fatten them up and sell them in the city of Ayacucho. Like Alberta, Candelaria’s dreams for the future are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to have a large guinea pig farm.

loans.use: Fix irrigation system on farm, buy nutritional supplements for guinea pigs, etc.

loans.name: Maria Barbara

texts.es:
María es una laboriosa mujer de 57 años de edad, está separada desde hace muchos años. Tuvo 4 hijos con su ex-pareja y éstos actualmente tienen 32, 30, 26 y 24 años respectivamente. Los tres hijos mayores son comerciantes, ya se han independizado y han montado sus propios negocios, mientras que la última de sus hijos aún vive con ella y es quien le ayuda en el negocio.
María es propietaria de una despensa muy bien surtida que funciona en su casa propia, también tiene venta de carnes y embutidos de todo tipo.
La ubicación de su negocio es excelente, debido a que se encuentra en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad de Itá.
Ella comenta que desde muy pequeña se dedicó al negocio de las ventas de productos de todo tipo como ser: verduras y frutas que traía junto con su madre del mercado de Abasto de la ciudad capital para luego venderlos casa por casa por los barrios de la ciudad.
Posteriormente, y con mucho sacrificio, logró montar una pequeña despensa en su hogar que con el tiempo fue creciendo y hoy día es la mejor surtida del barrio.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio y convertirlo algún día en un gran supermercado. A la vez desea que dicho negocio quede algún día a cargo de su hija menor.
En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para la compra de más mercaderías como: harina, azúcar, arroz, fideo, yerba, aceite, pan, gasesosas, etc. debido a que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y aumentan considerablemente las ventas.
texts.en:
Mary is an industrious woman, age 57 and separated for many years. She had four children with her ex-partner, and they now are 32, 30, 26 and 24 years old respectively. The three oldest children are merchants, have already become independent, and have started their own businesses while the last of her children still lives with her and is the one who helps in the business. Maria is the owner of a well-stocked store that she runs in her own home. She also sells meats and sausages of all kinds. The location of her business is excellent, because it is in a strategic location in the city of Itá. She says that since she was very little she worked selling products of all kinds such as fruits and vegetables that she brought with her mother from the Abasto market in the capital city to sell house to house in the neighborhoods of her city . Subsequently, and with great sacrifice, she managed to set up a small store at home that eventually grew and today is the best-stocked in the neighborhood. She dreams of expanding her business and one day converting it into a large supermarket. At the same time she hopes that some day her youngest daughter will be in charge of the business. At this time she needs a credit to buy more goods such as flour, sugar, rice, noodles, tea, oil, bread, soft drinks, etc. because the end of the year holiday festivities are approaching and sales increase significantly.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar, rice, noodles, tea, oil, bread, softdrinks, etc.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.en:
The town of La Merced, where members of the "Virgen D. Fatima" Village Bank live and meet, is located in southern Churcampo Province in Huancavelica Department. The area is located at about 2,300 meters above sea level and has a hot, dry climate. The main economic activity is raising livestock, mostly goats and cows. There is little commerce in the area.

Vilma and Teresa are two members of the "Virgen D. Fatima" Village Bank. Vilma is married with five children between the ages of 8 and 23. Vilma buys and sells fruit, and has been working at this since she was 15 years old. She plans to use most of her loan of 400 soles to invest in her business, and the rest will go towards her children’s education. Her goals for the future are for her family to get ahead and for her business to continue to grow. She likes being able to save money with FINCA, and plans to use her savings to help her children and to invest in her business.

Teresa is a widow and has five children between the ages of 19 and 34. She sells "chancaca" (brown sugarloaf maD. from sugarcane), and also buys and sells fruit from time to time. With her loan of 200 soles, Teresa plans to start buying small animals like guinea pigs and goats. She would like for her children to join FINCA too, someday, so that they could start saving money, as she has. She plans to use her savings as an emergency fund in case she has any unexpected needs in the future

loans.use: Pay children's school fees, buy guinea pigs and goats, etc.

loans.name: Meneleo

texts.es:
El Sr. Meneleo de 47 años de edad es comerciante y está casado hace 25 años con la Sra. Celina de 41 años de edad, juntos  tuvieron 5 hijos: Reinaldo de 23 años, Carlos de 22 años, Antolina de 19 años, Pedro de 16 años y Andrea de 7 años de edad. Solamente la hija menor sigue sus estudios, ya que los otros hijos decidieron trabajar dejando sus estudios de lado, todos sus hijos aún viven a cargo suyo. 
Meneleo es agricultor, al igual que su esposa. Se dedican específicamente a la horticultura.
Comenzó su actividad en el año 1990.Sus comienzos fueron muy difíciles, porque necesitaba invertir mucho capital de trabajo, y con muchos hijos lo fue aún más, pero con esfuerzo y dedicación logró salir adelante.
 Con mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de toda su familia pudo salir adelante y hoy en día tiene una gran plantación de verdeos.
 Sus hortalizas son de muy buena calidad y comenta que se debe al riego constante que recibe ya que su negocio cuenta con todo un sistema de riego subterráneo. Sus productos los comercializan en el mercado de abasto de la ciudad capital.
El Sr. Meneleo solicita el préstamo para la compra de abono, semillas, insecticidas y redes de media sombra, que le es de suma urgencia por el intenso calor de este verano, y por el bajo precio con el que comercializa actualmente sus hortalizas, le resulta difícil adquirirlos por el alto costo que implica .
texts.en:
Mr. Meneleo is a 47 year old businessman and has been married for 25 years to Celina who is 41. They have five children together: Reinaldo 23, Carlos 22, Antolina 19, Pedro 16, and Andrea 7 years old. Only the youngest daughter continues her studies because the other children decided to work, leaving their studies aside. All their children still live at home. Meneleo is a farmer, like his wife. They work specifically in horticulture. They started their work in 1990. The beginning was very difficult, because they needed to invest a lot of working capital. With many children it was even harder, but with effort and dedication they managed to get ahead. With much effort and the help of his entire family he was able to move forward and today has a large plantation of greens. His vegetables are very good quality which he says is due to the constant irrigation they receive since the business has a complete underground irrigation system. They sell their products in the fruit and vegetable market of the capital city. Mr. Meneleo requests the loan for the purchase of fertilizer, seeds, insecticides and half shade nets which are of utmost urgency due to the intense heat this summer. Acquiring these items is difficult because of the high cost involved and the low price his vegetables are currently getting in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and half shade nets.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
The Amanecer lending group was founded in January 2008 by 17 very active and mutually supportive women. They enjoy the concept of gaining access to working capital through the formation of social relations, seeing it as an opportunity to unite and stand in solidarity with one another. The group's members dedicate themselves to a variety of businesses. Basilisa, Rosaria, Andrea and Elva sell groceries; María Ángela, María Evergista, Clara, Norma, María Benita and Perla make and sell meals; Susana, Carmen, Benigna and Sofia make and sell clothing; Pabla sells jewelery; and Fermina and Felicita sell cleaning products. The group counts on its members' mutual support and confidence in one another's projects. Although each member is individually responsible for their loan, together the group fosters a strong work ethic. Amanecer's members strongly believe in social inclusion and their community has been greatly strengthened by the growth of their group, improving the quality of life for many small businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva volunteer

El grupo se constituyó en el mes de enero del año 2.008, el comité está integrado por 17 señoras activas y muy solidarias. Ellas valoran la oportunidad de obtener capital social y de trabajo mediante relaciones sociales el cual hace que las mismas sean muy unidas y solidarias. El comité se denomina Amanecer, cada una de ellas se dedican a distintas actividades comerciales como venta de comidas, artículos de limpieza, bijouterie, frutas y verduras, etc. El grupo cuenta con integrantes con una firme base en la solidaridad y confianza para el desarrollo de sus proyectos conjuntos. Las mismas valoran la oportunidad, ya que el programa les permite potenciar emprendimientos individuales y al mismo tiempo generar una relación solidaria entre ellas. Entre las asociadas se fomenta una cultura de trabajo y los pilares de la inclusión social para que el comité funcione en forma excelente. Gracias al programa dentro de la comunidad se generó una reconstrucción de lazos el cual ayudo a mejorar las condiciones de vida de muchas mujeres emprendedoras. Basilisa A. Venta de comestibles María Ángela B. Venta de comidas María Evergista B. Venta de comidas Susana V. Confección de ropas Fermina C. Venta de productos de limpieza Benigna A. Venta de lencería Felicita P. Venta de productos de limpieza Clara B. Venta de comidas Elva A. Venta de frutas y verduras Norma D. Venta de comidas Del Rosaria Otazú Despensa Carmen D. Venta de ropas María Benita B. Venta de comidas Pabla A. Venta de bijouterie Andrea M. Despensa Sofía Espínola Venta de lencería Perla López Venta de comidas

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of: ingredients for food preparation, fruit, vegetables, basic home articles such as milk, bread, sugar, meat, etc., purchase of jewelry-making supplies.

loans.name: Hojalateria Group

texts.es:
El g/s HOJALATERIA viene de la comarca guanacastillo jurisdicción de Nindiri, pertenece a la zona rural del departamento de masaya, la actividad principal del g/s es la elaboración de ropa tales como: chores, pantalones y camisas de niño esta actividad es típica de la zona, la mayoría de pobladores saben este oficio.
Doña Dania es jefe de familia ya que su esposo la abandono con 3 hijos a raíz de ese fracaso ella asumió el negocio costura, el que lo comercializa en el mercado de masaya y en las zonas francas  mas importantes de la ciudad con esto ella pretende mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia
Sus integrantes son del mismo sector de la  comarca y entre todos se apoyan mutuamente tanto en la producción como en la comercialización de sus productos.
Doña Ruth y Doña Petrona  iniciaron su negocio a temprana edad pues es herencia de su padres, en la actualidad los créditos de adim los han invertidos en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos, piensan en un futuro ampliar y poner un taller en la ciudad de Masaya, para lograrlo saben que tiene que manejar bien sus créditos para optar a uno más grande y poder cumplir su sueños, y  ser siempre una buena clienta de ADIM
texts.en:
The Hojalateria lending group is from Guanacastillo, in the Nindiri region, a rural area of the Masaya district. The group works mostly with clothing, making shorts, pants, children's shirts etc. The region is known for it's tailoring and the majority of its population knows the trade. Doña Dania began making clothes when her husband left her with three children. She overcame her loss and has been selling her clothes in the markets of Masaya and the surrounding region in order to improve her family's quality of life. Doña Ruth and Doña Petrona began making clothing at an early age, inheriting the business from their parents. They have, so far, invested the loans they have received from ADIM into the purchase of raw materials for their clothing. In the future, they hope to expand their business and open a shop in Masaya. In order to achieve this dream, they know that they have to manage their loan repayment well so that they become eligible for a larger one. The group's members are from the same neighborhood and they support one another's work, helping each other out both with the production and the marketing of their clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Miurel Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Miurel del Rosario C. tiene la edad de 21 años, habita en el barrio Piedra Menuda, ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposo e hijo de tres años, los planes de doña Miurel para su familia son darle una mejor condición de vida. Ella trabaja como domestica en una casa privada desde hace dos años, es un trabajo agotador pero tiene que salir adelante con su familia, ya que todo esta bien caro,  ella solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para poder comprar materiales de construcción y así poder mejorar su vivienda, ya tiene comprado parte de los materiales como los bloques y espera comprar piedra, arena, cemento, hierro entre otros, para poder gozar de un techo digno con su familia.
texts.en:
Miurel del Rosario C. is 21 years old, living in the Piedra Menuda (Tiny Rock) neighborhood in the city of Masaya. She lives with her husband and son. She and her husband care for the little boy of three years. Miurel's plan for her family is to give her son better living conditions. She has worked as a maid in a private home for two years. It's an exhausting job, but she wants her family to do well, and everything is expensive. She is asking for Kiva partner Afodenic's help so she can buy construction materials and fix up her home. She has already bought some of the materials, such as the bricks, and she hopes to buy rocks, sand, cement, iron, etc., so she and her family can enjoy a proper roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to fix up the home

loans.name: El Mamon Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del g/s EL MAMON viven en la comarca buena vista  en la zona rural de Nindiri,   a pesar de ser humilde y de escasos recursos este grupo ha salido adelante por ser personas bien emprendedoras y luchadoras sus negocios son ambulantes en los barrios de Masaya y Nindiri 
Doña María vende ropa usada ella comenzó comprando ropa por unidad, con los créditos que adim les ha proporcionados ahora compra por pacas las que le generan mayores ganancias.
Doña Linda vende productos plásticos del hogar ella compra en el mercado oriental por docenas y los coloca en las pulperías y barrios de nindiri.   Sus mayores sueños es poder remodelar su casa ella lo va a lograr ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y de adim atreves de los créditos
Este g/s ha sido capacitado por desarrollo empresarial en los temas de autoestima y manejo del negocio, para lo cual se siente bien agradecidas con adim, y prometen no quedar mal para gozar de sus beneficios.
texts.en:
The members of the group El Mamon ** live in the Buena Vista region in the rural area of Nindiri. Despite being of humble and limited resources, this group has succeeded by being hardworking and enterprising people with their traveling businesses in the Masaya and Nindiri neighborhoods. Mrs. Maria sells used clothing. She began by buying clothing by the piece; with loans from Kiva partner ADIM, she now buys packages of clothing, which generates better profits. Mrs. Linda sells plastic products for the home, which she buys by the dozen at the oriental market and sells in the local stores in the Nindiri neighborhoods. Her greatest dream is to be able to remodel her home. She is going to do this with the help of her husband and Kiva partner ADIM's loans. This group is headed for success in their businesses because of their self-esteem and business management. They are very grateful to Kiva partner ADIM, and they promise they will not do badly so that they can enjoy the benefits. ** Translator's note: Mamon is a type of green fruit known to Nicaragua. It looks something like a lime.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses to serve more customers

loans.name: Lupita Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del g/s  LUPITA viven en el barrio los altos de Nindiri sobre la carretera tipitapa, Managua este grupo tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a escuelas de  primaria lo que les permite ser unas  personas bien comunicativas y accesibles en la sociedad. Iniciaron sus negocios ambulantes, comprando los productos en el mercado oriental de Managua y vendiendo de casa en casa en los barrio aledaños a su domicilio
 Rebeca es una señora que valora mucho y dice sentirse agradecida con adim por que además del crédito, las capacita para que ellas puedan salir adelante. Siente que el aprendizaje mas importante que ha obtenido al trabajar con ADIM ha sido reconocer cuanto vale ella como mujer honrada y trabajadora. 
Sus créditos lo utilizan en la compra de productos por mayor  para ofertar y obtener precios más bajos y poder aumentar sus ganancias.
Ellas  esperan poder participar en las capacitaciones de desarrollo empresarial. Quiere además seguir siendo cumplida en sus pagos como hasta ahora lo ha sido, para poder obtener mayores beneficios
texts.en:
The members of the group Lupita live in the Los Altos (the Heights) neighborhood of Nindiri on Tipitapa Road in Managua. This group had the opportunity to attend elementary school, so they communicate well and are approachable in society. They started their own traveling businesses, purchasing items in Managua's oriental market and selling them by going house to house in nearby neighborhoods. Rebeca is a wonderful woman and she says she is grateful to Kiva partner ADIM for not only the loan, but also the ability to improve. She feels that the learning experience that she has gotten by working with ADIM has allowed her to realize how valuable a honorable and hardworking woman is. The women use their loans to buy items wholesale for lower prices and increase their profits. They hope to participate in training workshops to improve their businesses. They also want to stay current on their loan payments, as they have done until now, to continue to receive benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items wholesale to offer better variety

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in her business of selling clothes and shoes

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Pablo tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, en la capital de Managua estado civil soltero, sus hijos son independientes. Sus planes para el futuro es terminar la construcción de su casa y comprar otro vehículo para trabajarlo. Don Pablo se desempeña en su pequeño negocio de perecedero como chiltoma, tomate, ayote entre otras verduras  y además es proveedor de una empresa privada desde hace quince años tiene su negocio, lo inicio con préstamos de micro financieras. Sus objetivos a corto plazo para su negocio es la expansión a nuevos canales de comercialización de su producto. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic lograr la comprar de producto para ampliarle y extenderse a otros mercados.
texts.en:
Pablo is 50 years old, living in the North Laureles neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is single; his sons are grown. His plans for the future are to finish building his house and buy another vehicle for work. Pablo has a small business of selling perishable goods such as sweet peppers, tomatoes, ayote and other vegetables. He is also a supplier for a private company. He has had his business for 15 years, which he started with microfinance loans. His short-term goal for his business is to market his products to new audiences. Thanks to the loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, he will be able to buy products to expand his business and reach out to other markets.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables and other products to expand the business

loans.name: Maria Clemencia

texts.es:
Maria Clemencia empezó su negocio desde cuando ella tenia 12 años de edad con una pequeña tortillería, debido a que su madre se encontraba enferma, ella se hizo cargo de este negocio. Años después una prima le platico que porque mejor invirtiera su dinero en la venta de carne de marranos porque eso le dejaría mas ganancias que una tortillería.  Ella decidió invertir en los marranos, pero siempre siguió con su tortillería, con el tiempo   aprendió a cocinar los marranos y hacer chicharrones y carne,  inicio con un marrano a la semana, y poco a poco ha ido creciendo.  Ahora quiere dedicarse a criar los marranos, ya que esto tendría más ganancias.  Con el tiempo decidió cerrar su tortillería.
Ahora vende porciones completas de chicharrones, y carne de marrano.  También decidió iniciar con una pequeña tienda  en su casa  para poder generar más ingresos.  Ella necesita el préstamo para surtir mejor la tienda con azúcar, aceite, jabón, y otros artículos de primera necesidad que la gente solicita. Así como también tiene algunas otras ventas  como lo es carbón para cocinar, venta de comida, venta de manteca. 
Maria Clemencia tiene varios negocios que le ayudan a mantener a sus hijos, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 son pequeños y están estudiando.  Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, pero no siempre tiene ingresos fijos.
texts.en:
Maria Clemencia started her business when she was 12 years old with a small tortilla stand. because her mother was ill, she took over this business. Years later, her cousin talked to her about investing her money in the sale of pig meat because that would leave her with more profits than a tortillería. She decided to invest in pigs, but always continued with her tortillería. Eventually, she learned to cook the pigs and make chicarrones (fried pork skin dish) and pork. She began with a pig a week, and little by little has grown. Now she wants to raise pigs to earn more profits. Over time, she decided to close her tortillería. Now sells chicharrones dishes and pork. She also decided to open a small store in her home to generate more revenue. She needs a loan to stock her store with sugar, oil, soap and other necessities that people request. She also sell other items such as coal for cooking, meals, and lard. Maria Clemencia has several businesses that help support her children. She has six children, three of whom are small and in school. Her husband is a mason, but he does not always have a regular income.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in food sales.

loans.name: Rosa Blanca Group

texts.es:
El g/s ROSA BLANCA  son del domicilio de Campuzano comarca de Nindiri este barrio queda a 2 km de la sucursal, sus integrantes son de origen campesino, por tal motivo son tímidas y de poco hablar, se siente satisfecha de trabajar con adim ya que además del crédito las ha capacitado en la administración de su negocios y  se han dado cuenta  lo útil que son para la sociedad.
Doña Maria empezó con un capital menor de C$1,000.00, con los créditos de adim ella los ha invertido en capital de trabajo y este ha crecido, lo que le ha generado mas ganancias, en la actualidad manejan montos mayores a C$3,100.00
Doña Mercedes tiene negocio de destace de cerdo ella destaza 2 veces a la semana, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos en la comercialización de productos,  su  familia es pequeña.  Piensa en un futuro tener su propia crianza de cerdos para obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, sabe que lo va a lograr con la ayuda de adim en cuanto a mantener su crédito.
texts.en:
The g/s ROSA BLANCA (White Rose) is from the Campuzano region of Nindiri. This neighborhood is 2 km from the office. Its members are peasants and therefore are shy and speak very little. They are happy to work with ADIM since, in addition to loans, ADIM has given them skills to manage their businesses and they now realize that they are useful to society.

Doña Maria began with less than C$1,000.00 in capital. With loans from ADIM, she has invested in working capital and this has grown, which has generated more profits. She now manages amounts over C$3,100.00.

Doña Mercedes slaughters pigs twice a week and counts on the help of her husband and children to sell her products. Her family is small. She thinks of raising pigs in the future to earn greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. She knows that she is going to achieve this with the help of ADIM to maintain her loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario LAS DIVINAS esta compuesta por 5 miembros ellas pertenecen al barrio buena vista  de la comunidad de Nindiri además de ser vecinas ellas son amigas y siempre han trabajado juntas, unas a las otras se ayudan en la comercialización de sus productos.
Doña Jessica es la coordinadora  ella elabora tortillas todos los días en dos turnos por la mañana y por la tarde, es madre soltera de 3 hijos los que le ayudan en la elaboración de productos 
Este grupo nace de la necesidad de hacer crecer sus negocios para obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su nivel de vida, ellas se sienten agradecida  tanto de los créditos como de las capacitaciones que ha recibido a lo largo de dos años, en los que ha visto crecer y florecer su negocio. Sus mayores sueños es tener una tortillería en su casa para trabajar todo el día. Producir lo suficiente para que sus hijos  vivan en  buenas condiciones. 
Están mas que  clara que para lograr su sueño necesita ser puntual con sus créditos con ADIM.
texts.en:
The group The Divine is comprised of five members who live in the Buena Vista neighborhood of the Nindiri community. They are both neighbors and friends, and they have always worked together and helped each other sell their products. Jessica is the coordinator; she makes tortillas every day in two shifts - the morning and the afternon. She is a single mother of three children who help her bake her products. This group was born out of the necessity to grow their businesses through loans to improve their lives. The women are grateful for both the loans as well as the training they have received over the past two years, through which they have seen their businesses grow and flourish. Jessica's greatest dream is to have a tortilla shop in her home so she can work all day and earn enough so that her children can have good living conditions. These women are more than clear on the fact that in order to realize their dreams, they need to make their loan payments in time to Kiva partner ADIM.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow the businesses and earn more profits

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El g/s  SAN FRANCISCO están en su decimo ciclo son de la comunidad de san francisco de campusano, comunidad de Nindiri  son personas humildes pero emprendedoras, tienen la primaria aprobada y eso les permites ser bien expresivas y han logrado salir adelante porque ellas han perdido la timidez, y eso se lo deben a adim que las ha capacitado. Sus créditos los han invertidos en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pan el cual después lo ofertan en pulperías por docenas
Con el crédito de adim han tenido la oportunidad de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, ya que con las ganancias además de invertir en sus negocios también han realizado mejoras en sus hogares. Doña Carolina es madre soltera ella vende cosméticos por encargo  y no cuenta con ningún tipo de apoyo del padre de sus hijos considera que gracias a ADIM ha podido enfrentar la vida y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y le ha permitido a sus hijos asistir a la escuela.
texts.en:
The group San Francisco is in its 10th cycle. The members are of the Saint Francisco of Campusano community in Nindiri. They are humble people but enterprising; they have the primary approval (for their loan) and that has let them be more expressive and more successful because they have lost their shyness. They owe this to Kiva partner ADIM, who has helped them. Their loans have been invested in the purchase of ingredients for baking bread, which is later sold by the dozen in stores. With the loans from ADIM, they have had the opportunity to improve the lives of their families. They have both invested their profits in their businesses as well as used them to fix up their homes. Carolina is a single mother. She sells cosmetics by order ** and has not had any sort of help from her children's father. Thanks to ADIM, she has been able to face life and take care of her family's basic necessities, and her children have been able to attend school. ** Translator's note: There was not a clear English translation for "vender cosmeticos por encargo," but it sounds like this is a Mary Kay-type of business, with customers ordering the makeup through a catalog that Carolina shows them.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products for their businesses as well as other operating expenses

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en: Christine K. is a member of the Kuteesa group in Luleeka. She is married with 8 children and cares for 2 other dependents. Two  so far have completed school.  She is proud that through Pearl she has been able to finance her smoked fish business which she sells to people mostly of Koba and Nabutiri as well as to pay the school fees for her children.  She has done this business for over ten years. Because of the fluctuating prices of fish, four months ago Christine diversified and opened a charcoal selling business.  She also grows tomatoes for sale. In the future, she dreams of buying charcoal in bulk and supplying  Lugazi  where prices are higher.  She attributes her success to the quality of her fish, her reasonable pricing and the availability of charcoal at all times.

loans.use: More fish for sale, and more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Marbelly

texts.es: La Sra. Marbelly, de 42 años de edad, es casada, con 3 hijos, uno de 25 años quien ya trabaja y 2 niñas estudiando la primaria, trbaja para Plan Nicaragua desde hace 3 años como asesora tecnica sobre los derechos de la niñez y la adolescencia, su esposo es abogado y le ayuda con sus hijas. Está solicitando su 3er credito el que utilizara para compra de 3 puertas y la elaboracion de un closes, tambien pintara la caa si el dinero le ajusta, esta empezando a invertir en la casa porque hasta hace unos meses el esposo dio escritura a nombre de las niñas y ella como albacea y es hasta ahora que ella hara las mejoras a la vivienda porque esta segura que la inversion que haga no sera en vano, pues las beneficiadas serán sus hijas, sin el temos que un dia las saquen de la casa como ha sucedido en muchos casos.  una vez que cancele este credito solicitara otros hasta dar las condiciones deseadas a su casa, porque en el futuro sera de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marbelly is a 42-year-old married mother of three children: her oldest is 25 years old and employed, and she has two daughters in primary school. She has worked at Plan Nicaragua for three years as a technical assessor for children's and adolescents' rights. Her husband is a lawyer and helps support the girls. This is her third loan request, which she'll use to make home improvements and buy three doors, build a closet, and paint the house if there is money leftover. She is beginning the house improvements because a few months ago her husband placed the house in the girls' names and named Mrs. Marbelly as executrix. She is ensuring her daughters will benefit from the house and not be evicted as has happened in other cases. Once she has paid off this loan, she'll request future loans in order to continue the house improvements until completed, as the house will be for her daughters in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three doors and build a closet

loans.name: Karen Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sr. Karen tiene 24 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Laureles Norte, casada,  su esposo trabaja como operario en una empresa, tiene dos preciosos hijos de 6 meses y 4 años de edad, los planes para su familia es mejorar el nivel de vida ofreciéndole a sus hijos un futuro diferente.
Doña Karen posee su pequeño negocio de comida desde hace dos años lo inicio con fondos propios y ahora ya esta estable en el campo de comercialización. Sus objetivos en el ámbito económico es incrementar sus ventas, aumentar el local generando mayores ganancias para el benefició del hogar. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar materia prima, para seguir ofertando sus ricos platos y variados de comida, también  podrá comprar utensilios y otras inversiones que crearan mayores fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Karen is 24 years old and married, and her husband works as an operator. They live in a neighborhood known as Laureles Norte and have two beautiful children, a 6 month old and a 4 year old. The couple hopes to improve their quality of life so that they can offer their children a brighter future. Two years ago, and with her own savings, Karen began a small business selling meals. Now she has a stable shop at a commercial center, but would love to see her business grow. Her goals are to increase her sales and to expand her shop, so that she can bring more money home for her family. With Afodenic's help, she will buy the raw ingredients for her delicious meals, so that she can continue to offer a varied menu. She will also buy some utensils and invest the money in ways that will help her expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for meals

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es: Maria del Pilar, casada, de 41 años de edad, con 1 hija estudiante universitaria, su esposo es mecanico y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ella trabajaba en la Universidad Agraria, pero se cambio a la Coca-Cola debido a que salario es un poco mejor. Esta solicitando su 2do credito y lo utilizara para construir un anexo que sera destinado para un cuarto, esto lo hace porque quiere darle privacidad a su hija que aunque estudia en Leon cuando esté de vacaciones quiere que se sienta con mucha comodiad e independencia.  Maria del Pilar solamente ha trabajado un credito con AFODENIC, el cual lo pago con 3 meses de anticipacion debido al cambio de trabajo, sin embargo ahora solicita un nuevo credito porque se considera con estabilidad laboral y un mejor salario.
texts.en:
Maria del Pilar is married, 41 years old, and has one daughter who is studying at university. Maria's husband is a mechanic and she helps him with household costs. She worked in the Agraria University, but she switched to Coca-Cola because the salary was a little better. She is requesting her second loan and will use it to construct an addition to her home that will be a bedroom. She wants to do this because it will give privacy to her daughter, who, despite attending university in Leon, lives at home during vacations and will make her feel more comfortable and independent. Maria del Pilar has only requested one loan with AFODENIC, which she repaid three months early upon changing jobs. Nevertheless, she is now requesting a new loan because she has more stable employment and a better salary.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Fred's Group

texts.en: Fred S. is the leader of Kutesa Group 2. He is married with 5 children, ages 8 to 20 years. He is also caring for 4 other dependents.  Fred has been in the group for 8 years. He runs two retail shops in Kasanga and Koba, and also grows green vegetables like nakati, dodo, cabbages etc which he takes to Kampala to the large market for sale.  However, with plantains, his biggest challenge is the high and ever increasing transport costs which sometimes cause delays in delivery of his products to Kampala. Since these are perishables, with the use of loans he reduces  costs  and the excess costs are covered in pricing.  Fred has a future plan of one day acquiring his own truck as well as opening up a wholesale shop/ outlet in Lugazi Town Council.  Fred needs a loan to finance his shops amd for buying more quality seeds for planting more vegetables.

loans.use: Restocking his 2 retail shops and to buy quality seeds.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo A. Gaitán tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa particular, para poder apoyarle con los gastos del hogar; ellos tienen a su cargo una hija la cual estudia su primaria, los planes para su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la casa para brindarle mayor seguridad a su hogar ya que él por falta de financiamiento todavía no a terminado de construir. Este señor trabaja como técnico en servicios de gasolinera desde hace siete años, con la solicitud de préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado y otras pequeñas reparaciones, para no mojarse en el invierno, con este préstamo será de gran beneficio lo cual lograra darles una vivienda digna y con seguridad a su familia
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo A. Gaitán is 35 years old and lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife who works as a maid in a private residence to help with the household expenses. They have a little girl in primary school. His plans for his family include improving their house to provide a secure home environment, but he is lacking funds to complete the construction. Mr. Gaitán has worked as a services technician at a gas station for seven years. With this loan he will buy construction materials to build a new roof for his house, because the current one is in bad shape, and for other small repairs, in order to stay dry through the winter. The loan will help him greatly by allowing him to provide a dignified and secure home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a new roof

loans.name: Filida's Group

texts.en:
M. Filida is 48 years old. She is married, with 6 children between 20 and 30 years of age. She also has 9 dependents, including one adopted child who is 6 years old.

Filida is a fish monger on Lake Victoria. She sells her fish at Mpunge–Buleebi Kachanga. Thanks to previous loans, she also has 12 cows and sells 40 litres of milk per week for additional income. Her specific purpose for this loan is to buy more fish nets to meet the demands in both the local and foreign markets, and to buy more cows to provide milk to sell. Filida is a member of Tumwesige women’s group in Lugazi.

loans.use: More fish nets for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Elena, casa, de 37 años de edad, con un hijo de 13 años estudiando la secundaria, su esposo trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.  Maria Elena es una persona responsable, buena madre y desea darle un hogar digno y propio a su hijo, ya que ella en estos momentos alquila y quiere salir de esa situacion pues en el cuarto que habita no puede realizar ninguna mejora porque no es de ella, con los creditos anteriores compro un terreno y parte de los materiales de construccion, con este 3er credito quiere levantar paredes y poner techo; plantea que en un futuro cuando haya cancelado este credito continuara con otros hasta lograr la construccion completa de su propia vivienda que han sido los sueños de toda su vida para que su hijo tenga estabilidad y no estar de un lugar a otro, porque los dueños de las casas donde habita actualmente le pueden pedir en cualquier momento desaloje el cuarto.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 37 years old, she is married and has a 13 year old son who is in high school. Her husband works and helps her with the household expenses. Maria Elena is a responsible person, she is a good mother and wants to giver her son a worthy and proper home. She currently rents and wants to get out of this situation since she cannot make improvements to the room that she lives in as it does not belong to her. With the previous loans that she received she bought a plot of land and a portion of the construction materials. With this third loan she wants to erect walls and build a roof. She plans that in the future, when she has paid this loan, she will continue with others until the construction of her own home is complete. It has been her life long dream that her son have stability and not move from place to place because the owners of the homes where she currently lives can ask her to leave at any time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Erect walls and build a roof for her home currently under construction.

loans.name: Madinah's Group

texts.en:
Madinah Z. is a member of Tumwesige Group in Mpunge. She is a hard-working lady with a retail shop that she has owned for a long time now. She is even having a hard time counting the many times she has had loans from Pearl Micro-finance but what she can never forget are the many achievements she has attained out of her association with other members by getting loans.

On top of her retail shop that has over time increased the quantity and quality of goods such as sugar, bread, and eggs that she sells, she has also been able to get 5 cows plus another plot of land in addition to where she is staying right now with her husband and children.

Madinah needs another loan to restock her shop with more goods for increased profits, the balance of which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchasing more goods for her shop

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty M. is one of the executive members of Tumwesige Group in Mpunge. She is a businesswoman involved in selling matooke (green bananas) both from her farm as well as those bought from truck owners since she finds that she does not always have enough for sell to her customers. She sells in the town centre where the market for her produce is readily available and because of the way she handles her customers, many come to her, so she is able to sell a lot in a short while, meaning making more profits.

Betty is grateful for her previous loans because they helped her buy more "matooke" for re-sale. She is requesting this loan to boost her "matooke"-selling business further.

loans.use: buying more "matooke" to boost her business

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Martha del Socorro P. Méndez tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta Señora tiene 3 hijos sus edades son de 30 su hija mayor, su otra hija de 24 años y 20 años de edad, ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella, sus propósitos son de aumentar su negocio ya que le interesa tener una variedad de productos que pueda ofrecer a los diferentes gustos que el cliente pida, sus deseos son de tener una tienda donde pueda vender mejor su mercadería para seguirle proporcionando a su familia ingresos ya que estos le proporcionan ayuda.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa en la que vende los productos como: ropa interior, camisetas y camisolas, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, ella inicia este negocio vendiendo unos pocos productos y al ver que tuvo aceptación con su negocio decide realizar la inversión de mas producto y se traslada a los departamentos de telica y Chinandega, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos por lo que viaja hasta honduras y el oriental que es mas favorable para ella.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro P. M. is 52 years old and is single. She has three children - her oldest daughter is 30 and her younger daughters are 24 and 20. None of her children depend on her. Her goal is to expand her business since she is interested in having a variety of products that she can offer to her clients' different tastes. Her wish is to have a a store where she can better sell her merchandise so that she can keep providing income for her family as they also provide her with help. The economic activity that she dedicates herself to is the sale of clothing. She sells products such as underwear, shirts and camisoles which she sells as a traveling salesperson. She has had her business for 10 years. She started her business selling a few products and once she saw that her business was accepted she decided to invest in more products and she moved to the departments of Telica and Chinandega. She will use this loan as working capital to purchase products for which she travels to Honduras and east as the prices are more favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to invest in the purchase of merchandise for clothing sales.

loans.name: Leyla Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Leyla Evangelina López tiene la edad de 56 años, su estado civil es viuda Doña Leyla tiene 6 hijos de los cuales ninguno de sus hijos dependen de ella ya que todos trabajan por cuenta propia, sus deseos son mantener su negocio activo por lo que todavía necesita mantener a su Mama que todavía esta a su cargo, sus propósitos son de superar la calidad de su producto para lograr obtener la afluencia de clientes y así proporcionar mas ingresos para ella y para su familia que ocupan su mayor prioridad como también lo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que puedan vivir mejor en un futuro.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica el de destace de cerdo y el la elaboración de nacatamales y de frito, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 23 años, ella inicia este negocio  por la necesidad de trabajar ya que ella tenia el oficio de costurera y por la poca afluencia de clientes decide establecer el negocio de la venta de nacatamales y la elaboración y mas tarde decide quedarse con este negocio y empieza con la compra de un cerdo y al tener afluencia de clientes decide invertir mas en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital e trabajo destinado para la compra de  mas productos como: Maíz, leña y los diferentes ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los nacatamales.
texts.en:
Leyla Evangelina L. is 56 years old and is widowed. She has 6 children none of whom depend on her as they all work. Her wish is to keep her business active as she needs to support her mother who is still in her charge. Her intention is to increase the quality of her product so that she can obtain an influx of clients and thus provide more income for herself and for her family who are her biggest priority. She also wants to provide for improvements to her home so that they can liver better in the future. The economic activity that she dedicates herself to is butchering pork and making "nacatamales" (traditional Nicaraguan food). She has had her business for 23 years. She started this business because she needed to work as she could no longer work as a seamstress because there were few clients. She decided to establish her business selling and making nacatamales and later decided to keep this business and started buying pork. With the influx of clients she decided to invest more in her business. This loan will be used to purchase more products such as corn, wood and the different ingredients used to make nacatamales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as corn, wood and the different ingredients used to make nacatamales.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yesenia Benita

texts.es:
La Joven Yesenia Benita Hernández tiene la edad de 27 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Yesenia tiene 3 hijos de los cuales tienen las siguientes edades una niña de 9 años que cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su otra hija de 8 años cursa el 3 grado de primaria y su hijo de 2 años de edad no estudia, su compañero de vida labora en la reparación de bicicletas, sus sueños son independizarse del trabajo que tiene actualmente para trabajar mas cómodamente en lo que seria su negocio ya que ella trabaja en ARNECOM, sus propósitos son mantener su negocio activo para que este pueda ofrecerle a sus hijas un futuro para los estudios.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa como: pantalones, camisas, ropa para niños y ropa interior, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 7 años, sus inicios se dan por otro tipo de negocio como lo fue la venta de sandalias y no obtuvo la mejor respuesta de parte de los clientes y mas tarde decide invertir en la venta de ropa o otros por lo que en este recibe las afluencias de sus clientes y así decide seguir manteniendo este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de su productos como lo es la mudadas para niños y pantalones ya que piensa que con esta temporada festiva ofrecerá mas productos variados a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yesenia Benita is 27 years old and has a partner. She has three children. A 9 year old daughter who is in 5th grade, an 8 year old daughter who is in 3rd grade and a 2 year old son. Her life partner works as a bicycle repairman. Her dream is to be independent of the job she currently has in order to more comfortably work in her business as she currently works at ARNECOM. Her purpose is to keep her business active so that she can provide her daughters with an education in their future. The economic activity that she dedicates herself to is the sale of clothing such as pants, shirts, children's clothes and underwear. She has her business as a traveling salesperson and has had this business for 7 years. Yesenia started her business selling other products such as sandals but did not obtain the best response from clients. She later decided to invest in the sale of clothing and other products and she has an influx of clients and decided to keep the business. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital which she needs to purchase products such as clothing for children and pants since she thinks that during this festive season she will offer a greater variety of products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase products such as children's clothing and pants.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La Señora Dorotea Gómez tiene la edad de 60 años su estado civil es soltera, Doña Dorotea tiene 5 hijos de los cuales ninguno de sus hijos dependen de ella, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo para lograr sus objetivos ya que necesita salir adelante con su negocio por lo que este le permitió sacar a sus hijos adelante para que estos fueran hombres y mujeres de provecho, su deseo es proporcionarle  a su vivienda las comodidades necesarias ya que quiere remodelarla completamente para que el día de mañana pueda permanecer en ella para su vejes y no tenga que estar en dependencia de sus hijos.


Su actividad económica es la venta de comida como lo es: arroz, frijoles, maduro, queso frito, queso, plátanos y papas, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 20 años la ubicación es la siguiente de la iglesia católica 2 cuadras al sur, ella comienza este negocio por cuenta propia y empieza a realizar prestamos con Fundación León 2000 y decide establecer un negocio en su casa de habitación y realizaba viajes hasta Matagalpa para la compra de queso, leche pero no pudo mantener este negocio y por eso que mas tarde decide implementar el negocio de venta de comida y así obtiene este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajosa que tiene que realizar las respectivas compras para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en:
Dorotea Gomex is 60 years old and is single. She has 5 children none of whom depend on her. Her intention is to keep her business active in order to accomplish her objectives as she needs to be successful with her business. Her business allowed her to get her children ahead so that they could be useful men and women. Her wish is to provide her home with the necessary comforts. She wants completely remodel it so that in the future she can remain in it through her old age and not have to depend on her children. Dorotea's economic activity is the sale of food such as rice, beans, fried cheese, cheese, bananas and potatoes. She has had her business for 20 years and it was located next to the catholic church. She started her business on her own and started receiving loans from Fundacion Leon 2000 and then decided to establish the business in her home. She had to travel to Matagalpa to buy cheese and milk but she was not able to maintain this business which is why she later decided to establish her current business selling food. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase the respective products she needs to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase products to make her food.

loans.name: Francisco Fernando

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco tiene 53 años de edad, habita en un  barrio de la capital de Managua llamado Memorial Sandino, estado civil casado tiene un hijo de 20 años de edad, los planes para con su familia es terminar de construir su casa ya que le falta poner puertas segura, repellar la pared y embaldosar ya que su piso es de tierra  para que su familia este en mejores condiciones. Don Francisco se desempeña como taxista desde hace diez años que brinda el servicio de trasporte a los diferentes clientes de esta capital. Inicio el negocio con un crédito para comprar su unidad de taxi así adquirió así compro su carro. Sus objetivos en el ámbito empresarial es crecer. Para poder tener recurso para seguir trabajando y poder cumplir la meta de ver a su familia en una casa con seguridad y digna es por  eso que da Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic.  A largo plazo es comprar otra unidad para obtener mejores beneficios
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco is 53 years old and live in a neighborhood in the capital city of Managua called Memorial Sandino. He is married and has a son who is 20 years old. His plans for his family are to finish construction of his home since they lack secure doors, repair the wall, and tile the floor since it is currently exposed dirt, so that his family may live in better conditions. Francisco has been employed as a taxi driver for 10 years through which he provides transportation services to various clients of the capitol. He began the business with a loan to purchase a taxi unit and was able to do so. His goal in business terms is growth. The ability to have the resources necessary to continue working and be able to accomplish his goals to see his family in safe and dignified house is thanks to the loans of Afodenic. Over the long term he hopes to purchase another taxi and obtain higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the necessary materials to finish construction on his home.

loans.name: Rodolfo De Jesus

texts.es:
El Sr. Rodolfo tiene 46 años de edad, habita en un   barrio  que se llama Memorial Sandino, en la capital de Managua,  estado civil casado, su esposa es auxiliar de laboratorio, tiene dos hijas de 13 y 16 años de edad ambos estudian. Los planes para su familia es brindarle un patrimonio a sus hijas, seguridad y protección. Don  Rodolfo se desempeña como guardia de seguridad desde hace ocho años que brinda seguridad a otras personas. Sus planes en el ámbito laboral es cambiar de trabajo con mayores ingresos. Ya que gana un salario mínimo y aparte que es un trabajo desgastante, y así. Con esta solicitud va comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su casa. A largo plazo es poder tener una casa digna para su familia.
Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr compra materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro y bloque terminar de construir su casa y ofrecerle el patrimonio, la seguridad y protección a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Rodolfo is 46 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in Managua. He is married, his wife is a laboratory assistant, and has two daughter who are 13 and 16 years of age. Both of his children are in school. His plan for his family is to provide legacy, security, and protection for his daughters. Rodolfo has been employed as a security guard for 8 years and provides security services for other people. He plans to switch jobs for higher income, since he earns a minimal salary and the work is not enjoyable. With this loan he is going to purchase construction materials to finish work on his home. Over the long term he will be able to have a dignified home for his family. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic he has been able to buy construction materials like: cement, iron and blocks, to finish construction on his home and offer the legacy, security, and protection to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the necessary materials to finish construction on his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Business Capital; To be able to Grow her business; and Offer more Products.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Sandra tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Esperanza de la capital de Managua, casada, tiene un nieto de 8 años y una hija de 21 años. Los planes para con su familia es construir parte de su casa, mejorar su nivel de vida y ofrecerle un porvenir mejor Doña Sandra se desempeña como domestica desde hace diecisiete años tiene un negocio de cosméticos y vende también cosméticos desde hace siete años para obtener otros ingresos, que inicio con fondos propios Sus planes en el ámbito empresarial es aumentar sus ingresos con la innovación de nuevos Producto en la comercialización de Cosméticos, platería.
Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic logrará comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, ladrillo y bloque, para terminar de hacer su casa Así  también le ofrecerá seguridad y protección a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 51 years old and lives in the Esperanza neighborhood in Managua. She is married and has a grandson of 8 years and a 21 year old daughter. The plans for her family are to repair part of their home, improve their quality of life and offer them a better livelihood. Sandra works from home where she has run a cosmetics business for 16 years. She also has also sold cosmetics for 7 years to obtain additional income, which she began with her own funds. For her business, she plans to increase her income with the innovation of new products in the commercialization of cosmetics and jewelry. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic she has been able to purchase construction materials such as: cement, iron, brick, and cinder block, so that she can finish repairing her home. With their help, she has also been able to provide security and protection to those that she loves.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the necessary materials to finish construction on his home.

loans.name: Nenas Group

texts.es:
El  g/s NENAS está conformado por 3 integrantes 2 mujeres y un varón que viven en la zona rural de la comarca el raizon de la ciudad de Nindiri. Ellos han iniciado su negocio con capital pequeño  solicitaron su primer crédito con ADIM y se dieron cuenta de los beneficios que se obtienen cuando invierten bien en su negocio y pagan a tiempo su crédito.
Doña  Reyna es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella nos cuenta que su g/s tiene éxito por la buena comunicación y solidaridad de sus integrantes  piensan seguir trabajando y ampliando cada vez más  productos. Son beneficiadas de un segundo  ciclo de crédito y se siente orgullosa de no haber quedado mal con ADIM 
El g/s ha recibido capacitaciones  en economía y administración del negocio. Su mayor aprendizaje ha sido que para progresar es necesario ahorrar, pues así se queda bien, se pude tener un nuevo crédito y progresar.
texts.en:
The group, NENAS, includes 3 members: 2 woman and one man who live in the rural area, Comarca el Raizon, of the city of NIndiri. They have started their business with a little capital they solicited as their first loan from ADIM. They realized the benefits they could obtain when they invest well in their business and pay back their loans on time. Reyna is the coordinator of the group. She tells us that their group is successful because of great communication and solidarity of their members who always think about continuing to work and constantly improving their products. They have benefited from a second cycle of loans and feel proud of not having become delinquent with ADIM. The group has received administrative and financial training from ADIM. Their greatest lesson has been that to succeed it is necessary to save; in order to follow this rule, they must have a new loan and progress.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Capital; Invest in their different businesses; Sales of Plants, CDs, and pewters.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: El Señor U. es soltero, de 42 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, 1 varon fuera del pais y una niña de 4 años, su compañera tambien trabaja para el sector salud, esta solicitando su 9no credito el que utilizara para construir aproximadamente 7 mts de acera; los creditos anteriores tambien los ha utilizado para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, la cual esta en buenas condiciones, el trabaja en el centro de salud "Adan Barillas", con 22 años de servicio, manifiesta que AFODENIC es una de las financieras que tiene sus politicas mas flexibles, por esa razon continua con la institucion, pero en esta ocasion bajó el monto, ya que la situacion esta muy dificil y no quiere quedar mal.
texts.en:
Mr. U. is single, 42 years old, and has two children, one son lives outside the country and a little girl who is 4 years old. HIs partner works for the health department. He is requesting his 9th loan the he will use to construct approximately seven meters of walkway. His previous loans have been used for improving his home, which is now in good condition. He has worked in the "Adan Barillas" health center for 22 years and tells us that AFODENIC is one of the lenders that has the most flexible policies, which is why he continues to work with the institution. On this occasion he has lowered the amount of his loan request because the current situation is very difficult and he does not want to fall behind.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a walkway

loans.name: Las Populares Group

texts.es:
G/S LAS POPULARES, nace por la necesidad de hacer crecer su negocio, esta miembros del g/s son vecinas  viven en la ciudad de Nindiri,  son de condición humildes, a veces expresivas otras muy calladas, son respetuosas y de trato muy amable. Iniciaron su negocio por la necesidad de obtener mayores  ingresos que les ayuden a soportar la carga económica de sus compañeros, comenzaron con solo venta de golosinas en un canasto, con los créditos de adim ellas han incrementado su negocio y ahora ofertan otros productos.

Doña Reina  ha  ofertado más productos básicos de primera necesidad, ella compra en el mercado de masaya  dos veces por semana, la demanda ella no la puede cubrir por falta de capital, es por eso que acide a adim para un financiamiento.
Las miembros de este g/s sueñan con llegar a tener una pulpería, debido a su tenacidad ellas saben que lo va a   lograr, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposos e hijos mayores los cuales han sido muy colaboradores en los proyectos que emprende su mamá.
texts.en:
The group of associates, Las Populares, was born of the necessity to make thier business grow. The members of the group are neighbors that live in the city of Nindiri, are of humble backgrounds, at times very expressive at other very quiet, they are respectful and very friendly. The started their businesses in order to obtain better income that would help them support the economic responsibilities of their partners. They started by selling only snack out of a basket. With the loans from ADIM they have expanded their business and now offer more products. Reina has offered more products of basic necessity that she buys at the Masaya market twice a week. She is unable to cover the demand for goods due to lack of capital, which is why she came to ADIM for a loan. The members of this group of associates dream of having a store. Because of their tenacity, they know that it will happen, especially since they have the support of their husbands and grown children who have been very helpful in the projects taken on by their mothers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital; Supply their business; Satisfy demand for products.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: La Sr. María tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo es de profesión carpintero, tiene un hijo  mayor. Sus planes es terminar de construir su casa. Doña  María tiene un  pequeño negocio de venta de ropas usadas, nuevas y cosméticos desde hace cuatro años lo inicio con fondo propio, la competencia a aumentado pero también la demanda,  con la variedad de productos y el buen servicio a los clientes se mantiene estable en el mercado de las ventas  Sus objetivos para el negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta obteniendo mayores utilidades. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar mercadería y comercializarla en mayores cantidades generando una mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua, is married to a carpenter, and has an adult son. She plans to finish construction on her home. For 4 years now, Maria has run a small business where she sells new and used clothing and cosmetics. She began with her own funds and her competency has increased, but so has demand. With the variety of products she sells and the great service she provides to her clients, she maintains stability in the sales market. Her goals for her business are to increase the volume of sales and obtain better incomes. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC, she will be able to purchase merchandise and sell higher quantities to generate a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase packages of clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Malasia

texts.es:
Doña Malasia inicio el  negocio a raíz que se quedo sin empleo su esposo, con la liquidación el le puso una mini pulpería viendo que le iba bien visito las oficinas de Adim y solicito su primer crédito, el cual lo invirtió en la compra de productos de primera necesitad, después del crédito, adim la invito a participar en los talleres de capacitación, a los que acudio y participo aplicando en su negocio lo aprendido.
Va al mercado 3 veces a la semana para abastecer su pulpería; por su carácter amable y jovial se ha ganado la simpatía de sus vecinos y esto le ha servido para tener mayores clientes 
Se siete satisfecha con los servicios brindados por adim, lo que la hace ser fiel con la institución
Su mayor sueño es ampliar su casa para ubicar aparte su negocio y darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, por tal motivo ella esta ahorrando de sus ganancias para no descapitalizar su negocio
texts.en:
Malasia started her business as soon as her husband became unemployed. With his severance they put up a small general store seeing as their visit at the ADIM offices went well and the requested their first loan, which they invested in the purchase of staple goods. After providing the loan, ADIM invited them to participate in the training workshops, which they came to and participated in-applying what they learned to their business. Malasia goes to the market 3 times a week to supply her store. Because of her kind and jovial personality, she has earned the friendship of her neighbors and they have come to be her best clients. She feels satisfied with the services provided by ADIM, which has made her loyal to the institution. Her greatest dream is to improve her home with a separate space for her business and to provide better living conditions to her children.
