For this reason she is saving her income so that she will not under-invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Captial; To Grow her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sr. Juana tiene 59 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah, estado civil casada su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad,  tiene una hija de 11 años de edad. Sus planes para su familia es construir su casa por completa. Doña Juana posee su pequeño negocio de venta de nacatamales, chicharrón y leña desde hace veinte años, inicio vendiendo solamente leña después fue adquiriendo más capital y invirtiendo en otros productos y elaborando los nacatamales. Los cuales sale a vender en un carretón jalado de dos caballos para vender mas,  Sus metas para el negocio a corto plazo es aumentar el volumen de venta y captar nuevos clientes. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materia prima para incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias a si como captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old and lives in Managua’s Hialeah neighborhood with her husband and their 11 year old daughter. Juana’s husband works in security services. The family plans to finish building their house. For 20 years Juana has had a small business selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales), chicharrón (pork rind), and firewood. When she started her business she only sold firewood, but later she acquired more capital and began investing in other products and making nacatamales. Juana goes to sell her nacatamales in a cart pulled by two horses, which allows her to sell more. Her short-term business goal is to increase her sales volume and attract new customers. Thanks to a loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, Juana will be able to purchase ingredients for making nacatamales. This will allow her to increase her sales, earn higher profits, and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for making nacatamales

loans.name: Martha Yuliza

texts.es: Martha Yuliza es soltera, de 28 años de edad, trabaja como conserje en la Universidad Agraria con 7 años de servicio, vive en casa de su mamá, esta solicitando su credito # 8 para comprar un terreno y construir su propia vivienda en el futuro y asi tener un poco de independencia, piensa seguir con los creditos para poco a poco realizar su sueño de tener su casa, pues en el futuro tendra su propia familia y desea que esten en un lugar propio y darle las condiciones basicas.  Martha Yuliza se ha caracterizado por ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos, es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos, y confia en que AFODENIC le ayudara a cumplir su sueño de tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha Yuliza is 28 years old and single. For the past seven years, she has been working as a custodian at the Agrarian University. She currently lives with her mother, and is requesting her eighth loan to buy a plot of land on which she can build her own home in the future. She plans to continue to take out loans so that, little by little, she can make her dream of building her own home come true. Someday, she will have a family of her own, and she would like her family to have its own home and access to basic services. Martha Yuliza has been very responsible and punctual with previous loan payments. She is very well-liked by her coworkers and neighbors, and she is confident that AFODENIC will help make her dream of having her own home a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a plot of land to build her house on

loans.name: Rodolfo De Los Angeles

texts.es: El Sr. Rodolfo tiene 47 años de edad, habitante del barrio de La capital de Managua llamado San Judas, estado civil casado, tiene una hija de 15 años de edad, los planes para sus familia es darle un patrimonio a su hija. Don Rodolfo tiene como profesión carpintero y ofrece clase, tiene su profesión desde hace treinta años de experiencias, el adquirió el conocimiento y lo puso en práctica mediante la enseñaza de su padre. Sus objetivos en el ámbito laboral  es crecer y llegar a captar nuevos clientes con nuevos diseños y la misma calidad de siempre. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar materia prima como: maderas finas, Aumentando el volumen de ventas e incrementando sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 47 years old and lives in the San Judas neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. Rodolfo is married and has a 15-year-old daughter; his plans for his family are to leave his daughter with an inheritance. Rodolfo has been a carpenter for thirty years; he also gives classes. He learned the trade from his father. His work-related objectives are to expand his business and gain new clients by offering new designs, with the same high-quality workmanship he always provides. Thanks to loans from AFODENIC, Rodolfo will be able to buy raw materials, like good quality wood, which will increase his sales volume as well as his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different kinds of wood to increase sales volume

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
En su pequeña casa del barrio julio Sánchez de Nindiri Doña Maria  elabora la comida que los fines de semana oferta en los cuadros de béisbol de la localidad,  mujer de 56 años quien atiende al público, hace la comida y limpia sin dejar de sonreír. Ella es la dueña del negocio, que inició dos años con un primer préstamo de ADIM y hoy está ya participando en un cuarto ciclo. Comenzó con un monto de $85.00 (ochenta y cinco dólares) y en la actualidad maneja un monto de $400.00 con un buen record crediticio.  Fue capacitada desde un inicio en como administrar el negocio, saber economizar y mantenerse al día con sus abonos, lo que ha sido la clave del éxito que ha alcanzado. 

Maria Elsa sueña con hacer un poco mas grande su comidería, comprar  mesa, sillas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes está segura que va lograr su sueño pues la vida le ha demostrado que trabajando duro, economizando y siendo responsable con los compromisos adquiridos se puede salir adelante. Todo depende del amor que se le ponga, además se siente bien agradecida con adim por la oportunidad que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
In her small home in the Julio Sanchez de Nindiri neighborhood, Doña Maria cooks meals to sell on the weekends near the local baseball fields. Doña Maria is 56 years old, and is constantly smiling as she cooks, serves her clients and cleans up. She owns the business, which she launched two years ago with the help of a loan from ADIM. Today, she is beginning her fourth loan cycle, and has good credit history. She began with US$85, and is now taking out a loan of US$400. She was trained in business administration since she first started the business, so she knows how to keep costs down and keep daily records of her sales; this is the key to her success. Maria Elsa dreams of expanding her food stand and of buying tables and chairs to make her clients more comfortable. She is certain that she will achieve her dreams, since life has taught her that you can get ahead by working hard, saving money and being responsible with your obligations. Everything depends on how much love you put into it, and she feels very grateful to Adim for the opportunity they are providing her with.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve working conditions, make her customers more satisfied by buying tables and chairs

loans.name: Heyzel

texts.es:
Con un pequeño monto que le prestó ADIM esta joven mujer instaló su taller de costura en la casa de sus padres.  Heyzel  aprendió a coser desde niña, aprendió en un taller de una amiga de su mama, por ser de escasos recursos económicos esta joven y  su familia no tenia recursos para comprarle la máquina. Conoció a ADIM, por recomendaciones de una vecina que es clienta, opto por el crédito individual  del cual entró en su primer ciclo de crédito y lo pago con un excelente record crediticio, en la actualidad  va por su segundo ciclo. 
Heyzel considera que haber podido iniciar su microempresa ha sido una de las cosas mas importantes que le han pasado pues está segura que poco a poco va a poder avanzar ingresando a nuevos ciclos con montos mayores. Tener su propio taller es un sueño de esta joven que se comienza a realizar, ampliarlo cada día es una meta que está segura de alcanzar con trabajo, disciplina, voluntad y ahorro. 
Ha participado  en los talleres de capacitación, que adim le ha brindado y  ha  aplicado en su negocio lo aprendido.
texts.en:
As a young girl, Heyzel learned to sew in the workshop of a friend of her mother. Unfortunately, her family did not have the resources to buy her a sewing machine. She heard about Kiva's partner ADIM from a neighbor and, with the help of a small loan, Heyzel was finally able to set up a sewing workshop in her parents' home. Heyzel was granted an individual loan and repaid it on time. She is now requesting a second loan.

Heyzel believes starting her own small business is one of the most important things that has happened to her. She is sure that little by little she will be able to earn more and be eligible to borrow more money. She is beginning to realize her dream of having her own workshop, and expanding her business every day is a goal that she is sure to reach with hard work, discipline, willpower, and savings.

Heyzel has participated in ADIM's training workshops, and has applied what she has learned to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business until she has a large workshop

loans.name: Lazaro Bernardo

texts.es: El Sr. Lázaro tiene 50 años de edad, habita en  un bario de la capital de Managua llamado Hialeah, casado su esposa trabaja como domestica en una casa particular no tienen hijos. Los planes para el futuro de  su familia es terminar de construir su casa. Don Lázaro se desemP. como celador, es un trabajo agotador tiene seis años de experiencia laboral también posee conocimiento de construcción. Sus objetivos es cambiar a un mejor trabajo y con un mejor  ingresos los donde pueda satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: Cemento, hierro, bloque y ladrillo para terminar de hacer su casa y poder gozar de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Senor Lázaro, 50, lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the capital of Managua. He is married, his wife works as a domestic in a private home, they have no children. The family's future plans are to complete the construction of their house. Don Lázaro has the job of security guard, which is exhausting work. He has 6 years of work experience, and he also has knowledge of construction. Their objective is to change to a better job with a better income that would be able to meet the needs of the household. Thanks to the Afodenic loans, he will be able to buy construction materials such as: cement, iron, blocks and bricks to finish building his house and be able to enjoy a decent lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials to finish his house

loans.name: Jasmina Careli

texts.es: La Sr. Jasmina tiene 25 años de edad, habita del barrio 19 de Febrero, en la capital de Managua madre  soltera, tiene dos lindos hijos de 3 y 7 años de edad, sus planes para su familia brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos y un patrimonio seguro ya que no tienen el apoyo de su padre, aunque con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante Doña Jasmina posee su pequeño negocio de ventas de cosméticos, joyas, ropa y otros, sus metas  en el ámbito económico es aumentar el volumen de venta con nuevas líneas de productos, lo inicio con crédito. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar nuevos producto para ofertarlos a sus clientes y comercializarlo a nuevos sectores del mercado
texts.en:
Senora Jasmina, 25, lives in the February 19th district in the capital of Managua. She is the single mother of two beautiful children, 3 and 7 years old. Her plans for her family are to provide a better future for her children and financial security since they do not receive support from their father. Although Doña Jasmina, through much effort, has gotten ahead in her small business selling cosmetics, jewelry, clothing and other things, her goal in the current economic climate is to increase the sales volume with new product lines, in the beginning on credit. Thanks to the Afodenic loans she has been able to buy new products to present to her clients and to sell in new sectors of the market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various jewelry and cosmetic products

loans.name: La Armonia Group

texts.es:
G/S LA  ARMONIA, Este g/s  está haciendo uso de su noveno ciclo  de préstamo de ADIM. Trabajan con el apoyo de sus familiares, comenzaron ambulantes y cuando ingresaron en ADIM obtuvieron un primer crédito de $100 (cien dólares cada uno).

Doña Mayerling, con los créditos que ADIM le ha proporcionado ha tenido la oportunidad de acondicionar el local donde tiene su negocio, lo que le permite tener mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.
Doña Estelvina nos manifiesta que con los créditos de adim ella ha logrado comprar un frezer para el almacenamiento de su producto.
El g/s además ha tenido la oportunidad de capacitarse y han aplicado en su negocio lo aprendido. Sueñan en un futuro obtener créditos con montos mayores, sabe que para lograrlo tendrían  que aplicar a un crédito individual  y ellos  prefieren seguir en g/s.
texts.en:
The La Armonia group is making use of their ninth cycle of ADIM loans, working with the support of their families. They started out as street vendors, and when they joined ADIM they obtained their first loan of $100 each. Doña Mayerling, with the loans ADIM has given her, has been able to equip the space where she has her business, permitting her go have a better condition of life for her family. Doña Estelvina shows us that with the ADIM loans she has been able to buy a freezer to store her product. The group has had opportunity as well to get training, and they have applied what they learned to their businesses. They dream in the future of being able to obtain higher credit, and they know that in order to do so, they will have to apply for individual credit, and they prefer to continue in a group.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to grow their businesses

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 51 años de edad, habita en un barrio  Los Gómez de la capital de Managua, estado civil casado, tiene un hijo de 22 años de edad lo tiene estudiando. Los planes para el futuro de su familia es asegurarle un mejor provenir. Doña Juana posee su pequeño negocio de Alquiler de sillas, mesas y arreglos de mesas. Lo creo desde hace dos años de experiencia en la atención al cliente, lo inicio con bienes propios, sus objetivos en el  ámbito económico es aumentar  su inventario y así ofrecer a otros canales del mercado de servicio. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar mayores cantidades de mesas, sillas, manteles, bufetes y aros para brindarle a cliente un servicio completo en la atención de sus celebraciones.
texts.en:
Señora Juana, 51, lives in the Los Gómez neighborhood of the capital of Managua. She is in a civil marriage and has one son of 22 who is in school. The future plans of her family are to ensure a better future. Doña Juana has a small business renting chairs, tables, and table arrangements. With two years' experience in client service, she started it with her own funds. Her goal in this economic climate is to increase her inventory and thus provide additional ways of marketing her service. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she will be able to buy larger quantities of tables, chairs, tablecloths, trays and napkin rings, so she can provide a complete client service of party provisioning.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs

loans.name: Velkis Yanira

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Velkys O. me dedico a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cremas, articulos de belleza, articulos para el hogar entre otros, soy una persona con gran capacidad para los negocios, en esta epoca necesito comprar mas mercaderia para poder tener mejores ventas y por lo tanto mejorar mis ganancias las cuales las occupo para ayudar a mis padres ya que en estos momentos no tengo hijos y estamos saliendo adelante con mi familia, tengo muchas ganas de superarme y tener una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que necesito este credito para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hi, my name is Velkys O.. I earn my living by selling clothing, shoes, creams, home and beauty products and other items. I am a very good businessperson. At present I need to purchase more goods so that I can improve my sales and increase my income, which I use to help my parents since I currently do not have children. My family and I are getting ahead. I have a strong desire to improve myself and have a better quality of life, so I need this loan to be able to keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy purses, shoes, home products, blankets, sheets, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 45 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, estado civil soltera, tiene tres lindos hijos que son independiente. Los planes para su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida. Doña Juana tiene su negocio que es una  pulpería desde hace diez años de experiencia en el servicio al cliente, inicio con fondos propios ya anteriormente vendía nacatamales, leña y otros productos de consumos diarios, sus objetivos  para el negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta con la introducción de nuevos productos. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar productos como: granos básicos, enlatados, frutas, verduras y golosinas, aumentando el volumen de venta y generando utilidades que benefician al hogar.
texts.en:
Juana is 45-years-old and lives in the district of Villa Reconciliación. She is single and has three beautiful children, who are independent. Her plan is to raise her family’s standard of living. Juana runs her own business, a small grocery store in which she has gained experience serving her customers for the past ten years. She started out with her own funds and previously sold nacatamales (Honduran tamales), firewood, and other everyday consumer products. Her goal for her business is to grow her sales by introducing new products. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC she will be able to purchase goods like basic grains, canned goods, fruits, vegetables, and candy, allowing her to increase sales and generate profits for the benefit of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and canned goods

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: La Sra. Diana tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, estado civil casada, tiene dos hijos de 4 y 16 años de edad. Sus planes para su familia es construir  una parte de la casa que requiere mejoras y después construirla parcialmente la casa. Doña Diana se desempeña como conserje una empresa de transporte desde hace siete años sus labores es limpiar, hacer los mandados, servicios de café, entre otros, cuando sale del trabajo tiene que tomar la ruta para llegar a su casa, lo cual es una rutina cansada, y gana poco por eso en el ámbito laboral es cambiar de trabajo que posee a uno mejor con mayores ingresos para ofrecerles a sus hijos un patrimonio. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar materiales de construcción como: Cemento, hierro, bloque y ladrillo, ofreciéndole a su familia seguridad y protección, y sobre todo una vivienda digna
texts.en:
Diana is 42 and lives in the district of Laurales Norte. She is married and has two children, 4 and 16. Her plan is to work on the part of her house that needs repairs, and then to partially improve her house. Diana has worked as a caretaker for a transportation company for seven years. Her job involves cleaning, shopping, and serving coffee, among other tasks, and after work she has to go home, a routine she is tired of. She does not earn much, so her goal is to find a new job that pays more so she can provide for her children’s future. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC, she will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, and bricks, so she can offer her family security and protection, and above all, a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair her home

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La sra. Ana Maria, Rodríguez tiene 47 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, tiene  tres hijos de 10, 12,14 años de edad, que están estudiando, la secundaria, también su esposo le ayuda lo cual lo administran los dos es un taller de carpintería que lo tienen desde hace seis años, comenzó debido a la experiencia. dquirida por su trabajo anterior, aprovecho para poner su propio taller, con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la remodelación de su taller, para dar buen servicios a sus cliente y aumentar las ventas, generándole buenos ingresos, a futuro es elaborar nuevos diseños para captar mas clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria Rodríguez is 47 and lives in a district called Memorial Sandino in the capital of Managua. She has three children, 10, 12, and 14, all secondary school students. Her husband helps her, and together they manage a carpentry workshop, which they have had for six years. Mrs. R. took advantage of experience gained from her prior job to open her own workshop. She is requesting a loan to remodel her workshop, so she and her husband can provide quality service to their customers and increase sales to generate strong income. Future plans include developing new designs in order to win more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to remodel her business

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Krishna Kumari M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur District, Nepal, with her husband, Mr. Jayu M., and their two daughters, who are studying in secondary school. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work. However, Mrs. M. and her husband make traditional brass religious statues.

The religious statues of Nepal are very famous and the demand for them is increasing around the world. Therefore, Mrs. M. is asking for a loan of NPR15000.00 (US $200) to buy raw materials including wax, silver, etc. for their business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Dipu

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipu M. is a 36-year-old lady who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur District, Nepal. She lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Mangal M., and their two sons. Her older son is in grade 9 and her younger son is in primary school. 
Mrs. M. and her husband opened their kitchenware shop six years ago. In their shop they sell different types of steel items including dinner plates, glasses, jugs, spoons, cups, cooking pots, and much more. The income from the shop meets the basic needs of the family. Now they are requesting for their second loan of NPR30000.00 (US$400.00) from Kiva to buy  more steel goods and expand the shop.

loans.use: To buy steel kitchenware

loans.name: Ratna Shova

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratna Shova B. lives in a single-family home with her husband, two daughters, and one son in Tangal, Lalitpur district, Nepal. Her older daughter works in a private office and her younger daughter is studying in grade12. Her son left school and now makes religious statues.

Tangal includes one of the very busy bazaars of Lalitpur district. Mrs. Maharjan and her husband, Mr. Gyan Bhakta, opened their tailoring shop 10 years ago. They make different types of custom-fitted lady's dresses, including the kurta-salwar, blouses, and trousers. Tailoring is the traditional work of their family and they were trained by their fathers. Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of NPR 25000.00 loan to buy cloth, cutting tools, and other requirements for her tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Jug Maya

texts.en:
Mrs. Jug Maya M. is a 49-year-old lady who lives in Thecho, Lalitpur District, Nepal. She lives in with her husband, son, and daughter. Both her son and daughter are studying in the post-secondary BBS level.

Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Govinda M., opened their grocery shop 10 years ago when he was out of work. They sell different types of grocery goods in their shop including rice, maize, pulses, noodles, and biscuits. Their children also help them in their work. All the needs of the family are met by the income of the shop. Mrs. M. is requesting a second loan of NPR 25000 (US$350.00) from Kiva to buy inventory for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery inventory

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Mrs. Parbati G., 33, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur District, Nepal. She is one of the active group members of Patan Business and Professional Women. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, her husband, two daughters, and a son. Her husband, Mr. Shankar G., is a farmer and works in their own field. Their daughters are studying in grades 9 and 5 and their son is in grade 3.  Because Mr. G. is the eldest son of his father, Nepali culture requires that his father live with them. 

Mrs. G. opened the grocery shop 5 years ago to improve the living standards of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her store such as rice, maize, and noodles. Her children help her in her shop.  She is requesting a second loan of NPR15000 ($200.00) from Kiva to buy more varied inventory for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery inventory

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita B. is a tailor in the town of Tangal in Lalitpur District, Nepal.  Mrs. B. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Rajip B., makes traditional brass religious statues. She has one son who attends pre-primary school.

Mrs. B. opened her tailoring shop 8 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular clothing like the Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies long dresses, and others. Now Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of NPR25000.00 loan to buy material for her work.

loans.use: To buy tailoring inventory

loans.name: Zabida

texts.en:
Zabida is married and lives in a household of 7 members. She is uneducated and divides her time between tailoring and doing the housework. Her husband has a small retail shop where she also works whenever possible.

Zabida has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghans (US$650.00) to improve the inventory of her tailoring business and to help her husband's business as well. She would like to say that this loan will help a lot toward supporting her family. She is happy to maintain her partnership with Kiva and AFSG and she is certain that after two or three years she will be a good business leader. She thanks her lenders around the world.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring inventory

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
Seema is a 30-year-old married woman with three children living in District 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  Her husband sells vegetables from a cart and she works as a tailor.

Seema is asking for a loan of US$850 (40000 AFN) to buy more vegetables for her husband and a sewing machine for her business, hoping that the investment will bring them greater success.  She wants to thank Kiva for this loan process that helps the poor all around the world.  She is happy with her relationship with both Kiva and AFSG and she thanks all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and vegetables for sale

loans.name: André Rosalina

texts.pt:
André Rosalina Z. é natural de Maputo, tem 37 anos de idade, é casado maritalmente e pai de 3 filhos, com idade entre 11, 9 e 2 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta uma empregada que vive com ela.

André estudou até 12ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeira da família, cresceu com a sua mãe dado que perdeu seu pai muito cedo, estando no seu segundo casamento dado que a primeira divorciaram e esta a 4 anos que estão juntos. Neste momento vive numa casa arrendando e a sua ainda está em construção.

André para alem de negocio é voluntário numa organização de apoio aos meninos da rua, e tem uma mercearia onde aponta os lucros líquidos de 6000,00mt mensal conta com ajuda de uma empregada. Para André este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva.

André sonha daqui para frente concluir a sua casa, casar oficialmente e comprar uma viatura para família e ajudar nas compras.
texts.en:
A native of Maputo, André Rosalina Z. is a 37-year-old married father of 3 children (of 11, 9 and 2 years of age). Along with his children, he also supports a live-in maid. André studied up until the 12th year and stopped because of his family's lack of financial conditions. He was raised by his mother because he lost his father at a young age. His mother is in her second marriage (of four years). The first ended in divorce. His mother lives in a rented house, and André's home is still under construction. Apart from his business, he also works as a volunteer in an organization that supports children living on the streets. He also has a grocery store where he employs one worker. This is André's first loan. He dreams of finishing his home, marrying officially, and purchasing a vehicle for the family.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and sell a variety of products

loans.name: Avelina

texts.pt:
Avelina Z. é natural de Maputo e tem 40 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 26, 24, 20 e 14 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta uma sobrinha que vive com ela e vive na casa própria.

Avelina estudou até 6ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras, em 1982 juntou se e em 1992 inicia actividades comerciais, em 2004 divorcia se do marido. Já desenvolveu vários de negócios. Onde neste momento dedica se a venda de produtos de mercearia. Com destaque aos sumos que compra a caixa por 235,00mt e vende por 360,00mt. Desta consegue um rendimento mensal de 6000,00mt.

Para Avelina este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar a sua mercadoria de forma a responder bem a procura nesta quadra festiva e aumentando assim os seus rendimentos. Tem como sonhos pessoas construção de uma casa para arrendar aumentando assim a renda familiar.
texts.en:
A native of Maputo, Avelina Z. is a 40-year-old divorced mother of 4 children (of 26, 24, 20 and 14 years of age). Along with her children, she supports her niece, who also lives with her. Avelina studied up until the 6th year and did not continue her studies because of a lack of financial conditions. In 1982 she married. In 1992 she initiated her first business. In 2004, she divorced. She has started various businesses. At the moment she sells grocery products. For Avelina, this is her first loan, with which she intends to increase the number of products in order to meet the holiday demand. She dreams of building a home to rent, which would increase the family's own income.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and sell a variety of products

loans.name: Eulália José

texts.pt:
Eulália Jose U. é natural de Maputo e tem 45 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 6 filhos com idade entre 28, 18, 11, 9, 7 e 5 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os filhos.

Eulália estudou até 6ªclasse e parou quando faleceu o seu pai e não teve alguém para ajudar financeiramente a mãe era desempregada. Eulália cresceu num ambiente familiar aos 15 anos faleceu o seu pai, em 1980 juntou se com o seu primeiro marido que veio a separar dele em 1985 e em 1995 casou se pela segunda vez com qual vive até hoje.

Eulália é gestora de uma mercearia e proprietária do mesmo, qual abre as 8:00he fecha as 18:00h não tem empregada. Tem um rendimento liquido mensal de 20.500,00mt , este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende reforçar a mercadoria existente a fim de responder bem a procura nesta quadra festiva do fim do ano. Futuramente  pretende comprar um carro.
texts.en:
A native of Maputo, Eulália Jose U. is a 45-year-old mother of 6 children (of 28, 18, 11, 9, 7 and 5 years of age). Eulália studied up until the 6th year and stopped her studies when her father passed away and she lacked financial support. Eulália's father passed away when she was 15 years old. In 1980 she married for the first time only to later separate in 1985, and in 1995 she married for the second time. Eulália is the manager and owner of a grocery store that opens at 8am and closes at 6pm. She does not employ any help. This is her first loan, with which she intends to bolster her existing stock in order to meet the holiday demand. In the future she hopes to purchase a car.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and sell a variety of products

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin M.. N. is forty years old. He is married with one child who is currently in the basic school. Godwin resides at Ejura with his immediate family. Ejura is a busy market town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The residents of Ejura are actively involved in trading activities.

Godwin runs a number of businesses in his locality and elsewhere. His ventures include motorbike spare parts, cell phone credits and accessories, CDs, and photography. He has run these multiple businesses for more than sixteen years and is very grateful to God for how far He has brought him. Godwin says he does not only stay in his studio to take photographs; he also travels with clients to other places to take photos and videotape events for a fee.

Godwin is requesting a loan to support his photography business. He says that for some time now, business has been steady due to technological advancements. He hopes to revive this business to avoid being kicked out of the market.

Godwin is in a member of a group called ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another to access the loan.

loans.use: To revive and expand his photography business

loans.name: Afishata

texts.en:
Afishata M. is thirty-five years old and married. She and her husband have five children, and the family lives in a business center called Ejura. Ejura is a busy market town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Afishata says all her kids are still in school.

Afishata enjoys trading very much. She started trading in her infancy when she stayed with her parents, and has been trading in maize and yams for over fifteen years. She buys her goods from the small towns nearby and sells at the local market. She buys beans, groundnuts, or other cereals, depending on the situation.

With this loan, Afishata plans to increase the quantity of cereals she buys on each trip, which will reduce her travel time and costs and enable her to supply a sizeable market. She is in a group called ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals and yams in bulk

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida M. is thirty years old. She is a married woman with three children who are all currently in the basic school.

Rashida has been trading since her infancy with her mother. She went into business right after completing elementary school. Rashida trades cereals such as maize and groundnuts, along with beans and other food items. She buys these foods directly from the farmers at relatively low prices and sells them at the local market in the town where she lives with her family. She also treks some of her goods to nearby markets to sell. Rashida says she wants to use this loan to buy the goods in bulk so that she can distribute to a number of customers.

Rashida belongs to a group in her community known as ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cereals like maize and groundnuts

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia Mummuni is thirty-five years old. She is married and has two children. Both are attending elementary school in Ejura.

Safia sells food items such as rice, beans, maize, and groundnut. She has been in this business for over ten years now. Safia buys her goods from the wholesalers in her community and sells to food vendors at the market square.

Rashida wants a loan to increase her working capital so that her dream of buying goods in bulk can be achieved. In this way, she can supply to a large number of customers. By increasing her market size, she will increase her profit margin.

Safia belongs to a group in her community known as ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Azalatu

texts.en:
Azalatu I. is a married woman. She is thirty years old and the mother of four children. Azalatu lives with her husband and children in a town called Ejura in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She enjoys trading and has been selling for over fifteen years in the town where she lives. 

She sells food items like beans, maize, groundnuts [peanuts] and others. She buys her goods from the farmers in her locality and surrounding towns. Azalatu sells to the people in her area, most of whom are food vendors. She says she desires to buy the goods in bulk so that she can reach a larger size of the market by trekking to markets in nearby towns. This, she says, is only possible by increasing her working capital. Basically, this is what she aspires to use the loan for. 

Azalatu belongs to a group in her community known as ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk beans, maize, groundnuts (peanuts), etc.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia I. is fifty years old. She is married and has two children. Both are attending elementary school in Ejura, where they reside.

She is into selling food items such as beans, maize and groundnuts [peanuts]. She has been in this business for over thirty-five years now. Sadia said she started this business with her mother when she was a child. Sadia buys her goods from wholesalers in her community and sells to food vendors. She says she sells at the market square. 

Sadia wants a loan to increase her working capital so that her wish to buy goods in bulk can be achieved. In this way, she can supply to a large number of customers to increase her market size, and hence, her profit margin.

Sadia belongs to a group in her community known as ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba J. is 50 years old, married and the mother of five kids; three of whom have successfully completed high school and are waiting for their results to enter the university, while the others are still in school. She has been a food vendor for twenty years through which she has supported her kids in school. She prepares and sells rice with stew and cooked yam in Ejura, a farming community where she lives with her household, and, along with this business, she also sells raw food products like maize in the marketplace of Ejura mostly during their market hours on Mondays. 

The food that Abiba prepares is a delicacy that many Ghanaians enjoy everyday either as breakfast, lunch or dinner, especially where she lives. Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more maize grains, vegetables, yam, rice and assorted meat for her operation and also to use part to provide education for her kids. 

She hopes this loan will help to increase her savings and improve her family's well-being. She would be very grateful for that assistance. 

She belongs to the community group called ‘Rely on God’ Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meat, etc.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya M. is 40 years old, married and the mother of four kids. Currently, all her kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood. She sells in a community called Ejura, where the major occupations are crop farming, including maize, groundnuts [peanuts] and the like, because of the fertility of the land. 

She has been selling yams for almost thirty years to support her family. Mariya started this business with her mother when she was a child. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with direct supply of yams. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to serve her customers, especially for the Christmas festivities and for the New Year. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. 

Mariya is a member of a community group called “Rely on God” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alhasan

texts.en:
Alhasan M., a 35-year-old trader, is a wife and mother of four children, who are currently in school. She trades in yams, beans, maize and groundnuts [peanuts], etc., on a table top in the local market of Ejura, a farming community where in the Ashanti region of Ghana where she lives. 

Alhasan says through this business, she has managed to support her first child to finish junior high school. She is requesting the loan to enable her to buy increased stock of yams, groundnuts, bags of maize and beans to grow her business. Alhasan says she believes the loan will increase her business for this year and early next year. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children in school to give them hope for a better future. 

She belongs to the community group called “Rely on God Trust Group”. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Safio

texts.en:
Satio U., 55 years old, is married with five children who are currently in school.  She is a trader and believes in hard working and dedication as the primary method to minimize poverty.  Therefore, she is very serious about her business, trading maize, beans and peanuts.  Safio started trading with her mother when she was a little girl and has remain in this business for 30 years after inheriting her business from her late mother.  When growing up, she said she did not realized the importance of education, yet she does see it now.  Being educated is very resourceful for her family.  

She wants to use the loan to buy larger supply of maize, beans and peanuts to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She is a member of the trust group called "Rely on God" trust group.  In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: Safio want the loan to buy larger supply of maize, beans, peanuts etc.

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna A., 45 year old, is married with three children.  She trades in cassava powder and also operates a grocery shop in Ejura, a community where majority of the population are farmers. She has been trading for the past 20 years. She has been very resourceful to her family through her business.  
She runs a small provision kiosk in her neighbourhood. She also sells cassava powder on a table top in front of her grocery kiosk. She has been in business for fifteen years. She says that she also supplies cassava powder to food vendors in her community. Mamuna wants a bigger working capital. She desires to buy purchase more groceries and cassava powder to serve her community during the festive season. 
She is a member of the trust group called "Rely on God." In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and cassava powder.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia S., 35 years old, is married and has two children. Both children are attending elementary school in their community, Ejura.  S. owns a business selling food items such as beans and groundnuts that she has been operating for over ten years.  S. said she started this business when she was a child with her mother.  S. buys her goods from the wholesalers in her community and sells to food vendors both in her community and to the surrounding communities.  She also sells food at the market square during their market which falls on every Monday. 

S. wants a loan to increase her working capital so that her dream of buying goods in bulk can be achieved.  She will then be able to supply large quantities of customers, increasing her market size and profit margin.  S. belongs to a group in her community known as "Rely on God," where the group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: Malia wants the loan to buy cereals in bulk, such as beans and groundnuts.

loans.name: Borya

texts.en: Borya Z. is 40 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are currently in school, and the oldest is married and living with her husband. Borya is a petty trader who trades in peanuts. Her husband and children are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling peanuts has enabled her to rent accommodation for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of peanuts to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's education. She is a member of the group called “Trust in God” Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days, and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: Borya wants the loan to buy bulk supply of peanuts

loans.name: Hélder

texts.pt:
Hélder A. é natural de Maputo e tem 28 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com idade ente primeiro com 8 anos e segundo tem 4 anos. Para alem dos filhos sustenta a sua mãe e seus irmãos que vive com eles na mesma casa.

Hélder fez o instituto comercial e neste momento trabalha como professor de inglês sendo professor do aparelho do estado. Para alem do salário faz o negocio de vende de produtos diversos onde conta com ajuda de uma empregada. Quando incluir o salário totaliza mensalmente 12000,00mt o rendimento liquido.

Para Hélder este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, já teve noutra instituição no valor de 12000,00mt valor aplicado na reabilitação da sua residência, este pretende reforçar o seu estoque.

Hélder pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de melhorar a suas condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
A native of Maputo, Hélder A. is a 28-year-old married father of 2 children (of 8 and 4 years of age). Along with his children, he supports his mother and her brothers, who also live in his home. Hélder completed school and at the moment works as an English instructor. Aside from his salary, he sells various products at his business where he employs one worker. This is Hélder's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva with which he intends to increase his business' stock. He has already asked for a loan from another institution that helped him remodel his home. He intends to pay back the loan as soon as possible in order to ask for another one to help him improve his way of life.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and sell a variety of products

loans.name: Maria Amélia

texts.pt:
Maria Amélia C. é natural de Maputo e tem 42 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos, com idade entre 26, 22 e 15 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta irmãos que vive com eles. Vive na casa própria.

Maria estudou até 8ªclasse e parou quando ficou grávida e assim viu se obrigada a ir ao lar. Tendo ida ao lar aos 16 anos de idade, a sua infância passou com a sua mãe dado que o seu pai morreu mais cedo. Aos 30 anos começou a trabalhar na educação e devido ao salário que era muito baixo deixou e iniciou um negócio de venda de carne o qual desenvolve até data Hoje. O mesmo estabelece um horário das 7:00h até as 15:00h. Com um rendimento mensal de 12000,00mt.

 Para Maria este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o estoque afim de responder da melhor maneira a procura nesta quadra festiva. E pretende pagar antes do tempo afim de solicitar outro para compra de mobília.
texts.en:
A native of Maputo, Maria Amélia C. is a 42-year-old married mother of 3 children (of 26, 22 and 15 years of age). Along with her children, she supports her brothers, who also live with her. Maria lives in her own home. Maria studied up until the 8th year and stopped when she became pregnant and was forced to return to her mother's home. Since she spent her time at home since 16, her childhood was spent with her mother. Her father passed away at an early age. At 30 years of age she began to work in education. Because her salary was low she decided to start her own business selling meat, a job she performs to this day. She works from 7am to 3am. This is Maria's first loan. She intends to increase her stock, especially in response to the holiday season. She also intends to pay back the loan as soon as possible in order to ask for another loan to purchase furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Artur Saeta

texts.pt:
Artur Saeta M. é natural da província de Inhambane, tem 44 anos de idade, casado maritalmente com duas esposas e pai de 7 filhos com idades entre 21,19, 17, 16,16,10 e 8 anos de respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta um sobrinho enviando géneros alimentícios.

Artur estudou até 7ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras da família     
Em 1980 mudou se para província do Maputo sozinho a procura de emprego onde primeiramente trabalhou como empregado domestico, mais tarde veio trabalhar no instituto nacional de ciências sociais, em 1984 incorporou se nas forças armadas de defesa de Moçambique e em 1994 inicia actividades comercial ( negócios) onde até ao momento já praticou vários tipos de negócios.

Para alem de pertencer as forças armadas é gestor de um estabelecimento comercial de venda de diversos produtos com destaque a cerveja que compra a caixa por 230,00mt e vende por 280,00mt. Desta maneira consegue um rendimento liquido mensal de 15000,00mt.

Para Artur este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, onde os primeiros dois usou para compra de peças para a sua viatura e assim pretende pagar ante do tempo este para solicitar outro afim de melhorar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Artur Saeta M. comes from the Inhambane province. He is 44 years old, married to two wives and father of 7 children -- their ages are 8, 10, 16, 16, 17, 19 and 21 respectively. Besides his own children he also supports a nephew by sending him food. Financial difficulties lead Artur to quit school after completing the 7th grade. In 1980, he moved to the Maputo province by himself to look for work; there he worked as a housekeeper, and later he worked for the national institute of social sciences. In 1984, he joined the Mozambique´s defense armed forces and, in 1994, he began his business activities -- he has been involved with many types of businesses since then. Aside from his armed forces career, he also runs a commercial establishment that sells many different kinds of products; beer stands out because a case of it can be bought for 230,00mt and sold for 280,00mt, generating a monthly net income of 1500,00mt. This will be Artur's third loan through Hluvuku and first through Kiva; the previous two loans were used to purchase parts for his vehicle. He wishes to pay back the loan before its term date so he can request another loan that will be used for home restoration purposes.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products purchase and retail

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.pt:
Eugenia M. nasceu na província do Maputo e tem 40 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 24, 20 2 14 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta uma sobrinha que vive com ela.

Eugenia estudou até 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeira, cresceu com a família até aos 7 anos depois foi viver numa missão onde estudava até a 6ªclasse e como o nível terminava ai era necessário que fosse a outras zonas e por falta de condições não foi possível. Em 1992 inicia actividade comercial até hoje já praticou vários negócios. Neste momento dedica se a venda de produtos da primeira necessidade onde tem tido lucro mensal até 10000,00mt.

Para Eugenia este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva com qual pretende aumentar o estoque de forma a responder a procura nesta quadra festiva do fim do ano. Assim eugenia pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de comprar uma viatura para ajudar lhe nas compras.
texts.en:
Eugenia M. was born in the province of Maputo. She is 40 years old, married and mother of 3 sons -- their ages are 14, 20 and 24 respectively. She also supports a niece that lives with her. Eugenia was raised by her family until she was 7 years old and she attended school until the 6th grade. In order to continue her education beyond the 6th grade, she would have to commute to other parts of the city but, unfortunately, financial restraints at the time kept her from doing that. In 1992, she decided to dedicate herself to business ventures and she has participated in many since then. Currently, she owns a basic good retail business where she is has been able to reap profits of up to 10000,00mt. This will be Eugenia's first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva, and she wants to use to purchase more stock merchandise in order to meet the holiday season's demand. Eugenia plans on paying the loan back early so that she can purchase a vehicle with a second loan.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery goods purchase

loans.name: Francisco Daniel

texts.pt:
Francisco Daniel M. é natural de Maputo, tem 50 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 16 filhos, destes apenas vive com uma filha, um sobrinho e uma neta os demais já são maiores de idade e tem suas casas.

Francisco estudou até 9ªclasse e parou quando ingressou nas forças armadas de libertação nacional, foi formado na URSS, Na especialidade de Foguetes antiaérea e em 1997 foi desmobilizado. Logo depois da sua desmobilização iniciou a criação de frangos, negocio que durou apenas três anos por que ficou gravemente doente. Em 2005 começou o negocio de venda de carne, qual desenvolve até a data hoje. Compra a carne por 80,00mt o quilograma e vende por 100,00mt. Desta maneira consegue um rendimento líquido de 2000,00mt semanalmente.

Para Francisco este é seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque, tem sonhos para próximos empréstimo a compra de viatura para lhe ajudar no transporte de mercadoria.
texts.en:
A 50-year-old Maputo native, Francisco Daniel M. is married and had 16 children, although only one daughter lives with him along with a nephew and a granddaughter -- all the other are adults and have their own homes. Francisco went to school until the 9th grade when he joined the national liberation armed forces. He graduated as an anti-aircraft rocket specialist in the USSR and was dismissed in 1997. Right after his dismissal, he started a poultry business that only lasted until he fell gravely ill three years later. In 2005, he began a beef cattle business and he is still involved in this activity to this date. He purchases beef for 80,00mt per kilo and sells it for 100,00mt, which allows him to net 2000,00mt in income per week. This will be his first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva and he plans on investing it to increase stock. His dream is to be able to receive another loan that will fund the purchase of a vehicle that will help him transport his merchandise.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beef cattle purchase and sales

loans.name: Ilda David

texts.pt:
Ilda David S. é natural do bairro da Machava no distrito municipal da Matola um dos distritos da província do Maputo, tem 53 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 5 filhos, apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Ilda estudou até 4ªclasse e não continuou por ter tido problemas sociais quais não quis revelar ao nosso repórter. Teve a sua infância junto dos pais com 7 irmãos. Tem sua casa própria.

Ilda dedica se ao negócio de vende de produtos de mercearia é dona e tem um estabelecimento que abre as 6:00h e fecha as 22:00h  tem a destacar das mercadorias que tem mais saída é o peixe carapau que compra uma caixa por 1050,00mr e vende por 1350,00mt. Com isso tem lucros mensais de 8000,00mt e poupa algum. 

Para Ilda este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no kiva, pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Ilda tem planos futuros a aquisição de um estabelecimento para venda de carne de vaca.
texts.en:
Ilda David S. comes from Machava (a city that belongs to the district of Matola located in the Maputo province). She spent her childhood with her parents and 7 other siblings. Currently, this 53-year-old widow does not support anybody else besides her 5 children -- she owns the house where they live. She attended school up until the 4th grade, but social motives she did not want to share with our reporter cut her education short. Ilda owns a grocery goods retail establishment that opens from 6:00am until 10:00pm. She states that one of her best selling products is the carapau fish that can be bought for 1050,00mt per box and sold for 1350,00mt, enabling her to produce 8000,00mt in monthly revenues and to save a part of that. This will be Ilda's first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva and she wants to increase her stock merchandise. In the future she wants to purchase a commercial establishment that will be used to sell beef cattle.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of assorted products

loans.name: Rosita

texts.pt:
Rosita M. é natural do distrito de Bilene um dos distritos da província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique tem 48 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 5 filhos. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Rosita estudou até 2ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições, muito cedo mudou se de Bilene para Maputo na companhia da sua família onde viveu no bairro do aeroporto e lá conheceu o seu marido. 

Rosita dedica se a venda de roupa usada e dona do negócio não tem nenhuma empregada, compra um fardo de roupa por 2500,00mt e vende por 3500,00mt, assim tem um rendimento mensal de 12000,00mt poupa mensalmente 2700,00mt. Para Rosita este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e Kiva e pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Futuramente pretende fazer outro negócio em casa de venda de peixe congelado e assim lhe falta o congelador.
texts.en:
Rosita M. comes from the district of Bilene (a district of Gaza located in the southern end of Mozambique). She is 48 years old, married and has 5 children. She is not responsible for supporting anybody else. Due to financial difficulties, she went to school only until the 2nd grade. She moved from Bilene to Maputo at an early age, settling with her family in the airport area where she met her husband. Rosita runs a used-clothing business without help from anybody else. She buys a bale of used clothing for 2500,00mt and sells them for 3500,00mt, generating a monthly revenue income of 12000,00mt, from which 2700,00mt are saved. This will be Rosita's first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva and she wants to purchase additional stock merchandise with it. In the future she wants to set up a second home-based business dedicated to selling frozen fish; therefore, she will need to invest in a freezer.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of used clothing

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Mrs. Ret C., 42, is a rice farmer who lives in Phsar Leu Village in the Pursat Province. Her husband has been a construction worker since 1979, and with his many years experience is currently chief of workers. C. has two teenage daughters who are in school. 

Because rice farming is the main source of income for the family, C. works hard. She grows rice twice per year, once in the rainy season and once in the dry season. 

Previously, she has rented a buffalo at high cost from another villager to use to plow her farmland. Now, to reduce the cost of renting buffalo, she wants a loan to buy two buffaloes that she will own.

loans.use: To buy two buffaloes to plow her farmland

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn D., 49-year-old mother of three children in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur, devotedly seeks for an answer to how she could meet all her family needs. Her dream to have a simple and a happy family life made her joine and avail herself of the CEVI credit program.

From the little amount she borrowed, she started a small store where she sells firewood and assorted goods to all her neighbors. Her little efforts of starting up a business became a big help in supporting her family needs.

She needs a loan to purchase assorted goods for her store. She also intends to retail rice to augment her income. She is looking into some possible income opportunities to help her family more.

CEVI helps Marlyn sustain her business. Her being part of the program gives her access to the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage that CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for sale

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mr. Chhun R. is 47 years old. He is married to Srey Souy, age 44, and they live in Pursat Province. They grow rice and vegetables for their family's needs. In addition, they have raised pigs since 1981. They are the parents of eight children, six of whom are single and two of whom are married. Their eldest daughter is a farmer, and she assists her parents with their work. 

R. and Souy are applying for a loan to purchase more piglets to raise, and a cart to transport their crops.

loans.use: To purchase mores piglets and a cart

loans.name: Phung Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phùng Thị Liên năm nay 37 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con còn nhỏ. Năm 2006 chị Liên tham  gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi 200 con vịt, gia đình chị còn kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá nên thu nhập của gia đình chị Liên rất ổn định (3.000.000đ/ tháng).
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vào kinh doanh và mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Phùng Thị Liên is 37 years old. She has 3 young children. She started participating in TYM fund in 2006. Her loans were used to raise ducks. Today she and her family have 200 ducks, they also run a grocery store so they have a good & stable income, 3.000.000 VND a month. This loan cycle, she is requesting 9.000.000 VND to buy more merchandise for her store and food for her ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Đảng năm nay 45 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện đang sống tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hoá. Chị Đảng tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi, lương làm thợ xây của chồng và sự hỗ trợ thêm của con trai làm nghề lái xe. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng  kinh tế gia đình chị Đảng đang ngày càng phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn đựơc  vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Hoàng Thị Đảng is 45 years old. She and her family live in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hoá province. Mrs Đảng is a TYM fund member since 2006. Her family income is from raising poultry, her husband's salary as a construction worker and their son's contribution (a truck driver). Their combined income is 3.000.000 VND a month and it keeps increasing. For this loan cycle, Mrs Đảng would like to borrow 9.000.000 VND to buy feed for her chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Lợi năm nay 55 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó 4 người con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ việc làm chiếu và sự hỗ trợ của các con với thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê Thị Lợi is 55 years old. She has 4 children who are all grown up. In 2006, she became a TYM fund member to get capital to raise pigs. Today beside raising pigs, she also makes sedge mats to increase her income which amounts to 2.000.000 VND a month. Her children also contribute to the family's finance. She is requesting a loan of 9.000.000 VND to buy pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Hop Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Hợp năm nay 53 tuổi, hai vợ chồng chị đang sống cùng 4 con đã trưởng thành. Hiện tại  chồng chị đi làm thợ xây còn chị và các con làm nghề dệt chiếu và chăn nuôi tại gia đình. Công việc chăn nuôi, dệt chiếu đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng .
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 9.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Phần còn lại chị sử dụng mua thêm nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc dệt chiếu của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hop Thi L. is 53 years old. She and her husband live with their four adult sons. Currently her husband works as a construction worker and she and her children work weaving straw mats and raising livestock at their home. The livestock and straw mats businesses are growing very favorably and provides the family with an income of 2,500,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND, part of which will be used to buy more pigs to raise. The remaining portion will be used to buy more raw materials to use in the mat-weaving business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs, buy raw materials for weaving mats

loans.name: Tan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Tần năm nay 49 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con  đã trưởng thành. Năm 2007 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt . Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm gà vịt  về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tan Thi L., 49 years old, has two grown children. In 2007, she joined the Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising ducks. Currently this venture is the family's main source of income at 2,500,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying more chickens and ducks to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more ducks and chickens

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru:
Ходжиев Абдулло женат, имеет 6 детей. Он преподает математику в средней школе  своего поселка. Жена работает медсестрой в местной больнице, она остается на ночь на дежурство с больными пациентами. Бывают дни, когда супруги не видятся неделями. Но вырастить шестеро детей нелегко. Абдуллоджону пришлось  искать другие источники доходов. Он устроился водителем одного из городских  таксопарка.  Сначала он брал рейсы по городу, сейчас он берет и дальние рейсы в дальние города, и районы по республике Таджикистан.  Так как на дальние рейсы дают большие деньги. Сейчас их дети выросли, каждый из них зарабатывает на жизнь,  и помогают отцу. Один из сыновей  присылает деньги с России. На деньги сына и накопив необходимую сумму, он приобрел джип, так как на этой машине легко ехать по перевалам, также в эту машину  помещаются больше пассажиров, что приемлемо для его заработка. 
Его бизнес приносит хороший доход, поэтому его сыновья посоветовали  продать существующую машину и обратиться  в Микроинвест для приобретения новой и более надежной машины пригодной для перевала. Накопив нужный капитал, и по совету сына Абдулло получил кредит и приобрел надежную машину.
texts.en:
Abdullo K. is married and has six children. He teaches mathematics in his town's secondary school. His wife is a nurse at the local hospital, where she works with sick patients on the night shift. On occasion he does not see his wife for a week at a time, and raising six children was no easy matter. Adullo needed to find other sources of income, and took up driving a cab for a local taxi company. In the beginning, his fares were in town, but now because the pay is higher he takes on ones further afield, to distant towns and regions throughout Tajikistan. Their children are now grown and each of them earns a living and assists his father, including one son who wires money from Russia. Since business is good, his son recommended that he sell his current vehicle and seek assistance from MicroInvest for buying a new, more reliable vehicle better suited to mountain driving. Acting on his son's advice, Abdullo took out a loan and together with the money he had saved purchased an SUV that carries more passengers and makes it easy to drive the mountain passes, both good for his earnings.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an SUV

loans.name: Biek

texts.en: Biek B. is 35 years old and lives in the Pursat Province. She is a rice farmer who started the business over ten years ago. She is married with four children, all of whom are students and are living at home whilst her husband San Ngoun, 46, works as a vehicle repairman. He owns and runs a small workshop in front of his home, providing his services for bicycle or motorcycle repair, earning approximately $2 a day. B. requested a loan of $150 for her husband to purchase a range of tools and materials for his business activities. The loan will help their family to earn additional income. (B.'s husband appears in the picture of his workshop because she was not available)

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials for vehicle repair business

loans.name: Ninh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Ninh năm nay 34 tuổi, hai vợ chồng chị đang sống cùng 3 con nhỏ tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2006. Hiện tại  ngoài thời gian đi làm thợ xây chồng chị Ninh còn  hỗ trợ thêm cho chị trong việc chăn nuôi và trồng trọt.Với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống gia đình chị Ninh đang ngày càng ổn định và được cải thiện hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn, vịt về nuôi..
texts.en:
Mrs. Ninh Thi V. is 34 years old. She and her husband live with their 3 small children in the town of Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa province. She joined the Fund in 2006. Currently, besides his job as a construction worker, Mrs. V.'s husband also helps her with raising livestock and farming. With an income of 2,500,000 VND/month, the family's quality of life is becoming more stable day by day and is improving. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying pigs and ducks to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs, ducks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more equipment for a business that caters and organizes special events like weddings, parties, etc.

loans.name: Thanh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đặng Thị Thanh năm nay 33 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và  2 con nhỏ tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện tại  công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là buôn bán chiếu và hoa quả với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 6.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh daonh buôn bán của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh Thi D., 33 years old, lives with her husband and two children in the town of Quang Xuong, province of Thanh Hoa. She joined the Fund in 2007. Currently the business that is providing the family with their main source of income is selling straw mats and fruits and vegetables at an income of 2,500,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 6,000,000 VND to invest in the family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Adalgisa Bido Nuñez Group
loans.use: To establish a women's clothing shop/business

loans.name: Huong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Hường  năm nay 55 tuổi, gia đình chị  có 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2007 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán, kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa. Công việc kinh doanh ngày càng phát triển và đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Huong Thi P., 55 years old, has two small school-age children. In 2007 she joined the Fund and borrowed money to invest in running a general store. The business has been growing day by day and brings the family an income of 2,500,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying goods and supplies to serve her customers in the upcoming Tet New Year's festival.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more goods and supplies to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Dara Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who live in Srae Kouyk village in Kandal Province comprise the village bank. Mrs. Dara T. is the village bank president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells breakfast in the local school. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy plates, spoons, tables, and so on for her current business. Her husband, Mr. Pao Sokhum, is an air conditioner repairer. Mrs. Dara T. is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

This is a group loan. Two members have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. Members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy plates, spoons, tables and so on for her current business.

loans.name: Binh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lại Thị Bình năm nay 31 tuổi.Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương năm 2008 và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ việc làm chiếu và tiền công đi làm thuê của chồng nên kinh tế gia đình chị khá ổn định với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 6.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Phần còn lại chị sử dụng mua thêm nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc dệt chiếu của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Binh Thi L. is 31 years old. She joined the Fund in 2008 and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock. Currently, besides he income from raising livestock, the family also has an income stream from making straw mats and her husband's salary from working as labor-for-hire, so the family's finances are quite stable at 2,000,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 6,000,000, part of which will be used to invest in buying more pigs to raise. The remaining amount will be used to buy more raw materials for weaving straw mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs, raw materials for straw mats

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. RE. C. is the leader of a group of five members who all live in Trapang Pring village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is 41 years old and the mother of nine childrE.: two are employed in a garment factory, five are enrolled in the local school, and the remaining two are too young to work or study.

Mrs. RE. C. is a farmer who owns 1 hectar of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Huot Huor, transports firewood to sell in the local village. EvE. though they work hard, they do not earn enough income to provide a good quality of life for their family. In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. RE. C. decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to build a new house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Vĩnh năm nay 49 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng  2 con nhỏ tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện tại  công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi lợn và trồng trọt với thu nhập  2.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 6.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Vĩnh, 49 years old, lives with her two children in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. Presently, the main sources of income for her family are raising pigs and growing crops. Their income is about 2,000,000 VND (125 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 6,000,000 VND (375 USD) to invest in buying more pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khom S. is the leader of a group of four members who all live in Kngoak Pong village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is 38 years old and the mother of seven children: one is employed in a garment factory and the others attend the local school.

Mrs. Khom S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Loeng Tol, sells firewood in the local village. Unfortunately, he is now sick and cannot work to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Khom S. decided to ask for a loan to treat her husband's illness.

This is a group loan. Two members have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.
