Akua is innovative and pro-active when it comes to business. She was once a farmer who was into the sale of cereals, but she realized that she could divest or venture into a more viable area to generate more income to support her family. So she decided to use the proceeds from her farm business to start her new business: the sale of clothing.

Akua travels to Togo, a nearby country, to purchase her goods. She says it is comparatively cheap to buy in Togo. She has been selling things like linens, clothes, and lace, etc. for six years now. She has a niche market and concentrates on the surrounding villages rather than serving the entire market. There are no competitors for her now, she says. And her reason is that she has not concentrated on the whole market so that competitors would monitor her.

Akua is requesting the loan to buy more materials so as to avoid frequent trips, due to the risk involved. She wants to make more income to provide a better education to enhance her kids' future career. She is a member of a group called ‘The living God’ Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Akua does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy ready-made clothing like lace, linens and clothes to restock her inventory

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal, a 28-year-old woman living in Bourj el Barajneh, Lebanon with her husband and their child, has owned a grocery store selling food and candy for almost a year, having begun it with the support and encouragement of her brother. Her clients are friends and neighbors.

Dalal is requesting a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise and food products for her shop. Although this is the first time she has asked for a loan, in the future she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and food products.

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya M., 28 years old, lives in the town of Khapichhen in Lalitpur, where two years ago she opened her tailoring shop specializing in making custom-fitted ladies’ dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. Before starting the business, Maiya took a six-month training course in tailoring. She is now requesting a loan to buy raw materials for her work.

Maiya lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Rabin M., who works in his own electronic shop, and her three-year-old son, who is in preschool.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
The married father of two children who are presently in school as well as a renowned photographer with 10 years of experience, 31-year-old Solomon B. is a very dynamic, innovative, and hardworking young man who attends to his work with professionalism and customer care.

Solomon takes pictures in a wide variety of settings, going to places such as churches, wedding programs, etc. in order to solicit business. He says photography is a lucrative activity that he very much enjoys doing. Because digital photography has become so popular, Solomon is requesting a loan to purchase a digital camera, batteries, photo printer etc. He believes this will help him to remain in business and expand his clientele. In the future he plans to open a photo studio so that potential customers will be able to locate him easily.

Solomon is part of the ‘Holiness’ Trust group, whose members agree to guarantee each others’ loans.

loans.use: To buy camera film, tents, a digital camera and a photo printer.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir, 29, lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Samir has been working as a barber for fifteen years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase accessories and perfumes for his shop. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan.

When Samir first started his business, he had his father's support which helped him a lot. Samir is special in his work because of his good reputation and his good behavior with customers. His customers are his neighbors. In the future, he plans to have more than one shop.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and perfumes for his shop

loans.name: Abla Ahoefa

texts.fr:
Cette dame réside dans le quartier d’Agoè, un quartier de Lomé (Togo) où elle exerce son activité génératrice de revenu qi n’est autre que la vente de gravier. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne à AKATA. Cette dame n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de chez WAGES et sollicite donc son premier prêt pour acheter trois (03) bennes de dix (10) roues.
Madame G. divorcée de son époux  et à deux (02) enfants à charge. Ce crédit qu’elle demande lui permettra aussi de pouvoir bien subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. G. lives in the Agoè neighborhood, a district of Lomé (Togo), where she sells gravel to earn a living. She has been in this business since 2005 and gets her supply from AKATA. She has never received a loan from WAGES and is requesting her first to buy 3 buckets of 10 wheels.

Mrs. G. is divorced from her husband and is raising two children. This loan that she is requesting will also allow her to better support her children and supply what they need.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing gravel for re-sale

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May, 47, lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. May has been selling gold Brazilian jewelry sixteen years. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase gold from Syria.

May has been a micro-credit client for nine years now and has always repaid on time. The loans have made her life easier, especially since she didn’t have family support. May is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are friends, neighbors, and summer tourists. In the future, she plans to expand her business by becoming a wholesaler and also by selling gold to other retailers.

loans.use: to purchase gold from Syria for re-sale

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Mrs. Bhagabati A., 38, lives in Khokhana-Dobato. Khokhana-Dobato is located in Lalitpur district, and most of the people in this region are engaged in agriculture. Mrs. A. lives in a nuclear family with her husband, Mr. Karna Bhahadur A., and two children. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 12 and her daughter is studying in grade 5.

Both Mr. and Mrs. A. are engaged in running their own paint shop. They opened their paint (color) shop a few years ago. They do not have any other job, so all the requirements of their family are fulfilled by their shop’s income.

Now Mrs. A. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 30,000 to buy different types of colors of paint and also to expand her business. She wants to use her income to upgrade the living standards of their family.

loans.use: to buy different types of colors of paint

loans.name: Souzan

texts.en:
Souzan is a 19-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their child. She owns a beauty salon and she has been a hairdresser for two years. Souzan has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her salon. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan.

She expects that the loan will help her improve her business. Souzan is special in her work because of her dedication to her business. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she faced some difficulties like lack of cash, merchandise, and tools. In the future, she plans to expand her business by opening another shop.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her salon

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sita T., 30, is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Khokhana-Dobato. She opened her grocery shop 4 years ago to improve the living standard of her family. In her shop Mrs. T. sells rice, maize, snacks, cold drinks, etc. Now her family's living conditions are not so good because her husband, Mr. Buddha T., went to Dubai to earn money, but still he could not send any money to the family. So Mrs. T. has to fulfill all the needs of the family. She has to pay the fees for her children’s school as well. So she is facing economic problems.

To solve this problem, Mrs. T. is requesting Rs 10,000 loan to add some other varieties of grocery goods to her shop to increase her earnings. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 8 and her son is in primary school.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for re-sale

loans.name: Sodjedo

texts.fr:
Monsieur V.  est âgée de trente huit ans (38) et habite dans le quartier d’agoè nyévé,
Il a pour activité la soudure qu’il exerce depuis 2003, ce métier lui réussit bien parce qu’au Togo beaucoup de matériaux sont fabriqués en fer. Il n’a jamais fait de prêt à WAGES et demande ce prêt pour s’approvisionner avec des barres de fer.
Monsieur V.  est marié et à quatre personnes à charge (04).
texts.en:
Mr. V., 38, lives in the Agoè Nyévé neighborhood. Since 2003, he has been in the welding business, in which he is doing well because in Togo, lots of things are made out of iron. He has never received a loan from WAGES and is asking for this one so as to stock up on iron bars.

Mr. V. is married and supports four persons.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of tools etc. for his welding

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 49-year-old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh (in the southern suburbs of Lebanon) with his wife and their three children. For the past nine years, he has owned and operated a kiosk where he sells coffee, tea, candies, chicken, sandwiches, beverages, telephone cards, and makoucheh. (A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese), and lahm bi ajin (minced meat); it can be eaten anytime of the day, but for some reason it tastes better in the morning.)

Ibrahim is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 via A. Majmoua in order to purchase telephone cards, candies, and tobacco. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan. Ibrahim hopes that the loan proceeds will enable him to diversify his product line, which will in turn help him expand his client base (his clients are mostly workers). When he first started his business, he lacked cash, but his business has been doing very well in recent years. In the future, he plans to expand his business into a restaurant business.

loans.use: To attract new customers by diversifying his product line

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh (in the southern suburbs of Lebanon) with her husband and their three children. For the past five years, she has owned and operated a clothing shop where she sells clothes from Syria such as cotton pajamas and t-shirts.

Houda is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 via A. Majmoua in order to purchase clothes from Syria. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan. She hopes that the loan proceeds will enable her to generate an increase in sales revenue. Her main problem with this line of business is that her clients always want to bargain (i.e., by seeking to have her prices lowered), though she notes that she decided to start her business because of her tough personality and superior management skills. In the future, she plans to open up a shop.

loans.use: To generate an increase in sales by purchasing additional clothes from Syria

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Cette  dame de quarante neuf ans (49)  vit dans le quartier d’agoè avec sa famille, elle est une revendeuse de produits de beauté dans son quartier de résidence, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000. Elle a besoin d’approvisionner son stock surtout en ces périodes de fêtes où les femmes achète beaucoup pour s’entretenir c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES.
Elle divorcée de son mari et a 06 personnes à sa charge qu’elle doit soutenir en travaillant dur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo A., 49, lives in the Agoè neighborhod with her family. She sells beauty products right in the district where she lives, and has been involved in this business since 2000. She needs to add to her stocks, especially in this festive season, where women spend more money on such beauty products, and for this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES.

She is divorced from her husband and is supporting 6 people, which means that she must work very hard indeed.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita M. is a 31-year-old tailor in the town of Kritipur. Her husband's name is Anil M., and he works in private office. In addition, she has two daughters: one is 13 years old and is in grade 8 in school, while the other is 11 years old and is in grade 5.

She opened her tailoring shop 3 years ago, and she notes that she specializes in making custom-fitted ladies dresses (e.g., Kurta Sulwar, which are very popular with Nepali women). Before she started her own business, Mrs. M. completed a 6-month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her home.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $225 in order to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. In turn, she expects to generate an increase in her shop's income, which she will use to improve her family's living conditions and to pay for her daughters' educations. In Nepal the cost of a good education is increasing, so Mrs. M. is saving her income to provide her daughters with such an education.

loans.use: To expand and improve her tailoring business by purchasing additional raw materials

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 23-year-old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh (in the southern suburbs of Lebanon) with his wife. For the past ten years, he has owned and operated a sewing factory. In particular, he sews and sells ready-to-wear clothes.

Omar requests a loan in the amount of $1,000 via Al Majmoua in order to purchase sewing machines. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan. Omar expects that the loan proceeds will enable him to improve his business by expanding his production capabilities. Omar feels that he is successful in this business because he has good management skills and lofty ambitions. When he first started his business, he did not have much cash, but his business has been doing well in recent years. In the future, he plans to expand his business further.

loans.use: To expand production by purchasing sewing machines

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh (in the southern suburbs of Lebanon) with her husband and their six children. Since 2004, she has been in the business of selling bread, “saj”, and “nargileh” (also known as “shisha” in Egypt). The saj is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections. The nargileh, meanwhile, is an ancient food tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East; in fact, nargileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, but it is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe, and other countries.

Mariam requests a loan in the amount of $1,000 via Al Majmoua in order to pay off her debt. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan. Mariam states that she is successful with her work because of her good behavior and the high quality of her foods (especially her bread). Her clients are primarily her friends and neighbors. She notes that she decided to open her business because of debts that had to be paid off. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by reducing her debt load

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 22-year-old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. For the past 1.5 years, he has been working as a barber.

Mahdi is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 via Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and new seats for his salon. This is the first time that he has sought a loan, but Mahdi hopes that the loan proceeds will help him improve his salon. He notes that his clients are primarily his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to expand his business and to open up a bigger salon.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing tools and new seats for his salon

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr:
ce monsieur de vingt huit ans (28) vit dans le quartier protestant à Lomé. il a ouvert un bar dans lequel il vend des boissons et des liqueurs, son bar s’appelle « COIN CHAUD », il fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et au point d’approvisionnement de la brasserie du Bénin. il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de  WAGES  et sollicite son premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec des cartons de liqueurs et de casiers de boissons.
il est marié mais n’a pas d’enfants.il pourra donc avec ce crédit s’entretenir et aider certains autres personnes de sa famille.
texts.en:
This young man of 28, lives in the Protestant district of Lomé. He has opened a little bar where he sells drinks and liquors. He calls his bar « COIN CHAUD » (Warm Corner), and he has been in this business since 2005. He does his buying in the big open-air market of Lomé and at the Bénin Brewery store. He has never had a loan from WAGES and is asking for his first in order to buy cases of liquors and crates of drinks.

He is married but has no children. With this loan, he will thus be able to support himself and help certain other members of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks

loans.name: Esam

texts.en:
Esam is a 21-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. He is a hairdresser, but he also owns a clothing shop. He notes that he decided to go into this line of business because of his experience in women's affairs.

Esam is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 via Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional beauty products

loans.name: Rawad

texts.en:
Rawad is a 26-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. For the past 16 years, he has been working as a barber.

Rawad is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 via Al Majmoua in order to decorate his shop. Notably, this is the third loan that he has sought, and he states that he always repays his loans on schedule. His prior loans have helped to support his business operation, which he started because he wanted to be on his own from a professional standpoint. In the future, he plans to open another shop.

loans.use: To improve his business by decorating his shop

loans.name: Gribinet

texts.en:
Gribineţ T. is a 48-year-old woman who lives in the village of Carabetovca in the Basarabeasca district. She is in the agricultural industry, and she notes that her family has 2.64 hectares of agricultural land. She has been working this land since 2001. She has a relative who has some machinery to make working the land easier, but much of the work is manual labor. Thankfully, her 17-year-old daughter assists her with some such manual work, including weeding.

Next year she wants to plant 0.5 hectares of vines, so she is requesting a loan via Microinvest. Importantly, the land is ready for vines to be planted. This is the first loan that she has sought from Microinvest. With the loan proceeds, she would like to purchase grafts of the vines.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing vines to plant

loans.name: Agob

texts.en:
Agob is a 63-year-old man who lives in Beirut (the capital of Lebanon) with his wife. For the past 24 years, he has owned and operated a coffee shop.

Agob is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 via Al Majmoua in order to provide him with some cash. Agob has been a microcredit client for seven years now, and he proudly states that he has always repaid his loans on time. His prior loans enabled him to generate income and to thereby improve his financial situation. Agob feels that his business is special because of his happy face and his business skills. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

loans.use: To provide the entrepreneur with some extra cash

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari is a 46-year-old widow who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her child. Mari has owned a shop for twenty-two years where she sells pastries and souvenirs. Mari is asking for a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua. She will use this loan to purchase supplies for her shop. This is her second loan cycle, and she has always paid on schedule. 
The previous loan helped her improve her business. Mari is exceptional because of the excellent quality and taste of her food. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She went into this business after her husband died in order to support her family. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for a pastry shop.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Amal is a seamstress and also owns a clothing shop. She has been in this business for fifteen years. Amal is asking for a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase fabric and sewing machines. This is her first loan.
Amal excels in this business  because she has a lot of friends and she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her family, friends, and neighbors. When she first started her business, she couldn’t afford a sewing machine, but with determination she has made her business a success. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and sewing machines.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Khalil has been selling computer accessories for eight years. He is asking for a loan of 1200 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a printer. This is  Khalil's first loan request.
When Khalil first started his business, he faced a lot of competition. Many other shops offered similar services, but he distinguished himself by his determination and good service. He also owes his success to the support of his friends. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a printer.

loans.name: Medhat

texts.en:
Medhat is a 27-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. He has owned a clothing shop for a year. Medhat is asking for a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase his inventory. This is his second loan cycle. He has always paid on schedule.

The loan has influenced his life in a good way. With it, he began a business selling sportswear and shoes. His prices are competitive, and sometimes he sells wholesale. He is planning to expand his clothing line beyond sportwear and shoes. In the future, he hopes to generate more income by offering a greater selection of men's clothing.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif is a 32-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has painted cars in a body shop for fifteen years. Afif is asking for a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to make some household repairs. This is his second loan cycle, and he has always paid on schedule.

loans.use: To make household repairs

loans.name: Hayedar

texts.en:
Hayedar is a 37-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. He sells cassettes, accessories, perfumes, and CDs in his shop. He has been in this business for ten years. Hayedar is aksing for a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Hayedar has been a microcredit client for five years now, and has always paid on time.
Previous loans helped him improve his professional and financial situation. Hayedar has succeeded by offering quality goods at  competitive prices.

loans.use: To purchase cassettes and CDs for resale.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 25-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their one child. He has been working as an auto mechanic for twelve years. Youssef is asking for a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase equipments for his garage. Youssef has been a microcredit client for four years now and has always paid on time.

loans.use: Youssef will use the loan to purchase equipments for his garage.

loans.name: Catana

texts.en:
Catana P. is 54 years old, and she lives in Basarabeasca district, Carabetovca village, in the Republic of Moldova. Her family has 2.64 hectares of agricultural land, plus an additional 0.5 hectares of agricultural land which belongs to her parents. She has been working this land since 2001, though she does not have technical agricultural skills; instead, much of the technical work is carried out by skilled workers from the village, even though she participates in much of the manual labor.

Next year she wants to plant many vine varieties. As a result, she is seeking a loan through MicroInvest in order to purchase vine grafts and cuttings.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing 700 cuttings of vines

loans.name: Mumtaz Abbas Ali Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 37 years old and married. She lives in the city of Borewala, in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has lived for the past 20 years. She completed school through the 6th standard. She couldn’t study further because she started learning art of stitching and embroidery from her mother. 

Her husband is A. A., who is a cobbler by profession. He has 20 years of experience in this business. Mumtaz helps him in this business by embroidering the shoes he makes. They have five children: four sons and one daughter. Her first two sons manufacture furniture. The other children are enrolled in a local school. She successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (colored thread, beads, and leather) the couple will use to manufacture shoes. 

She is the leader of three people asking for this loan as a group. Ghulam Fatima wants a loan to buy rugs for resale. Sobia Tariq wants a loan to buy computers. She plans to run a computer institute to make the children of her community computer literate. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for shoe making

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Cette dame de cinquante et un (51)  réside dans le quartier de djidjolé dans la ville de Lomé au Togo. Elle est très travailleuse et a pour activité la vente de céréales et de tubercules qui sont des aliments très consommés dans la cuisine Togolaise et servent  à préparer de la pâte du fufu et bien d’autres choses. Elle demande son premier prêt à) WAGES pour acheter 100 tubercules, un sac de maïs et un sac de riz.
Elle est mariée et a 05 personnes à charges.
texts.en:
This 51-year-old lady lives in the Djidjolé neighborhood of the city of Lomé in Togo. She works hard at her business of selling cereals and yams, foods that are much in demand for Togolese cuisine as they are used in preparing "fufu" (white yams pounded into something like mashed potatoes) and many other dishes. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 100 coco yams, a sack of maize, and a sack of rice.

She is married and is responsible for 5 persons.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Amna Ashiq Hussain Group

texts.en:
Amna baji is a 48-year-old married lady who resides in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house which she has been living in for the past 5 years. Amna baji is an uneducated lady, but she knows the importance of education; in fact, she believes that knowledge takes a man or woman from the earth to the sky. Her husband's name is A. H., and he is a policeman who works at the police station nearest to her community. Amna baji has two kids: one son and one daughter. Her son works in a factory, while her daughter is in the 3rd standard.

Amna baji has a medicine sales business. She has 6 years of experience in this business. Specifically, she buys medicines from the wholesale market, and she later sells such medicines to medical stores. She has already successfully repaid one prior loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for another loan to expand her medicine-selling business.

She is the group leader of four other members: (1) Shazia baji wants a loan to buy tools for repairs in connection with her motor workshop; (2) Sugran baji seeks a loan to buy animals (goats and buffaloes) to resell; (3) Shamim akhtar baji requests a loan to buy goods (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food business; and (4) Humaira bano baji would like a loan to buy medicine to resell.

This is a group loan: as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Notably, the members mutually guarantee one another's loans: so, if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional medicine to resell

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Cette dame de cinquante cinq (55) exerce dans le commerce de boissons.  Elle réside dans le quartier de Djidjolé et s’approvisionne aux points de dépôts de la brasserie du Bénin. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour répondre favorablement à la demande élevée surtout en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année. Avec ce crédit elle va acheter set (07) casiers de bière et sept dame jeanne (boisson locale).
Elle est mariée à BALENG qui est employé à air Zaïre, ils ont ensemble cinq enfants (05) à charge.
texts.en:
This 55-year-old lady has a business selling drinks. She lives in the Djidjolé neighborhood and buys her inventory at the Benin Brewery depots. She is requesting this first loan from WAGES so that she will be able to meet the higher demand during the end-of-year festivities. With this loan she will buy 7 crates of beer and 7 demi-johns of a local drink.

She is married to Baleng, who is an employee of Air Zaire, and they are raising 5 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Gbojouma

texts.fr:
Cette jeune demoiselle de 21 ans est très travailleuse et dynamique, elle réside dans le quartier hedzranawoè à Lomé au Togo. A ce jeune âge elle a déjà entamée son propre commerce qui n’est autre que la vente de tissus et de lins qui est très confectionné et utilisé dans la couture au Togo, elle exerce ce commerce de façon ambulante. La demande de tissus est très élevée en ces périodes de fêtes de fin d’année. Elle approvisionne son stock au grand marché de Lomé, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2007.
Gbodjonu est célibataire avec une personne à sa charge.
texts.en:
This young lady of 21 is very hard-working and dynamic. She lives in the Hedzranawoè neighborhood in Lomé, Togo. At this young age, she has already set herself up in business, selling fabrics and linens, which are much used in sewing clothing in Togo. She sells her wares as an ambulant sales person. The demand for fabrics is very high during this period of end-of-year festivities. She buys her inventory in the big open-air market in Lomé, and she began her business in 2007.

Gbojouma is single and is supporting herself and one other person.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabrics and linen

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina Q. sells poultry products at Taterm, near Elmina. Christina completed junior high.  She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver. Christina has been selling poultry items since 2006. She helps her husband meet household expenses and take care of the children's needs. She will use her loan to buy more poultry products for resale. She hopes to use the profits from her business to start building a family home on a piece of land she acquired with her husband.

She is shown holding a pack of frozen chicken thighs, which is one of the many poultry products she sells.

loans.use: To buy poultry products for resale.

loans.name: Catana

texts.en:
Catana M. is 25 years old. She lives in the village of Carabatovca, in the Basarabeasca district. Her main activity is industry and agriculture. Her family owns 2.64 hectares of agricultural land, which it inherited from parents. They have worked this land since 2006. 

The family does not own advanced agricultural equipment. She pays for mechanized plowing and sowing, provided by a village service. They take care of the manual work themselves and hire a journeyman to help with the weeding.  This year she planted 1.5 hectares of wheat. In spring she will devote an additional 0.5 hectares to a sunflower plot. She will use the loan to pay for mechanized plowing and sowing of her wheat fields, to buy 300kg of mineral fertilizers, and to buy sunflower seeds.

loans.use: To pay for mechanized plowing and sowing and to buy fertilizers and sunflower seeds.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr:
Cette jeune dame de vingt cinq (25) ans habite le quartier d’Agoè abové au Togo. Elle exerce le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et a même temps un bar qu’elle  appelé BAR OCEAN, elle exerce cette activité depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne au marché locale d’Agoè et au grand marché de Lomé. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de chez WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit pour  approvisionner son stock d’alimentation générale et des casiers de boissons.
Elle est mariée à monsieur ABBEY Kodjovi qui est un informaticien et ils ont ensemble 02 enfants. Avec son commerce  elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes du ménage.
texts.en:
This young woman of 25 lives in the Agoè Abové neighborhood in Togo. She sells various foodstuffs and, at the same time, has a bar that she calls BAR OCEAN. She has been in this business since 2005 and does her buying at the local open-air market in Agoè and the big market in Lomé. She has never received a loan from WAGES and is asking for this first one to expand her stock of foodstuffs and buy some crates of drinks.

She is married to Mr. Kodjovi Abbey who works with computers and they have 2 children together. With her business income, she helps her husband with the daily household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Cette dame de trente quatre ans (34) réside dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo à  Lomé au Togo, elle exerce le commerce de charbons depuis 1998 et s’approvisionne au marché local. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec vingt cinq (25) sacs de charbons de bois.
 Elle est mariée et son époux est un enseignant ils ont un (01) enfant à charge.
texts.en:
This thirty-four-year-old woman lives the Agbalépédo neighborhood of Lomé in Togo. Since 1998, she has bought and sold coal. She stocks up at her local market. She has never had a loan from WAGES before, and is requesting this first loan to supply her business with 25 sacks of charcoal. She is married to a teacher, with whom she has one dependent child.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is divorced and has 3 children. She completed junior high school. Janet sells a cornmeal known locally as "banku."  She serves the banku with fried fish and hot sauce. It is one of the most popular foods in the country. She also sells fresh fish at Taterm near Elmina, which she has done since 1998.

Janet uses her income to pay the children's school fees, the utility bills, and other family expenses. Janet will use the loan to buy maize (which she uses to prepare the banku), fresh fish, and other ingredients of the meals she sells. With the profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to save towards a house she wants to build for the family.

She is shown with some fresh fish set out for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize and fish.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Cette femme est très travailleuse et exerce dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle habite le quartier d’Agoè mimamadou. Elle est très dynamique et s’approvisionne pour son activité dans les marchés de la place. Son commerce marche bien et elle demande son crédit pour augmenter son stock de produits d’alimentation générale.
 Elle est mariée, son époux est un transitaire, ils ont quatre (04) personnes à charge, avec ce commerce elle compte aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a hard-working woman who buys and sells foodstuffs, and lives in the Mimamadou neighborhood of Agoè. She is an energetic woman, and buys the supplies for her occupation at local markets. Her business is going well, and she is requesting this loan to increase her stock of foodstuffs in general. She is married to a freight forwarder. They have four dependents. Through her business, she intends to help her husband with their household's daily costs of living.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa C. sells fish. She buys them directly from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for resale. She also sells gari, a cassava-based fritter. She buys sacks of freshly milled  cassava and extracts the starch from the cassava dough. She then fries the cassava dough to make the gari. Her business is located at Elmina. Theresa has been selling fish and making gari since 2002.

Theresa has a basic education.  She is married and has 4 dependents.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She helps her husband take care of the children's needs and meet other financial obligations. She will use her loan  to buy fresh fish for processing and also cassava for gari. She hopes to use the profits from her business to put her children through school.

She is shown with some sacks of milled cassava yet to be processed into gari.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and cassava

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes O. sells onions, peppers, and other foodstuffs at the new market in Elmina. Agnes has no formal education.  She is divorced and has 3 children. Agnes has been selling food at the market since 1990. She is responsible for  the children's school fees, utility bills, and family expenses. She will use her loan to buy more stock to meet the increasing demand. She hopes to reinvest the profits in her business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: To buy food for resale

loans.name: Zein

texts.en: Zein is a 37-year-old married man with three children living in Deir Kifa, in southern Lebanon. A car mechanic, he opened his own workshop in 1988. Zein started renovating his garage and he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy an automatic car lift for faster and better customer service.

loans.use: To buy a car lift for a garage

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem, a 47-year-old married man with four children, lives in Kfarhatta in southern Lebanon, where he has owned a small snack shop since 2007. Kassem has identified a potential opportunity to increase his income through the introduction of a pool table to the shop and so is asking for a loan of $1,000 to accomplish his plan.

loans.use: To buy a pool table for his business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijas menores de edad a las que mantiene económicamente. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300, aumentó su capital para comprar artículos de segunda mano para luego venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su esposo es el encargado de comprar los artículos usados y ella se encarga de venderlos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más artículos de segunda mano para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo.

Luz Marina desea seguir trabajando para que sus hijas continúen sus estudios y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a partner with Víctor Echave communal bank in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is twenty-eight years old and married. She has three daughters, all of whom are too young to be economically independent. The first loan she received was for S/. 300. She used it to increase her capital for buying secondhand items, which is what she sells. She has been working with the communal bank for almost four years. She tells us that her husband is responsible for buying used items, and that she is in charge of selling them. With this loan of S/. 2,000, which will be repaid in four installments, she will buy more secondhand items to sell. Luz Marina wishes to continue working so that her daughters can stay in school and pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing secondhand items

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is a fifty-two year old widowed mother of four children.  She has been taking care of her four children since the demise of her husband.  She says her youngest child is currently in their final year as a pupil in the junior high school. 

She works very hard to be able to provide for her family.  Margaret bakes bread and distributes it to retailers in her community.  She has been baking and distributing bread for over fifteen years.  She buys the baking ingredients from the city, Kumasi. 

Margaret wants to expand her business so that she can distribute to a larger number of customers.  She wants to take advantage of the Christmas festivities to raise more income to support her family.  

Margaret is in a group called ‘Maranatha’ Trust Bank in her community.  The members in this group guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan, and peer support to repay.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar, etc in bulk.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: A. Pascaline s’est marié avec AMOUSSOU Tossou Prosper. Elle est née le 3 avril 1953. Pascaline a un enfant qui vend la nourriture avec elle et qui a 38 ans. Pascaline n’est pas scolarisée, mais sa fille était éduquée, et elle aide avec son entreprise. Pascaline veut un crédit avec Alidé pour acheter la nourriture, les boissons frais, et le charbon. Elle achète son charbon au centre-ville et sa nourriture à Tokpa. Le crédit peut aussi aider avec les frais pour transporter ses produits.  Dans l’avenir, elle veut se débarrasser de la nourriture à cause du feu qui n’est pas bon pour le santé, et de vendre seulement le charbon et les boissons frais. Elle aussi désire d’acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Pascaline A. is married to Tossou Prosper Amoussou. She was born April 3, 1953. Pascaline has a child who sells food with her and who is 38 years old. Pascaline was not educated, but her daughter was, and she helps with the business. Pascaline wants a loan with Alidé to buy food, cold drinks, and coal. She buys her coal downtown and her food at Tokpa. The loan can also help with the transportation costs for her products. In the future, she wants to get rid of the food-making part of her business because of the cooking fire, which isn’t healthy; she wants to sell only the coal and cold drinks. She would also like to buy a plot of land to build her own shop.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cold drinks and food

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 41 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 4 hijos a los que mantiene económicamente.
Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300 aumentó su capital de inversión y compró mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes. Tienes casi 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará panetones y otros artículos para vender en navidad.
Nancy desea seguir trabajando para que sus hijos continúen sus estudios y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the "Víctor Echave" Community Bank in Puno. She is a 41 year-old widow and supports four children. With the S/. 300 from her first loan, she increased her investment capital and bought merchandise for her grocery store. She has been working with the community bank for almost three years. With this S/. 500 loan, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy panetons (fruit cakes) and other goods to sell at Christmas time. Nancy wants to keep working so her children can continue their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit cakes and other goods

loans.name: Association Ditorguine Agoe Zongo Group

texts.fr:
Cette association est Située dans le quartier Agoè Zongo dans la ville de Lomé (Togo), l’association DITORGUINE AGOE ZONGO est une association qui fut crée en 2005 et regroupe en son sein  trois (3) femmes dynamiques, toutes clientes de WAGES : madame D. sofi, S. Afi et A. yawa manthe. Elles sont toutes mariées avec des enfants à leurs charges. Cette association exerce dans trois types de  commerce : l’alimentation générale et boissons, les marmites en aluminium et les chaussures dames dans le marché d’Agoè Zongo et s’approvisionne au marché voisin d’accra au GHANA et aussi au grand marché de Lomé.
Cette association a déjà obtenu un (01) crédit de 50,000F auprès de WAGES qu’elle a remboursé sans problèmes, elles sollicitent ce troisième crédit pour agrandir leur stock de marchandises avec vingt marmites en Aluminium, des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huile, de tomates et de pâtes alimentaires et trente quatre paires (34) de chaussures pour dames.
texts.en:
Ditorguine Agoè Zongo is a business partnership based in the Agoè Zongo neighborhood of Lomé, Togo. It was formed in 2005 and comprises three energetic women, all clients of WAGES: Madames Sofi D., Afi S. and Yawa Manthe A.. They are all married with dependent children. They trade in three areas--general foodstuffs and beverages, aluminum cooking pots, and ladies' shoes--in the marketplace of Agoè Zongo. They purchase their stock at the nearby Accra marketplace in Ghana, and at the central market of Lomé. This partnership has already received one loan of 50,000 francs from WAGES, which they paid back without incident. They request this, their third loan, to increase their stock of merchandise with twenty aluminum pots, sacks of rice, drums of oil, tomatoes, noodles, and thirty-four pairs of ladies' shoes.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aluminum cooking pots, foodstuffs, and footwear

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” del distrito, provincia  y departamento de Puno. Tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que mantiene económicamente. 
Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300 compró productos de belleza y joyas para venderlos ya que es consultora de belleza y distribuidora de joyas. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que vive en casa alquilada con su familia.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tener más ganancias con las que  cubrirá las necesidades de su familia.
Yanet desea continuar trabajando para que sus hijos continúen sus estudios y sean profesionales
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the "Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo" Community Bank in Puno. She is 34 years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of 3 young children whom she supports. With her first S/. 300 loan, she purchased beauty products and jewelry to sell since she is a beauty consultant and a jewelery dealer. She has worked with the community bank for almost 2 years. She tells us that she lives in a rented house with her family. With this S/. 1,700 loan, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will purchase a larger quantity of beauty products to earn more income to cover her family's needs. Yanet wants to keep working so that her children continue their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary F. is fifty years old and married with six children, some of whom have completed high school.  The last born is currently in junior high school.  Mary lives with her husband and some of their children who are dependent in Atebubu. 

Mary is a baker.  She bakes bread in her backyard and distributes to bread sellers and some beverage sellers in her community.  She has been in this business for over seven years.  Mary says that as a way of cutting down on transportation costs, she has formed an alliance with other bread sellers who travel to the city to buy the materials in bulk and share among themselves accordingly. 

She wants the loan to buy materials in larger quantities.  

Mary is in a group called ‘Maranatha’ Trust Group in her community.  The members in the group guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support to one another to repay.

loans.use: To buy bread baking materials in bulk.

loans.name: Eyo Mawuli

texts.fr:
Cette dame de vingt cinq ans (25) habite le quartier d’Adidogomé.  Elle a appris le métier de la coiffure mais à côté de celà elle s’est engagée dans le commerce de produits de beauté pour pouvoir mieux  subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Elle a ouvert une boutique de tresse et coiffure qu’elle a nommée « COIFFURE DJODJINA » depuis 2004. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec des produits de beauté surtout en cette période de fêtes de fin d’année où les femmes achètent beaucoup de ces produits.
Elle est mariée avec monsieur AKOTA Yawo qui est maçon, ils ont ensemble trois enfants qu’ils ont à leurs charges.
texts.en:
This twenty-five-year-old woman lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. She has learned to be a hairdresser, and sells beauty products on the side in order to better meet her needs and her family's. In 2004, she opened a braiding and hairdressing salon called Coiffure Djodjina. She has never had a loan from WAGES, and requests this first one to stock up on beauty products in time for the end of the year, when there are many parties, for which women buy many such products. She is married to Mr. Yawo Akota, a mason. Together, they have three dependent children.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Florencia Corina

texts.es:
La señora Corina es socia del Banco Comunal "Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo" del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 74 años de edad, es casada y se encarga de apoyar a sus nietos que están en edad escolar.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió aumentó su capital y mejoró su local para atender mejor a sus clientes. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su esposo es una persona discapacitada y que ella se encarga de él con mucha dedicación.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, pintará su restaurante, comprará mesas e insumos para mejorar sus ventas durante las fiestas de navidad.

Corina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su esposo y a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Ms. Corina is a member of the Village Bank "Women United to Triumph" in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 74 years old, married and in charge of her school-aged grandchildren. With the first loan she received, Corina increased the amount of capital in her business and improved the condition of her restaurant in order to better serve her clients. Corina has been working with the village bank for four years and tells us that her husband is handicapped and that she cares for him with great dedication. With this loan of 3000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will paint the restaurant, buy tables and other goods to improve her sales during the holiday season. Corina wishes to continue working to support her husband and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and products for the restaurant

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana S. is forty-one years old.  She is married with three children who are currently in basic school.  She lives with her husband and children in Atebubu.  Atebubu is a farming community.  The inhabitants produce food crops like maize, yams, millet, beans, etc. 

Juliana is a hardworking woman who works to support her husband in taking care of the family.  She is a second hand textiles dealer.  She sells ladies’ clothes in her community market, and treks to nearby towns to sell as well.  She has been in business for eight years.  Juliana says she buys the textiles in bales from Kumasi, the regional capital town.  

It is her desire to buy more bales so that she can travel to other markets to do business.  She hopes the loan will help her to achieve her dream of giving her children a top quality education.  She hopes that she can increase her profit margin to help her husband take very good care of the family. 

Mary is in a group called ‘Maranatha’ Trust Bank in her community.  The members in the group guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk.

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr:
Cette dame âgée de cinquante cinq ans (55) habite le quartier d’adidogomé dans la ville de Lomé capitale du TOGO, elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale dans son quartier, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 1999 et s’approvisionne au marché local d’assiyéyé. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de chez WAGES et demande son premier crédit pour pouvoir réapprovisionner son stock et bien vendre.
Elle  a  trois (03) enfants qu’elle a à sa charge et avec les revenus de son commerce elle pourra bien prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
This fifty-five-year-old woman lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé, the capital of Togo, where she sells foodstuffs. This has been her occupation since 1999, and she buys her stock at the local marketplace of Assiyéyé. She has never had a loan from WAGES before, and requests her first one so she can restock and continue to sell effectively. She has three dependent children, and with the income from her business she will be able to provide well for her family.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu I. is thirty-five years old and married with three children.  She lives with her family in a town in Ghana called Atebubu.  Atebubu is a farming community.  The inhabitants produce food crops like maize, yams, millet, beans, etc.  Her first born has completed senior high school while the last two are in junior high school.  

She sells products like beans, soya beans, groundnuts, rice, etc and other food items like vegetable cooking oil.  She has been in business for twelve years.  Salamatu buys her cereals and other goods from surrounding villages and the farmers in her locality.  She sells in the local market on a table top.  

Salamatu says that food vendors come to her to buy in large quantities and so, wants a larger working capital to buy goods in bulk to be able to meet the demands of her customers. She, therefore, wants the loan for this purpose. 

Salamatu is in the “Do Good” Trust Bank group.  The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan

loans.use: To buy cereals – beans, rice, groundnuts, etc in bulk.

loans.name: Dani Justina

texts.es:
La señora Dani es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela” del distrito, provincia  y departamento de Puno. Tiene 41 años de edad, es separada y madre de 4 hijos estudiantes que mantiene económicamente. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/.300 compró productos de medicina natural para venderlos en su quiosco. Nos cuenta que inició su negocio hace 8 años en un quiosco y hace 3 años tomó en alquiler el local donde labora actualmente.  
Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más mercadería para ser vendida en las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo.
Dani desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Dani is a member of the "Flor de Canela" Community Bank in Puno. She is 41 years old, is separated, and is the mother of 4 school-aged children whom she supports. With her first S/. 300 loan, she purchased natural medicinal products to sell at her kiosk. She says that she started her business 8 years ago in a kiosk, and 3 years ago she rented the place where she currently works. With this S/. 500 loan, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will purchase more merchandise to sell for Christmas and New Year's. Dani wants to keep working to support her children in their studies so that they can have professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more natural medicines

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is forty-two years old and married with three children.  All her children are still in basic school.  Doris lives together with her family at Atebubu in Ghana.  Atebubu is a farming community.  The inhabitants produce food crops like maize, yams, millet, beans, etc. 

Doris loves fashion very much and, as a result, trades in jewels like earrings, necklaces and other fashionable accessories including beads.  The women in Atebubu adorn themselves with the beads.  She has been selling jewels for the last ten years.  

Doris buys her goods from Kumasi, a city in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  She sells her goods from house to house and also treks to nearby markets to sell. 

Doris wants to use the loan to buy jewels in bulk so she can trek to other markets. 

Doris is in a group called ‘Maranatha’ Trust Bank in her community.  The members in the group guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy jewels and other fashion accessories in bulk

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La señora Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y madre de un hijo que es estudiante universitario y que mantiene económicamente. Nos cuenta que tiene la intención de ampliar su negocio abriendo una sucursal de su librería y fotocopiadora. Tiene casi 3 meses trabajando con el banco comunal.

Con este préstamo de S/. 600, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará papel, toner y ampliará su negocio.

Eulogia desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su hijo a que termine sus estudios y llegue a ser profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eulogia is a member of the communal bank "Flor de Canela", in the district, province and region of Puno. She is 43 years old, single, and has one son who is studying in the university, whom she supports economically. Her goal to expand her business by opening another branch of her bookstore and photocopy business. She has worked with the communal bank for almost three months. With this loan of 600 soles, which will be repaid in four payments, she will buy paper and toner and expand her business. Eulogia wishes to keep working to support her son so he can finish his studies and start his career.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper and toner and expand the business.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Neé vers 1985 à Akpadanou dans la commune d'Adjohoun dans la vallée de l'Ouémé au sud du bénin, dame K. Odile est marié à kpanou Félix et mère d'un enfant. Elle vent des chaussures et des condiments dans leur domicile. dame K. est désireuse de renforcer son activité en cette période, elle  sollicite ce crédit.
texts.en:
Born around 1985 in Akpadanou in the Adjohoun community in the Ouémé valley in southern Bénin, Ms. Odile K. is married to Félix Kpanou and a mother of one. She sells shoes and seasonings from their home. Ms. K. would like to build her business and seeks this loan.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave”, distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno. Es viuda y madre D. 4 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo D. S/.500 aumentó su capital D. inversión y compró baldes D. pintura usados y latas D. aceite para vender en su puesto D. trabajo. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.
Con este préstamo D. S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más baldes usados y latas D. aceite para continuar con la venta en su puesto. 
Juana desea continuar trabajando para aumentar las ganancias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Víctor Echave” Community Bank in Puno. She is a widow with 4 children. With her first S/. 500 loan, she increased her investment capital and purchased used paint tubs and cooking oil tins to sell at her workplace. She has worked with the community bank for almost 2 years. With this S/. 500 loan, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will purchase more used paint tubs and cooking oil tins to keep up her sales. Juana wants to continue working so she can increase her business income.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paint tubs and cooking oil cans

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Née vers 1971 à Adjohoun dans la vallée dans le département de l'Ouémé au sud du Bénin, Dame K. Célestine est mariée Fooly Jonas. Ancienne revendeuse des produits divers, elle s'est maintenant reconvertis en vendeuse de pain. Aujourd'hui, elle fabrique du pain que les gens viennent chercher à la maison, dans l'optique d'accroitre son activité, elle sollicite ce crédit pour le renforcement de l'activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1971 in Adjohoun in the Ouémé valley in southern Bénin, Ms. Célestine K. is married to Jonas Fooly. Formerly a seller of miscellaneous items, she now sells bread. Today, she makes bread that people come to buy from her house. With the vision of increasing her business, she seeks this loan to reinforce the business.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of wheat flour

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos estudiantes, a los que mantiene. 
Con su primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300 compró golosinas para vender en el carrito que tenía para trabajar en la calle. Nos cuenta que ha vendido golosinas en un carrito hace 15 años y posteriormente construyó su casa donde desde hace un mes abrió su tienda.
Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará panetones y otros productos que se venden más en las fiestas de navidad.
Jacinta desea seguir trabajando para que sus hijos continúen sus estudios superiores y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jacinta is a member of the communal bank "Victor Echave" in the district, province and region of Puno. She is a 46-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are students and she supports. With the first 300 soles loan she received she bought sweets to sell from her street cart. She had been selling sweets from her cart for the past 15 years and then built her home, where just a month ago she opened up her store. With this 1,500 soles loan, which will be repaid in four payments, she will buy holiday breads and other products which sell during the Christmas holidays. Jacinta wishes to keep working so her children can continue their studies and one day begin their professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy holiday breads and other products.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosalina R. T. tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada, esta Señora tiene 2 hijos sus edades son un niño de 3 años y cursa el 1 nivel de preescolar y un niño de 9 meses, su esposo labora en salón de belleza, sus deseos son de prosperar en el negocio que tiene actualmente ya que este es el que le ha ayudado a salir adelante por lo que le proporcionado que sus hijos puedan estudiar, sus propósitos son de alcanzar la calidad en su negocio ya que existe mucha demanda de este tipo de negocio en el mercado por lo que su interés seria predominar fuertemente y los beneficios que obtendría de esto será tener su casa propia.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es un salón de belleza, la ubicación de su negocio es de hospital de emergencia 75 varas arriba, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, ella inicia este negocio en la casa de habitación de su Mama ya que su hermana tenia el negocio a su cargo por lo que cuando su hermana decide marcharse a otro país ella decide estudiar belleza e invertir en este negocio y es así como lo consigue, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de productos como: cremas para alisar el cabello, tintes, peroxido y tratamientos ya que sus clientes exigen la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosalina R. T. is 34 year old, married, and has two children, a 3-year-old son in his first year of pre-school and a nine-month-old boy. Her husband works in the beauty salon. Rosalina wishes to make her current business profitable, as it has helped her to prosper, and permitted her son to attend school. She strives for quality in her endeavors because the demand in the marketplace for this type of business is high. Rosalina is interested in making a good showing and to put her proceeds towards the purchase of her own home. The economic activity to which she devotes her efforts is a beauty salon located in an emergency hospital 75 yards away. She has had this business for ten years, starting out in her mother’s house, taking over from her sister who emigrated to another country. Rosalina decided to go to beauty school and invest in this business and that is how she got to where she is today. Since her customers demand quality products, the loan is for working capital intended for the purchase of products such as anti-frizz conditioners, hair dyes, peroxide and conditioners.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flavia Dionisia

texts.es:
La señora Flavia es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que mantiene económicamente. 
Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300 compró útiles escolares, termos y otros para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que es profesora en la ciudad de Ilave, lugar donde trabaja de lunes a viernes.
Con este préstamo de S/.2,100, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más útiles escolares para vender en la próxima campaña escolar en su puesto de trabajo.
Flavia desea continuar trabajando para que sus hijos continúen sus estudios y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Flavia is a member of the “Víctor Echave” Community Bank in Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and supports 3 young children. With her first S/. 300 loan, she purchased school supplies, thermoses, and other items to sell where she works. She has worked with the community bank for almost 4 years. She says that she is a teacher in Ilave, where she works from Monday through Friday. With this S/. 2,100 loan, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will purchase more school supplies to sell during her school's next term. Flavia wants to keep working so that her children can continue their studies and have professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for the next term

loans.name: Immaculée

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Dangbo dans le departement du plateau, K. Immaculée s'est mariée avec monsieur BOKO Geoffroy et de cette union est issue deux enfants Alain et Aline, des jumeaux  agés de 8ans et en classe de CE2.  Elle fait la location de baches et chaises lors des cérémonies et elle vend aussi des poissons frais congelés. Dame Immaculée avait commencé par les locations mais vu l'emplacement de sa boutique et  sur la demande de ses clients elle a sollicité  auprès de notre institution un second pret.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Dangbo in the Plateau department, Immaculée K. is married to Mr. Geoffroy Boko and has two kids, Alain and Aline, 8-year-old twins who are in the 3rd grade. She rents out tarps and chairs for ceremonies and sells frozen fish. Ms. Immaculée had started with just the rentals but given the location of her shop and her clients’ demand, she is seeking a second loan with our institution.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of fish and 20 chairs

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora  Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos menores de edad a quienes mantiene económicamente. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/.300 aumentó su capital de inversión para comprar prendas de vestir para venderlas en su puesto de trabajo. Nos cuenta que se desempeña como docente y que su esposo es transportista.
Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más prendas de vestir y productos que venderá en las fiesta de navidad.
Paulina desea continuar trabajando para aumentar sus ganancias y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paulina is a member of the communal bank "Victor Echave" in the district, province and region of Puno. She is 33 years old, married, and has two young dependent children. She used her first 300 soles loan to buy articles of clothing to sell where she works. She is a teacher and her husband works as a commerce carrier. With this 3,000 soles loan, which will be repaid in four payments, she will buy more articles of clothing and other products to sell during the Christmas holidays. Paulina wishes to keep working to increase her income and cover her family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing and other products

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Martha García tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Martha tiene 4 hijos de los cuales su hijo mayor de 45 años de edad trabaja por cuenta propia, otro de sus hijos que tiene la edad de 38 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, sus otra hija de 33 años de edad que cursa recientemente el 5 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 28 años que cursa el técnico superior, su esposo no labora debido a la edad avanzada que el posee, los propósitos para con su negocio es ampliarlo y transformarlo en un comedor donde pueda brindarle a los clientes almuerzo familiar y comida a la carta y en sus deseos esta tener una pulpería para tener una variedad de ingresos para enfrentar la difícil situación económica.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de comida en la que vende: desayunos, almuerzos y refrescos, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años esta actividad la realiza a diario, ella inicia este negocio con una pequeña mesita donde vendía frutas y verduras mas tarde decide improvisar con una pulpería por lo que empezó con pocas cosas pero debido a problemas personales decide realizar un viaje fuera del país por lo que no tuvo otra opción de encargarle el negocio a su hija por lo que cuando ella decide volver al país pero su negocio había decaído completamente y trata de comenzar de nuevo con otro negocio que seria la venta de comida que hasta los momentos es la que ha mantenido con firmeza para que no suceda lo que paso con su otro negocio ya que sus clientes son una variedad de personas tanto médicos, enfermeras y empleados de diferentes lugares, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de verduras frescas y frutas para la realización de sus refrescos naturales y carne fresca para la elaboración de sus diferentes comidas.
texts.en:
Martha García is 59 years old and is married. Martha has 4 children. Her oldest son is 45 and self-employed, her second son is 38 and self-employed, her 33 year-old daughter is studying the 5th year of secondary school, and her other son is 28 and studying for an Advanced Technical Degree. Her husband does not work due to his advanced age. Her proposal is to expand her business and turn it into a cafeteria where she can offer customers home-style cooking and a la carte meals. She also hopes to have a store so that she can have various incomes to meet the difficult economic situation. In her business she sells meals: breakfast, lunch, and refreshments. She has had this business for 10 years and works at it daily. She started this business with a small table where she sold fruits and vegetables. Then later she decided to put together a store, which she started with only a few items. However because of personal problems she decided to make a trip out of the country, and she had no choice but to leave her daughter in charge of the business. When she decided to return to the country her business had completely declined, and she tried to start over again with another by selling food. This is what she has been committed to until now, so that what happened to her other business does not happen again. She has a variety of customers like doctors, nurses, and employees from different places. The loan is for capital to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to make natural refreshments and fresh meat for making her different meals.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Née le 18 novembre 1973 à Cotonou, dame M. Mariama est originaire de DJOUGOU, mariée à Aziz OROUKPE, elle est  mère de trois enfants, Abdoul l'ainé agé de 10 ans est en classe de 6ème, Keita le cadet agé de 8 ans est en classe de CE2 et Alassane le benjamin agé de 06ans est en classe de CI. Tot les matins elle prepare du riz qu'elle va vendre au marché de l'abatoir de cotonou, afin de s'occuper les aprés midi elle a décidé de distribuer les tissus et foulards à ses voisines à crédit et de collecter les sous  par jour.Pour etre plus efficace dans ses activités elle a sollicité cet pret.
texts.en:
Born on November 18, 1973, in Cotonou, Ms. Mariama M. is originally from Djougou, is married to Aziz Oroukpe, and is a mother of three: Abdoul, the eldest, is 10 years old and in the 6th grade; Keita, the younger brother, is 8 and in the 3rd grade; and Alassane, the youngest, is 6 and in the 2nd grade. Every morning she makes rice that she sells at the butcher’s market in Cotonou. In order to fill her afternoons, she decided to sell fabrics and scarves to her neighbors on credit and collect the money day by day. In order to be more effective in her businesses, she is seeking this loan.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bags of rice, a bag of beans, 4 pieces of fabric and scarves

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Le jeune Abdoulaye F. exploite un cyber et un télécentre dans le populaire quartier de Kandé Banéto. Grâce à cette activité il arrive à gagner sa vie et à entretenir sa peite famille. Il sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Young Abdoulaye F. runs a cybercafé and a telecenter in the popular Kandé Banéto neighborhood. Thanks to this business, he manages to make a living and to provide for his small family. He's seeking this loan to increase his income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his income

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas la Triunfo” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera. 
Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300, compró insumos para su negocio de reparto de mazamorra. Tiene casi un año trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que trabaja repartiendo mazamorra por las mañana y además hace un año es socia de la farmacia donde trabaja. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, aumentará el stock de medicamentos de su farmacia y comprará más insumos para su negocio de reparto de mazamorra.
Bertha desea continuar trabajando para aumentar las ganancias tanto en su farmacia como en su negocio de mazamorra.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha is a member of the Women United in Triumph (“Mujeres Unidas la Triunfo”) Community Bank in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 29 years old and is single.

With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought supplies for her business of delivering mazamorra (corn porridge). She has worked with the Community Bank for almost a year. She delivers mazamorra in the morning and has also worked at a pharmacy for a year.

With this loan of 1,300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will increase her stock of medicines in her pharmacy and will buy more supplies for her mazamorra delivery business.

Bertha wants to continue working to increase her earnings in her pharmacy as well as in her mazamorra business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy medicines and supplies to make mazamorra (corn porridge)

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es:
Su nombre es Bonifacio Martínez tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es acompañado, Dona Bonifacio tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 18 años y cursa recientemente el 4 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 16 años que cursa el 3 año de secundaria, su compañera de vida labora como ama de casa, sus propósitos son de fortalecer su negocio ya que tiene 2 tipos de negocio como lo es venta de lotería y  su pulpería  por lo quiere que su negocio permanezca activo, en sus sueños esta darle las respectivas mejoras a su vivienda por lo que allí mismo esta ubicado su negocio y mejorar su calidad en ofertar sus productos para su clientes.
