Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. semillas, abono, remedios, azúcar, arroz, fideo y pago D. peones. Los sueños D. las socias es que sus negocios sean prósperos, producir en mayor cantidad, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, medicines, sugar, rice, noodles, and pay farmhands

loans.name: Francisa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca tiene 27 años de edad, habita del barrio Waspan Norte, en la capital de Managua, estado civil casada, tiene un hijo de 1 años de edad, los planes para su familia es terminar la construcción de su casa, algunas mejoras  en parte de la viviendas y cambiar el nivel de vida. Doña Francisca posee su  pequeño negocio de variedades como ropa, zapatos y otros con la experiencia de dos años   de comercialización, sus metas a largo plazo es expandirse a otras regiones del país. Gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra la compra nuevas y mayores cantidades de mercadería como. Zapatos, ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, prendas interiores, prendas de plantas y otros productos. El incremento de su inventario generara mayores utilidades, lo cual se beneficiara para dar sus abonos en tiempo y forma de pago
texts.en:
Francisca is 27 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Waspan Norte in the capital of Managua, is married, and has a one-year-old son. For her family, she plans to complete the construction of her home, make improvements on part of the house, and change her quality of life. Francisca owns her own small variety store which sells clothing, shoes, and other items. With 2 years of experience running her business, her long-term goal is to expand to other regions of the country. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic she will be able to purchase new and greater quantities of merchandise such as shoes, women's, men's and children's clothing, undergarments, and other products. The increase in her inventory will generate greater profits, which will benefit her by increasing her time and her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Modesta Isabel

texts.es: La Sr. Modesta tiene 44 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Waspan Norte, estado civil soltera, tiene cuatros hijos, tres son independiente y solo la hija de 17 años depende de ella, sus planes para su familia es mejorar la vivienda ofreciéndole un patrimonio seguridad. Doña Modesta tiene su pequeño negocio de variedades en donde ella vende productos de belleza, ropas para damas y caballeros en la zona norte de nicaragua, con diez años de experiencia en ventas viaja en los buses de Matagalpa a muchos kilómetros de Managua, pero las ventas son buenas, lo inicio con fondos propios, las metas para corto plazo de su negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta mediante la introducción de nuevos productos y nuevos mercados. Con la solicitud del   prestamos de Afodenic lograra comprar nuevos productos como: zapatos, platas, ropas para niños, juguetes para esta época, útiles escolares, ofreciéndole a su familia un porvenir mejor, seguro y protegido.
texts.en:
Señora Modesta is 44-years-old and lives in the Waspan Norte neighborhood. She is single and has 4 children: three are independent and only her 17-year-old daughter still depends on her. Her plan for her family is to improve her home so she can offer them a secure inheritance. Doña Modesta has a small business selling various products such as beauty products and clothing for women and men in the northern zone of Nicaragua. She has 10 years of experience in sales. She travels on the buses of Matagalpa, many kilometers form Managua, but her sales are good. She started her business with her own funds. Her short term goal for her business is to increase her sales volume by introducing new products and entering new markets. With this request for a loan from Afodenic, she will purchase new products such as: shoes, clothing for children, toys, and school supplies for the upcoming school year. In this way, she will offer her family a better future, which is secure and protected.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Iris Lanao Group

texts.en:
The Iris Lanao Village Bank (named for FINCA’s Executive Director) is maD. up of 23 members, who are beginning their fourth loan cycle. All of the group members are from the Chiara District, located one hour outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. Most of the local community members are farmers or raise animals. The group members are involved in a variety of different business activities. Some sell dry goods, small animals, food, sweets, grains, or firewood, while others are farmers.

Gabriela is 33 years old and married with two children. Gabriela has a store where she sells dry goods and vegetables. She also grows corn and potatoes, which she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Rosa is 36 years old and married with six children. Rosa has a store in the Kishuar community, located 30 minutes outsiD. of Chiara. She also farms and raises animals. Luzmila is 26 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. Luzmila raises guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy) and also buys guinea pigs from other farmers, selling them in the city of Ayacucho.

The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300 (US$ 100), 450 (US$ 150), 600 (US$ 200) or 900 (US$ 300) soles. "Iris Lanao" is requesting a total of 14,500 soles in loans. The loans will be used to buy animals, rice, sugar, sweets, firewood, clothing and grains. Some of the group members dreams are for their children to get an education, to expand their businesses, to get ahead in life and to have all the basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

El Banco Comunal Iris Lanao inicia su cuarto ciclo con 23 socias. Todas las socias son del distrito D. Chiara que se encuentra a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, la población se dedican a la agricultura y crianza D. animales. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes, animales menores, comida, ropa, golosinas, cereales, leña y la agricultura.

Como es el caso D. Gabriela que es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Gabriela tiene una tienda en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, además se dedica a la agricultura D. maíz, papa que venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Rosa es casada, tiene 36 años y 6 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en la comunidad D. Kishuar que se encuentra a 30 minutos del distrito, además se dedica a la crianza D. animales y agricultura.

Mientras que Luzmila es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 3 hijos, Luzmila se dedica a la crianza D. cuy, y también compra D. los diferentes pueblos y los venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles y 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 14,500 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. animales, arroz, azúcar, leña, golosinas, ropa y cereales. Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos estudien, ampliar su negocio, salir adelante y tener todo lo necesario.

loans.use: Buy animals, rice, sugar, sweets, firewood, clothing, and grains

loans.name: Lesbia De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Sra. Lesbia tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Villa  Reconciliación, casada, tiene dos hijos de 1 y 9 años de edad, el niño mayor cursa la primaria, los planes para su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y ofrecerle un patrimonio para su hijos. Doña Lesbia tiene su pequeño negocio de comediría desde hace cuatro años de brindarle a publico en general el servicio de comediría con ricos y variados platillo de comida, inicio confundo propios, pero requiere de una remodelación en  la infraestructura. Sus objetivos para su negocio es crecer creando nuevo locales siempre en la región de Managua aumentando sus utilidades. Con la solicitud  del  préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques y zinc para brindarle a sus cliente mayor seguridad y protección obteniendo preferencia.
texts.en:
Señora Lesbia is 28-years-old, lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, and is married. She has 2 children who are 1 and 9, and her son is in elementary school. Her plans for her family are to improve her quality of life and to build an inheritance to leave to her children. Doña Lesbia has had a small restaurant business for 4 years in which she offers delicious and varied dishes to the general public. She started with her own funds, but she needs to remodel her location. Her goals for her business are to grow, creating new locations in Managua and increasing her profits. With her request for a loan from Afodenic, she will purchase construction materials like: cement, iron, brick, and metal for her roof to offer her customers better protection so they will prefer her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel her location

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.en:
Zenobia is a member of the Kusikuy Village Bank. “Kusikuy” means “Be Happy” in Quechua. Zenobia is 43 years old and is married with six children who are 23, 19, 15, 13, 9 and 4 years old. Zenobia brings dry goods and household implements to regional markets to sell. She also buys grains, cheeses and animals like rams and pigs in these markets, which she pays a driver to bring back to Ayacucho for her. She resells the cheese and grains in the city, and slaughters the animals herself to sell the meat.

Zenobia is requesting a loan of 1650 soles to buy dry goods like rice, sugar and salt to take to rural markets to sell. 

Zenobia’s goal for the future is to start building her own house. She hopes to have enough money to get started in March. Zenobia is very proud because her daughter will graduate with her teaching degree on Monday, December 22.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and salt to sell in rural markets

loans.name: Lourdes Isabel

texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Sumaqcha (“Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Lourdes has a business selling plates, dishes, crystal ware and timepieces. She buys the items wholesale, either in Ayacucho or in Lima, and sells them from a tricycle. On Sundays, she sells at the Las Americas Market. Her business is 20 or 25 years old; she inherited it from her mother. She used to work with her mother, and now works with her husband. 

Lourdes is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy Christmas lights to sell for the holiday season. She always sells according to seasons; for example, she buys Christmas items now, and will buy pens, pencils and notebooks for back-to-school season in February and March. 

Lourdes’s goal for the future is to open a market stand so that she can sell her merchandise wholesale.

loans.use: Buy Christmas lights

loans.name: Jackelyn Nayadey

texts.en:
Jackelyn, a member of the Sumaqcha (“Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank, is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their one child. Jackelyn has a small transportation business renting out the two buses she owns to drivers for inter-provincial transport between the cities of Ayacucho and San Francisco. She has been running this business for the past three years, earning about $35 per day.

Jackelyn is now requesting a loan to add to some money she has saved up to buy another car. Her goal for the future is to create a larger transportation business of which she will be the sole proprietor, as she currently has several other partners in her business.

loans.use: To buy a car.

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: El señor Felipe Santiago R. S. tiene la edad de 46 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la señora es comerciante de productos AVON desde hace diez años, ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos los cuales estudian, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar la condiciones de vida, para darle un hogar a sus hijos. Este señor trabaja  como talador (servicios de moto sierra) desde hace veinte años, con el apoyo de su esposa ha logrado construir parte de su vivienda. Con esta solicitud es la séptima la cual va seguir mejorando su vivienda, para eso tiene que comprar materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, hierro entre otros para terminar su casa con las condiciones debida y segura para su familia
texts.en:
Señor Felipe Santiago R. S. is 46-years-old and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood, which is located in the town of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who has sold Avon products for 10 years. They have two children, who are in school. Felipe's plans for the future are to increase his quality of living to give a home to his children. He has worked as a logger (offering chainsaw services) for 20 years. With the support of his wife, he has managed to construct part of his house. With this request, which is his seventh loan, he will continue improving his home. For this he has to buy construction materials such as: sand, cement, and iron, among other things, to finish his house with decent and safe conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to finish building his home.

loans.name: Ketty Diana

texts.en:
Ketty is a member of the Sumaqcha (“Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi, and Ketty sells coca leaves near a busy intersection in the city of Ayacucho. Coca leaves are used to make tea or chewed for energy to ward off hunger, and to fight the symptoms of altitude sickness. She buys the leaves from ENACO (Peru’s National Coca Company) for 120 or 125 soles per 25-pound bag. She usually sells about 25 pounds per day and earns about 25 soles (US $8.30) per day. 

Ketty is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy more coca leaves, to have some maintenance performed on her motorcycle, and to buy new motorcycle tires. Her goal for the future is to buy her own car, hopefully in June or July of 2009. She would then rent out the motorcycle to another driver, and her husband would use the car as a taxi.

loans.use: Buy coca leaves, have maintenance done on motorocycle taxi, buy motorcycle tires

loans.name: Ana Yensi

texts.es: La señora Ana Yensi González L. tiene la edad de 22 años habita en el barrio Sanpedro ubicado en el Kilómetro. 16 ½ carreta hacia Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, ellos todavía no tienen hijos, el esposo de la señora trabaja por si solo.  Ya que ellos tienen una pequeña pulpería en la casa de habitación que con sus propios esfuerzos han logrado establecer. La señora Ana le ayuda a sus padres aunque no vivan con ellos, los objetivos hacia un futuro es logra terminar de construir su vivienda, ella desde hace dos años desempeña el cargo de cajera en las oficina de DISNORTE – DISSUR (unión FENOSA), la mayor dificultad que han tenido es la falta de financiamiento, con esta solicitud de préstamo es para hacer mejoras a su vivienda, va  a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un comienzo a su casa y poder gozar de una casa digna.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Yensi González L. is 22-years-old. She lives in the Sanpedro neighborhood, which is located on kilometer 16 ½ of the highway to Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband. They still don't have children, and her husband is self-employed. They have a small grocery store located in their home, which they managed to establish through their own efforts. Señora Ana helps her parents out even though they don't live with them. Her goal for the future is to finish constructing her home. She has worked as a cashier for two years in the office of DISNORTE-DISSUR (par of the FENOSA union). The biggest difficulty they have had is the lack of financing. This request for a loan is to make improvements to her home. She is going to purchase construction materials to begin working on her house and to be able to enjoy a worthy home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get clothing items to restock small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vegetable and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Fanny Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Fanny tiene 57 años de edad, estado civil casada su esposo	es comerciante, los planes para sus familia es remodelar su vivienda y que permita obtener mayor comodidad. Doña Fanny tiene su pequeño negocio una tienda donde se vende ropa, zapatos y otros, lo posee desde hace tres años lo inicio con fondo propio, sus metas para el futuro en el  negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta mediante nuevos productos. Con la solicitud del préstamo de Afodenic lograra comprar nueva mercadería como: zapatos, ropa para dama, caballero, niños, cosméticos, perfumería. Obteniendo mayor clientela y a la vez mayores ganancia y poder brindar a sus clientes las variedades y estilo de ropa, a si como la captación de nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Fanny is 57 years old and married. She is a salesperson; her plan for her family is to remodel her home so they can be more comfortable. Fanny has a small business - a store that sells clothes, shoes, and other things. She has had it for three years. She started it with her own money. Her goal for the future is to increase her sales by (offering) new products. With the requested loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, she will purchase new merchandise such as shoes, women's clothing, men's clothing, children's clothing, cosmetics, and perfumes. This will give her better clientele as well as better earnings and the ability to offer her customers a variety of clothes and capture new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothes for children and adults

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Alba tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el  bario 380 de la capital de Managua, estado civil soltera con un hija de 19 años de edad que esta estudiando la secundaria. Los planes para su familia es asegurarle un patrimonio a su familia, un porvenir sólido. Doña Alba posee su pequeño negocio de alquiler de cuartos y de parqueo nocturno anteriormente tenia una pulpería y después  tomo la decisión de cambiar el giro del negocio, trabaja desde hace diez años de  experiencia de atención al cliente. Los objetivos de su pequeño negocio es ampliar sus cuartos con la construcción de nuevos cuartos para mayor captación del mercado de clientes que requiera de un cuarto donde  pueda descansar .Con la solicitud del  prestamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como. Cementos, hierros, bloques, zinc y ladrillos. Para ofrecerle a su familia y cliente mayor comodidad, seguridad y protección y sobre todo un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Señora Alba is 51 years old and lives in the 380 neighborhood of Managua, the capital city of Nicaragua. Alba is the single mother of a 19-year-old daughter, who is currently in high school. Señora Alba's goal for her family is to leave them an inheritance and a secure future. Doña Alba runs a small business renting out rooms and providing parking at night. She used to have a general store, but decided to take a new direction with her business. She has ten years of customer service experience. Her goals for her small business are to build new rooms and expand her existing rooms so that she can appeal to larger sectors of the market of people looking for a room to rest in. With this loan from Afodenic, she will buy construction materials like cement, iron rods, concrete blocks, zinc, and bricks, in order to offer her family and her clients more comfort, security and protection and, above all, good service.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a new room

loans.name: Emilina Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Emelina tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Memorial Sandino, estado civil casada su esposo es albañil, tiene dos hijas de 12 y 17 años de edad, sus planes para su familia es brindarle un patrimonio seguro y con mayor protección. Doña Emelina tiene su pequeño negocio de variedades desde hace dos años, sus objetivos en el ámbito económico es aumentar el volumen de venta a través de nuevos clientes y ofreciéndole nuevos productos. Con la solicitud del préstamo de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cementos, bloques y ladrillos para terminar de construir su casa, y poder gozar de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Señora Emelina is 40 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She is married, and her husband is a builder. She has two children, who are 12 and 17 years old. Her plan for her family is to provide them with a safe, more protected future. For the past two years, Doña Emelina has had a small business, where she sells a variety of items. Her economic objectives are to increase her sales volume through gaining new clients and by offering new products. With this loan from Afodenic, she will be able to buy construction materials, like cement, concrete blocks, and bricks, to finish building her house so that she can enjoy a proper home.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish building her house

loans.name: Magaly Lucrecia

texts.es:
La Señora Magaly Lucrecia L. tiene la edad de 42 años, su estado civil es casada, Esta Señora tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son de 11 años su hijo mayor y cursa recientemente el 1 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 9 años que cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como docente de secundaria, en sus sueños esta el proporcionarle a sus hijos una casa propia para sus hijos para que estos no presenten problemas por el día de mañana, en sus deseos esta poseer un buen estado financiero para sufragar todos sus gastos necesarios, en sus propósitos esta ampliar su negocio para mantenerlo activo ya que hasta los momentos esta es su mayor fuente de ingresos.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es la siguiente donde fue la 4 sección 4 cuadras abajo ½ al sur 10 varas arriba, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 7 años, Doña Magaly inicia este negocio por la necesidad de conseguir un trabajo y su prima inicio el negocio con caramelos y galletas, pero debido a la poca afluencia de clientes que se presentaba en su cuadra decide cambiar de lugar el negocio pasando a manos de su prima Doña Magaly y así decide invertir en este que seria su nuevo negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de mas golosinas, granos básicos y gaseosas ya que la compra de estos la realiza donde se encuentre mas favorable los productos.
texts.en:
Señora Magaly Lucrecia L. is 42 years old and married with two children, who are 11 and 9 years old. Her older son just started his first year of middle school, and her younger son is in 4th grade. Her husband works as a middle-school teacher. One of Señora Magaly's dreams is to give her children a home of their own, so that this will not present a problem for them in days to come. She would also like to gain a steady financial standing in order to pay for all of her necessary expenditures. She wants to expand her business in order to keep it active, since her business is her main source of income at the moment.

For the past seven years, she has been running a general store, located about four blocks south of the old "Section 4." Doña Magaly launched this business when she was looking for a job. Her cousin actually started the business in another location selling caramels and cookies, but there were not very many customers in that area, so she decided to move the business and hand it over to her cousin, Doña Magaly. This is how Doña Magaly came to invest in her new business.

She will use her loan for more sweets, basic grains, and sodas, which she buys from the place she considers to have the best offering of products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets, basic grains and sodas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients and items for her grocery business

loans.name: Mireya Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mireya del Socorro O. tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Mireya tiene 2 hijas de las cuales su edades son las siguientes su hija de 14 años edad cursa el 6 grado de primaria y su hija de 4 años que cursa el 3 nivel de preescolar, su compañero de vida labora como chofer de carga pesada, sus propósitos son de darle una mejor educación a sus hijas ya que estas tienen  problemas de aprendizaje, en sus deseos esta seguir adelante con su negocio por lo que tiene que mantenerlo activo ya que este le ha generado ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijas, en sus sueños proporcionar estabilidad y seguridad a sus hijas para un futuro.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos en la que vende productos como: perfumes, cremas, lociones y otros, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 6 años, su negocio inicia por una consejera de la empresa avon que le hablo de las diferentes formas de vender los productos  por lo que decide ingresar a este tipo de negocio por lo que le gusto y se propuso que este pasaría a formar parte de su trabajo y así obtiene este medio generador de ingresos para su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compras de sus productos en las diferentes casas comerciales como lo es: perfumes, talco, brillos y cremas.
texts.en:
Señora Mireya del Socorro O. is 33 years old and lives with her partner. She has two daughters, who are 14 and 4 years old. Her older daughter is in 6th grade, and her younger daughter is in Level III of preschool. Her life partner is a truck driver who moves heavy loads. Her goal for the future is to give her daughters a better education, since they both have learning disabilities. She wants to continue moving forward with her business. She needs to keep the business active, since it has provided her with the income she needs to help her daughters get ahead in life. One of her dreams is to give her daughters more stability and security for the future.

Señora Mireya sells cosmetics like perfumes, creams, lotions and other products. She is an ambulatory vendor, and has had her business for the past six years. She started it thanks to a representative of the Avon company, who told her about the different ways to sell Avon products. So she decided to give it a try, found that she enjoyed the work and decided to make it a part of her job. Her work now generates income for her family. She will use her loan as working capital to buy her products (perfume, talc, polishes and creams) from different stores.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy creams, polishes, talc and perfumes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Denis Leonel

texts.es:
El Joven empresario Denis Leonel García Hernández tiene la edad de 21 años, su estado civil es casado, este Joven tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 2 años y recientemente no estudia, su compañera de vida labora de comerciante, sus propósitos son de aumentar su negocio en una variedad de productos y proporcionar variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes que en sus deseos esta realizarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que tiene que dejarle a su hijo su casa para que este no sufra necesidades para el día de mañana, también en sus propósitos esta proporcionarle a su hijo un futuro en los estudios ya que quiere darle una buena educación y proporcionarle la educación que necesita para su formación.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la comerciante y vende los productos como: carne de pollo, carne de res y granos básicos, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, el inicia este negocio por su familia desde muy pequeño Denis ayudaba a su familia en el negocio al paso del tiempo su familia deciden que Denis administre el negocio y es así como pasa a formar de el por lo que decide realizar financiamientos para que su negocio obtenga toda la variedad de sus productos y poderle proporcionar a los clientes lo que ellos necesitan, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita aumentar su producción en sus productos de carne como lo es de pollo y de res y los grano básicos ya que en estos días festivos requieren de ambos productos necesarios para el consumo diario y agradece trabajar con la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas que le brindan este tipo de oportunidad para que siga adelante.
texts.en:
The young entrepreneur Denis Leonel G. H. is 21 years old and married with one two-year-old son. His life partner works in commerce. Denis wants to expand his business by offering a larger volume and wider variety of products. He also wants to make home improvements, so that he can leave his home to his son someday and his son won't have to suffer from unmet needs tomorrow. He would also like to provide his son with an academic future by offering him the good education that he needs in his formative years.

Denis works in commerce selling products like chicken, beef and staple grains. He has had his business for the past three years, and originally founded it to help his family. Since he was very young, Denis has helped his family with their business, and as the years went by they decided to turn the administration of their business over to Denis. Denis then decided to start taking out loans in order to begin offering a wider variety of products and give his clients everything they need. He will use his loan as working capital to help him increase his production of chicken, beef and staple grains for the holiday season. He is grateful to Fundacion Leon 2000 and its partner organizations for offering him this opportunity to continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of live chickens to slaughter and retail

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La Señora Josefa P. tiene la edad de 57 años su estado civil es soltera, Doña Josefa tiene 7 hijos de los cuales solo 2 de sus hijos dependen de ella que tienen las siguientes edades un niño de 11 años de edad y cursa recientemente el 3 grado de primaria y su otra hijo de 14 años que cursa 1 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son de aumentar en su negocio para que este progrese y se mantenga de forma activa ya que este su mayor ingreso que tiene hasta los momentos, sus deseos son de instalar un negocio lugar estable ya que no posee las condiciones necesarias para instalarlo y se la hecho un poco mas difícil por tener que mantener 2 negocios como lo es la repostería y la venta de ropa que ha sido uno de sus mayores ingresos para su familia y para ella.


La actividad económica es la de repostería y mercadería en general por lo que vende los productos de: pantalones, camisas, ropa interior y camisas para dama, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 4 años, Doña Josefa inicia su negocio por su hija quien fue la responsable de enseñarle este negocio ya que su hija vivía en honduras y aprendió esta profesión  en este país y así Doña Josefa se instruye en este oficio y lo adquiere como su medio de trabajo por lo que y trata de balancear ambos negocios tanto la venta de ropa y el de repostería, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita comprar mas ropa por la temporada festiva y mas ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos como lo es harina, azúcar, huevo y leña y agradece tanto a Fundación León 2000 como a las organizaciones amigas que le ayudan a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa P. is 57 years old and single. She has 7 children, 2 of whom are still dependent upon her, and they are an 11 year old son who recently completed 3rd grade of primary school and another son age 14 who finished 1st year of secondary school. Her goals are to expand her business so that it grows and in this way she remains active as this has been her greatest income lately. Her wishes are to open a business in a stable locale as she doesn’t have the necessary conditions to open it. She has found it difficult to maintain 2 businesses, which are a bakery and selling clothing, which has been one of the greatest sources of income for her and her family. Her work involves the bakery and general merchandise, where she sells items such as pants, shirts, women’s underwear and shirts. It is located in her home, and she has had this business for 4 years. Josefa began this business because her daughter was the one who showed her this business as her daughter used to live in Honduras and learned this work in that country. So Josefa entered into this business and balances now both the bakery and clothing selling. The financing is for working capital so she can buy more clothing for the holiday season and more ingredients to make her products, such as flour, sugar, egg, and firewood. She thanks Fundación León 2000 and other supportive organizations that help her be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy clothing and ingredients to make baked goods

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La emprendedora Señora de nombre Luz Marina R. M. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es soltera Doña Luz tiene 1 hija que tiene la edad de 32 años que labora como doctora, sus deseos son de sacar adelante a su familia para que su hija siga profundizando mas en su carrera y así pueda obtener un mejor porvenir para ella, sus propósitos son trabajar muy fuertemente con su negocio para llegar a establecerse de una forma en la que sus clientes puedan recibir una mejor atención enfocados en sus productos por lo que este ocupa su mayor atención.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de Cosméticos y productos online 
la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, ella da inicio a su negocio estableciendo una pulpería en la que vendía productos de la coca cola y con los ingresos que obtenía de este negocio decide ahorrar para establecer otro negocio como lo es la venta de ropa y de cosméticos ya que con este prevalece mas tiempo y decide quedarse con el negocio de la venta de ropa, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar las compras de sus productos en las diferentes casas distribuidoras de los productos ya que tiene que viajar hasta Managua para realizar la compra.
texts.en:
Businesswoman Luz Marina R. M. is 51 years old and single. Luz has one daughter who is 32 years old and works as a doctor. Her wishes are to help her family get ahead as her daughter is continuing to grow in her career, and in this way she can provide a better future for her. Her goals are to work very hard in the business to establish herself in a way so that her customers receive the best attention, focused on the products which she offers today. Luz sells cosmetics and online products. She is a traveling vendor and has sold for 20 years. She began her business establishing a small convenience store where she used to sell Coca-Cola products and with the income she made from this business she decided to save and establish another business selling clothing and cosmetics and has stayed with this for quite some time, then decided to stop selling clothing. The financing is for working capital so that she can make purchases of her product from different distribution houses, and she has to travel as far as Managua to make her purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock a small grocery store

loans.name: Karen Lisseth

texts.es: La Sr. Karen tiene 22 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, estado civil casada su esposo trabaja para una empresa estatal, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, los planes para su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida mediante la solides de su negocio. Doña Karen tiene su negocio de variedades con la experiencia de un años brindando servicio al publico en general, lo inicio con fondo propios, sus metas en el ámbito económico es incrementar el volumen de su venta mediante la comercialización de nuevos y variados productos. Con la solicitud del préstamo de Afodenic lograra comprar productos como: joyas, perfumes, zapatos, ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, y poder ofertar a sus clientes
texts.en:
Karen is 22 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She is married, her husband works in a state-owned business. She has a 3 year old son, and the plans for her family are to improve their quality of life through her business. Karen sells a variety of general merchandise and has provided this service to the public for a few years. She began with her own savings, and her goals in this economic climate are to increase the volume of sales by selling new and varied products. With the loan from Afodenic she will be able to buy products such as jewelry, perfume, shoes, and clothing for women, men and children to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of clothing, shows, perfume and jewelry

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave”, del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Es casada y madre de 2 hijos que mantiene económicamente. Sonia nos cuenta que es el primer préstamo que solicita y lo hizo para ayudar a su hija. Tiene un mes trabajando con el banco comunal. Se dedica a la compra y venta de cocinas.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mercadería para vender en navidad.
Sonia desea continuar trabajando para que su hija culmine sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the community bank “Víctor Echave”, in the district, province and department of Puno. She is married and the mother of 2 children whom she supports. Sonia told us that this is her first loan and that she is borrowing in order to help her daughter. She has been a member of the community bank for 1 month. She buys and sells stoves. With this S/. 500 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy merchandise to sell during the holidays. Sonia wants to continue working so that her daughter can finish her university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stoves.

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: El señor Erick Antonio Espinosa C. tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio santa Rosa ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a su familia, el es soltero, pero tiene a cargo una niña de nueve años que actualmente estudia su primaria, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, él desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de zapatos usados y reparacion es un trabajo que desde horas muy temprana llega a su puesto para poder ofertar sus ventas,  la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento para poder incrementar su negocio ; el solicita el apoyo de nuestra financiera para poder comprar tres pacas de zapatos y poco a poco incrementar su inventario , el sueño de don Erick es llegar a establecer una tienda.
texts.en:
Erick Antonio Espinosa C. is 36 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Santa Rosa, in the town of Masaya, with his family. He is single, but is responsible for a 9-year old girl who is in elementary school. His plans for his family are to improve his living conditions, for the past 2 years he has been selling used shoes and making shoe repairs, work which starts very early in the day as he opens his stand to begin selling. His greatest obstacle is the lack of financing to build his business. He is requesting the help of our financial institution in order to buy three bales of shoes and slowly build his inventory. Erick's dream is to be able to open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of used shoes to increase his inventory

loans.name: Bethy Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Bethy Consuelo tiene 59 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Terminó secundaria y estudió Cosmetología, profesión que le sirve muchísimo, manifiesta.
Se casó y tiene 7 hijos, 4 mujeres y 3 hombres, de los cuales viven 5, murió un varón y también una mujer quien le dejó un nieto. Un hijo, su nieto y su hijo mayor que tiene 39 años que es excepcional, dependen económicamente de ella.
Bethy tiene un salón de belleza que funciona en su casa, además cose mandiles para las vendedoras de los mercados.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en su salón.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en una máquina de cortar pelo.
Bethy sueña con que haya completa paz en su familia.
Fecha de desembolso del último crédito: 13 de diciembre de 2008. 
Tasa de interés mensual:  3, 50 %.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bethy Consuleo is 59 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank “Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II” and lives in the Florencia de Mora district, Trujillo province, La Libertad state, Peru. She finished secondary school and studied cosmetology, and profession that serves her well. She is married and has 7 children, 4 daughters and 3 sons, of whom 5 survive, a son died and also a daughter who left her a grandson. One son, her grandson, and her oldest 39 years old son who is exceptional, depend economically upon her. Bethy has a beauty salon in her home, in addition she sews aprons for the sellers in the markets. With the first loan for S/.300 which was repaid in 4 payments she invested in her salon. With this loan for S/.500, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy invest in a machine for cutting hair. Bethy dreams of having complete peace in her family. The loan was dispersed on December 13, 2008 Monthly interest rate: 3.5%

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a machine for cutting hair

loans.name: Diana Paola

texts.es:
La señora Diana Paola tiene 21 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió el primer ciclo de Educación Inicial, pero al tener su hijita y convertirse en madre soltera tuvo que dejar de estudiar para poder trabajar. Su niña aún tiene 11 meses.
Su negocio consiste en vender productos de belleza de manera ambulante y en su propia casa.
El primer crédito fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió para iniciar su negocio.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas,  invertirá en stock para la Navidad.
Diana sueña con tener su negocio propio y habilitar su casa para poder poner un negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Diana Paola is 21-years-old and belongs to the communal bank "Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II" (United for a Better Future II), located in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad in Peru. She studied through the first cycle of early childhood education, but upon having her little girl and becoming a single mother, she had to stop studying to be able to work. Her daughter is 11-months-old. Her business consists of selling beauty products as a street vendor and in her own home. Her first credit of 300 nuevos soles was paid off in 4 months, which she invested in starting her business. With this credit of 1,200 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in products for the Christmas season. Diana dreams about having her own business and fixing up her house to be able to accommodate her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in clothing to replenish a small store

loans.name: Doris Elena

texts.es:
La señora Doris Elena tiene 49 años de edad, es la tesorera del Grupo Solidario Las Azucenas de Villa Hermosa, pertenece al comedor popular Elian Karp y vive en el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
De niña vivió en un caserío llamado La Lucma, perteneciente a Contumaza del departamento de Cajamarca. En dicho lugar perdió a su madre, razón por la cual, nadie se preocupó para que continuara sus estudios de secundaria, por lo cual solamente estudió educación primaria. Se casó a los 19 años y tiene 9 hijos, 6 hombres y 3 mujeres, de los cuales 4 son estudiantes.
El negocio consiste en la venta de comida los días feriados y los demás días se dedica a trabajar para el comedor popular. Doris, como toda mujer emprendedora, no se contenta con lo que gana en las comidas, también cria, conejos, pollos y patos, los cuales vende.
El primer crédito fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas y lo invirtió en 2 sacos de arroz para sus comidas, se inició en la cria de conejos y compró una pareja.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en alimento para animales de corral y también para sus comidas de fines de semana.
Doris sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doris Elena is 49 years old and is the treasurer of the Solidarity Group Las Azucenas de Villa Hermosa, she belongs to the popular diner Elian Karp and lives in the district of Huanchaco, department of La Libertad, Peru. When she was a kid, she lost her mother and nobody took care of her education, so she didn't finished school. She married when she was 19 years old and she has 9 kids, 6 sons and 3 daughters, 4 of them are students. She sells food on holidays and the rest of the days she works at the popular diner. Doris like any good business women is not happy just selling food, she also raises bunnies, chickens, ducks and sells them. With her first loan of S/.300 cancelled in 4 quotes she invested on 2 sacks of rice for her foods, and she started raising bunnies. With this new loan of S/.500, which will be paid on 4 quotes, she will invest on buying animal food and supplies to prepare her dishes during the weekends. Doris dreams on seeing her kids as successful professionals one day.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest on buying food for animals and supplies to prepare her dishes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth tiene 56 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero por no contar con los debidos medios económicos no pudo continuar estudiando. Se casó a los 28 años y tuvo 5 hijos, 2 hombres y 3 mujeres, pero ahora tiene solamente 4 hijos porque una hija falleció. Los 4 hijos dependen de la pareja porque aún son estudiantes.
Elizabeth elabora y vende tamales en las tardes. Se sienta al costado de su amiga que vende pan, los clientes se sienten provocados por los tamales para el lonche y lo compran. Esta actividad lo realiza de manera ambulatoria.
El primer crédito fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas y lo invirtió en comprar manteca y maíz.
Con este crédito de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en todo lo que sea necesario para tamales.
Elizabeth sueña con tener una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth is 56 years old and belongs to the Community bank of United for a Better Future II, and lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, department of Libertad, Peru. She finished high school but couldn't keep on studying because of lack of economic resources. She married when she was 28 years old and had 5 children 2 sons and 3 daughters, but now she only has 4 children because one of her daughters died. The 4 children are still dependents, because they are all still in school. Elizabeth works and sells tamales in the afternoon. She sits next to a friend who sells bread, the clients then get tamales for their lunch when going to buy bread. She works on this on the streets. Her first credit was for S/.300 which was cancelled in 4 quotes and invested it on buying butter and corn. With this new loan for S/.800 which will be cancelled in 4 quotes too, she will invest on all supplies necessary to create her tamales. Elizabeth dreams on having a great business one day.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest on the preparation of tamales

loans.name: Francisca Salome

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Salome P. Ángeles tiene 42 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el primer año de secundaria y ya no continuó estudiando porque se embarazó a los 15 años. Es madre soltera de un hijo que ya le ha dado 2 nietos. Vivió un tiempo en Argentina, pero la crisis de ese país la hizo regresar, en el tiempo que regresó Argentina tenía una economía mucho más baja que la nuestra.
Francisca vende productos de belleza de diferentes líneas en su casa, en instituciones, para amistades y familiares.
Con el primer crédito que fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, invirtió en la compra de productos para tener stock.
Con este crédito de S/. 500 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, nuevamente invertirá en stock.
Francisca sueña con tener una casa muy linda.
texts.en:
Ms. Francisca Salome P. A. is 42 years old. She is a member of the United Communal Bank for a Better Future II and lives in the Florencia de Mora district of the Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Peru.

She went to school through her first year of high school, then discontinued her studies because she became pregnant at the age of 15. She is a single mother of one son, who has already given her two grandchildren. She lived for a time in Argentina, but crisis in that country forced her to return. At the time of her return, Argentina had an economy much lower than ours (meaning Peru).

Francisca sells different lines of beauty products out of her home, through other institutions, to her friends and to her family. With the first loan of 300 soles (~$100), which was paid back in four installments, she invested in the purchase of products for her stock. With this loan of 500 soles (~$175), which will be paid back in four installments, she will invest once again in her stock of products.

Francisca dreams of having a beautiful house.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in beauty products

loans.name: Frescia Doris

texts.es:
La señorita Frescia Doris tiene 25 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Azucenas de Villa Hermosa y vive en el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de la Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero debido a la falta de recursos económicos es que no continua estudiando, pero piensa auto sostenerse. Es soltera y trabaja en el taller de la señora Selena Castro en las galerías Don Carlos en el stand 293 frente al mercado mayorista de Trujillo.
El primer crédito fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, el cual lo invirtió en telas para confeccionar polos y venderlos.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, volverá a comprar telas para confeccionar polos deportivos.
Frescia sueña con tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Frescia Doris is 25 years old and belongs to the Grupo Solidario Azucenas in Villa Hermosa. She lives in the Huanchaco district in the Trujillo province in Libertad, Peru. She completed secondary school but due to a lack of financial resources she did not continue, but she wants to support herself. She is single and works in Selena Castro's workshop in the Don Carlos gallery, at stand number 293 in front of the wholesale market in Trujillo. Her first loan was paid in 4 payments and she used it to buy material to make sports jerseys and sell them. With this second loan, which she will also pay in 4 payments, she will once again buy material to make sports jerseys. Frescia dreams of having her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to make athletic jerseys to sell

loans.name: Gladis Esther

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Esther tiene 40 años D. edad, es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito D. Florencia D. Mora, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio primaria completa, pero por razones D. salud no continuó estudiando más. Se casó a los 17 años y tiene 4 hijos, 2 hombres y 2 mujeres, todos estudiantes.
El negocio se ubica en la esquina D. su casa y consiste en la venta D. raspadilla, pasteles, gelatina por la mañana, por la tarD. mazamorra y por la noche hamburguesas. 
El primer crédito fue D. S/. 200 cancelado en 4 cuotas, con lo que compró azúcar, hielo y otros materiales.
Con este crédito D. S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en comprar material para la mazamorra y hielo para raspadilla.
Gladys sueña con vivir feliz rodeada D. toda su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys Esther is 40 years old and is the president of the United Communal Bank for a Better Future II. She lives in the Florencia D. Mora district in the Province of Trullio in Libertad, Peru. She finished elementary school but for health reasons she did not continue studying. She got married when she was 17 and has 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls, all of whom are students. She has a business located at the corner near her home where she sells snow cones, cakes, jello in the morning, mazamorra [a type of corn porridge in Peru] in the afternoon and hamburgers at night. Her first loan for 200 soles, paid in four payments, was used to buy sugar, ice and other materials. With this loan of 1,700 soles, which will also be repaid in 4 payments, she will invest in materials to make mazamorra and ice for snow cones. Gladys dreams of living happily surrounded by her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make corn porridge and ice for snow cones

loans.name: Govana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Govana Elizabeth tiene 29 años de edad, pertenece al Banco comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando porque se caso a los 21 años. Tiene 2 hijos, una niña de 8 años y un niño de 3 años.
Tiene una bodega donde vende golosina, gaseosa y cerveza, se ubica en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300, cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró gaseosas y galletas.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en cerveza, gaseosa y gelatina para las fiestas de Navidad.
Govana sueña con tener una tienda muy grande.
texts.en:
Govana Elizabeth is 29 years old and belongs to the United Communal Bank for a Better Future II. She lives in the Florencia de Mora district in the province of Trujillo in Libertad, Peru. She finished secondary school but did not continue studying because she got married when she was 21. She has 2 children, an 8 year old girl and a 3 year old boy. She has a store in her home where she sells candies, soda and beer. She paid her first loan of 300 soles in 4 payments and used it to buy soda and cookies. With this loan of 1,700 soles, which will also be paid in 4 payments, she will buy beer, soda and jello to sell during the Christmas holidays. Govana dreams of having a really big store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer, soda and gelatin to sell

loans.name: Gumercinda Praxedes

texts.es:
La señora Gumercinda Práxedes tiene 48 años D. edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Bendecidas II y vive en el distrito El Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió educación primaria, pero no continuó estudiando debido a la falta D. apoyo económico. Se casó D. 16 años y tiene un solo hijo. 
Gumercinda tiene un negocio D. venta D. calzados según la estación, especialmente zapatillas.
Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró 2 docenas D. zapatillas y logró colocarlas a un buen precio.
Con este crédito D. S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, nuevamente comprará zapatillas por docenas  y venderá por pares.
Gumercinda sueña con tener un puesto o tienda para tener donD. vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Gumercinda Praxedes is 48 years old. She belongs to the Blessed Women Communal Bank II and lives in the Porvenir district in the Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Peru.

She studied elementary education, but she didn't continue her studies due to lack of financial aid. She married at the age of 16 and has one son.

Gumercinda has a business of selling season-appropriate footwear, especially sneakers.

With the first loan of 300 soles (~$100), which was paid back in four installments, she bought two dozen sneakers and was able to sell them for a good price.

With this loan of 500 soles (~$175), which will be paid back in four installments, she will buy several more dozens of sneakers and sell them by the pair.

Gumercinda dreams of having a place or a store where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy several dozens of sneakers

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La señora Karina F. I. tiene 27 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Azucenas de Villa Hermosa y vive en el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Karina vivía en la Selva en la provincia de Tarapoto,  estudió secundaria, pero no continuó estudios superiores por motivos económicos. Se casó de 19 años y actualmente tiene un hijo de 7 años y otro de 10 meses.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de zapatos o ropa de acuerdo a la época. 
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que fue cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró ropa y calzado.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en juguetes y sandalias.
Karina sueña con tener un negocio con capital propio.
texts.en:
Karina F. I. is 27 years old and is a member of the "Grupo Solidario Azucenas" of Villa Hermosa. She lives in the district of Huanchaco, in the province of Trujillo of the La Libertad department of Peru.

Karina used to live in the jungle in the province of Tarapoto, finished high school but was not able to continue her studies for financial reasons. She married at 19 years of age and has a 7- year old child and a 10-month old baby.

She is a shoe and clothing saleswoman, depending on the season.

With her first loan of 300 Soles ($1 US = 3 Soles), which she repaid in 4 installments, she bought clothing and shoes. With this loan of 500 Soles, which she'll repay in 4 installments, she'll invest in toys and sandals.

Karina dreams of owning her own business and growing it with her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in toys and sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in underwear for a small business.

loans.name: Luisa Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Luisa Esmeralda tiene 46 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Azucenas de Villa Hermosa y vive en  el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió educación primaria por su propio esfuerzo, quedo huérfana y no la apoyaron para poder estudiar, entonces estudió en nocturna.
Se comprometió con su pareja a la edad de 28 años y tiene un hijo y una hija, los que aún son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la cría y venta de animales de corral, dicha actividad la realiza en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas compró comida para aves.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, nuevamente invertirá en comida para aves de corral.
Luisa sueña con tener una tienda grande en su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa Esmeralda is 46 years old and belongs to the "Grupo Solidario Azucenas" of Villa Hermosa. She lives in the district of Huanchaco in the province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad department of Peru.

She went to elementary school on her own accord, but when she was orphaned, she no longer had the support she needed so she studied at night.

She committed to her partner when she was 28 and has a son and daughter who are currently in school.

Her business comprises the raising and selling of small farm animals; she works out of her house.

With the first loan of 300 Soles ($1 US = 3 Soles), which she repaid in 4 installments, she bought chicken feed. With this loan of 300 Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she'll invest in more chicken feed.

Luisa dreams of having a big store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beans to cook and retail

loans.name: Marcela Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Marcela Yolanda tiene 36 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, pero no continuó estudiando porque se casó a los 16 años y tiene 2 hijas, una de las cuales depende de ella porque es estudiante.
La socia tiene un negocio que consiste en la venta de artículos de belleza que lo hace en su casa y también vende gelatina, marcianos de manera ambulatoria en el complejo arqueológico Chan-Chan.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas hizo una inversión en productos de belleza.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invertirá en stock de avon y productos de unique.
Marcela sueña con llegar a ser directora de unique.
texts.en:
Marcela Yolanda is 36 years old and is a member of the Communal Bank "United for a Better Future II". She lives in the district of Florencia de Mora in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru.

She studied up to grade 12 and then didn't continue because she got married at 16 years of age. She has two daughters, one who still depends on her because she is a student.

Marcela sells beauty products in her home, as well as, gelatin desserts, which she sells by foot around the archeological site of Chan Chan.

With her first loan of 300 Soles ($1 US = 3 Soles), which she repaid in 4 installments, she invested in beauty products. With this loan of 1,200 Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she'll invest in Avon and Unique products.

Marcela dreams of becoming director of Unique.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in Avon products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing for a small store

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Mrs. Vang A. lives in Kvet village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces a small problem because her field is infertile; thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Lor Loeung, is a chicken farmer. Mrs. Vang A. is a 28-year-old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to support her field

loans.name: Marta Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Marta Tomasa H. A. tiene 51 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Azucenas de Villa Hermosa y vive en el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió hasta tercer año de primaria, pero no continuó estudiando debido a que sus padres tenían la  creencia, que si las niñas aprendían a leer y escribir serviría para escribir cartas de amor a los varones. Se casó a los 24 años y tuvo 8 hijos de los cuales viven 6, cuatro varones y dos mujeres, dependen de ella 5. Enviudó a la edad de 48 años.
Su negocio consiste en cria y venta de animales pequeños como patos, cuyes, gallinas y también vende quesillo que le traen de la sierra.
El primer crédito fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en comida para animales y compra de animales.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertirá en animales y pedido de quesillo.
Marta sueña con ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta Tomasa H. A. is 51 years old and belongs to the Azucenas de Villa Hermosa community group. She lives in the Huanchaco district of Trujillo province in La Libertad department. Marta attended school through third grade, but quit school because her parents believed that if young girls learnt to read and write, they would write love letters to boys. Marta married when she was 24 years old and has eight children, six of whom are still living—four boys and two girls. Five of them are her dependents. She became a widow at age 48. Marta breeds and sells small animals like ducks, guinea pigs and chickens. She also sells cheese, which is delivered to her from the mountains. She successfully paid back her first loan of $100 (300 Peruvian nuevos soles) in four payments. She invested that money in the purchase of animals and animal feed. She will invest this loan of $100, which will likewise be repaid in four payments, in animals and cheese. Marta dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals and cheese

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeang S. is a villager in Trapaing Bet village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Mei Mang, is a cow breeder. Since his cow-breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Yeang S. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to raise.

Mrs. Yeang S. hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for her family. She is a 52-year-old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to raise

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
La señora Melania Rodríguez D. V., tiene 56 años D. edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Bendecidas  II y vive en el distrito El  Porvenir D. la provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercer el grado D. primaria, pero ya no pudo continuar estudiando porque no tenia apoyo paterno.  Se casó D. 25 años y tiene 3 hijas y un hijo, dos hijas dependen D. ella porque son estudiantes.
Melania venD. fruta D. manera ambulante, pero su inversión más granD. está en sus aves, cria y venD. pichones y palomitas.
Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300 que fue cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró fruta y alimento para aves.
Con este crédito D. S/. 200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en alimento para aves.
Melania sueña con ver profesionales a sus hijos.

Fecha D. desembolso del último crédito: 17 D. diciembre D. 2008.
Tasa D. interés mensual:  3,50 %.
texts.en:
Melania Rodríguez D. V., 56 years old, is a member of the Mujeres Bendecidas II communal bank and lives in the El Provenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad Department in Peru. She studied until the 3rd graD., but couldn't continue because she didn't have parental support. She got married at 25 years old and has 3 daughters and one son. Two of her daughters are dependent upon her because they are students. Melania street vendor that sells fruit, but her main business is dealing with her birds; she raises and sells young pigeons and doves. With her first loan of 300 Nuevo Soles, which was repaid in 4 months, she purchased fruit and bird feed. With this loan of 200 Nuevo Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in bird feed. Melania dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bird feed.

loans.name: Patricia Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Patricia Maribel tiene 35 años de edad, es tesorera del Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió Técnica de Computación.  Se casó a los 23 años y tiene un hijo de 9 años que estudia en el colegio.
Su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de joyas de oro y de plata. Tiene un taller en su casa donde trabajan conjuntamente con su esposo, el trabajo es muy fino y artístico.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró plata, para elaborar, aretes, sortijas y cadenas.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en material como oro de 18 quilates y plata.
Patricia sueña con tener una fábrica de joyas para poder tener una vida más holgada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia Maribel is 35-years old, the treasurer for the community bank Unidas para un Futuro Mejor (‘United for a Better Future’), and lives in the Florencia de Mora district of the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Perú. She studied computer technology. She married at 23 and has a 9-year old son who is in school. Her business consists of making and selling gold and silver jewelry. She has a workshop in her house where she works with her husband; their work is very fine and artistic. With her first loan of 300 PEN, repaid in 4 payments, she bought silver to make into earrings, rings, and necklaces. With this loan of 1,700 PEN, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will invest in 18K gold and silver. Patricia dreams of having a larger jewelry factory to support a more comfortable life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gold and silver to make jewelry

loans.name: Rosa Felisa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Felisa tiene 69 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Bendecidas II y vive en el distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio solamente el primer año de primaria, pero no continúo más debido a la falta de apoyo económico de parte de sus padres. Se casó a los 22 años y tuvo  2 hijas y 3 hijos, todos ya son casados.
Rosa Felisa vende condimentos molidos, tamales, fruta, verdura y vende animales cuando hay oportunidad.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 que fue cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró su cocina para poder trabajar.
Con este crédito de S/. 400, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, desea terminar de implementar para poder poner una bodega de golosinas.
Rosa sueña con tener una bodega para no ser ambulante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Felisa is 69, she is a member of the community bank Mujeres Bendecidas II (‘Blessed Women’) and lives in the El Porvenir district of the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Perú. She went to school only until the 1st grade because her family couldn’t afford her schooling. She married at 22 and has 2 daughters and 3 sons, all of whom are married. Rosa Felisa sells ground seasonings, tamales, fruit and vegetables, and animals when she has the chance. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which was repaid in 4 payments, she bought a stove for her work. With this loan of 400 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she hopes to finish installing a store to sell sweets. Rosa dreams of selling her products from a store instead of her hand cart.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up store to sell food products

loans.name: Sinonn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinonn N. is a 38-year-old and lives in Samnak Thboung village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest her rice. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy two piglets to start a pig-breeding business.

Mrs. Sinonn N. hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for her family. Her husband, Mr. Kum Keng, is a worker who gets hired by the villagers to cut wood for pay. Mrs. Sinonn N. has seven children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school. The remaining three are too young to work or study. Her husband is also shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest their rice and buy two piglets to start a pig-breeding business

loans.name: Ruth Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Isabel tiene 34 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Azucenas de Villa Hermosa y vive en el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando porque se dedicó al negocio, además en el tiempo que debería estudiar superior, las universidades no dejaban de estar en constante huelga. Se capacitó en primeros auxilios. 
Se casó a los 18 años y actualmente tiene un hijo de 12 años que es todavía un estudiante.
El negocio consiste en traer diversa mercadería y repartir entre conocidos y amigos.
Con este crédito de S/. 300 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en polos, ropa interior, etc.
Ruth sueña con ver a su hijo como un joven de éxito que logre sus metas.
texts.en:
Ruth Isabel is 34 years old, belongs to the “Azucenas de Villa Hermosa” Communal Bank, and lives in Huanchaco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad state, Peru. She completed secondary school but didn’t continue studying because she dedicated herself to her business. In addition to the time she would have needed for post-secondary studies, the universities were constantly on strike. She trained in first aid. She married at 18 years old and today has a 12 year old child who is a student. Her business consists of selling diverse merchandise and delivering it to acquaintances and friends. With this loan for S/.300, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she invested in shirts, underwear, etc. Ruth dreams of seeing her son become a successful young man who achieves his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in shirts for the summer season

loans.name: Tany Fiorella

texts.es:
La señora Tany Fiorella tiene 21 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Cursa el quinto ciclo de la Especialidad de Educación Primaria en la Universidad Cesar Vallejo. Es casada y tiene una hija de una semana de nacida.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la línea de Avon en su casa y también las ofrece en las instituciones y a sus amistades.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en comprar stock.
Tany sueña con tener una tienda de productos de belleza y otros productos.
texts.en:
Tany Fiorella is 21 years old, belongs to the “Unidas para un Futuro Mejor” (United for a Better Future) Communal Bank, and lives in Florencia de Mora district, Trujillo province, La Libertad state, Peru. She is in the fifth cycle majoring in Elementary Education in the Cesar Vallejo University. She is married and has a one week old daughter. She sells Avon beauty products from her home and also offers them in the institutions and to her friends. With this loan for S/.300, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will invest in buying stock to sell. Tany dreams of having a store with beauty and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in beauty products

loans.name: Roeurng

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeurng Y. is 52 years old and lives in Krodas Khor village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Moey Mean, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. In their plantation, they face a small problem because their field is infertile; thus, Mrs. Roeurng Y. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. Roeurng Y. has four children, one of whom sells animal feed while another is employed in a garment factory. One is a farmer who helps out on the parents’ plantation while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer  to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan N. is a villager in Samnak Thboung village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ngem Yoeung, is a cow breeder. Since his cow-breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it; thus, Mrs. Yan N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise. She is a 58-year-old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other two are employed in a garment factory. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Mr. Thea M. is 34 years old and lives in Ou Chrouk village in Kampong Cham province. He has two children, one of whom attends the local school; the younger one is too young to work or study. Mr. Thea M. is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to support his family. He now faces a problem because his motorbike is old and he spends a lot of money on gasoline. In order to reduce family expenses, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy a new motorbike for his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions with this new loan. His wife, Mrs. Keo Ren, is a dessert seller in the local market. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for his business.

loans.name: Theun

texts.en:
Theun T. is 35 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province. He makes a living by purchasing used goods to store for recycling and re-sale. He has been running his business for over eight years, and he currently earns a profit of approximately US$ 6 per day. He is the farther of two young children; both of them attend school.

Theun T.'s wife, Oul Savean, 40, is a rice farmer as well as buying rice to store and re-sell, earning an income of around of US$ 5 a day. To enlarge these businesses and earn extra money, T. has requested a loan to buy more used goods to recycle. He will use the remainder of the loan for his wife to order additional rice for re-sale. (T.'s wife appears in the picture, because he was not available.)

loans.use: To buy more used goods to recycle and rice to store for re-sale

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en: Mr. Voeun C. is a villager in Trapaing Anh Chanh village in Kampong Cham province. He is 53 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are enrolled in the local school.
