He and his wife, Mrs. Ouk Moun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even though they work hard, they still earn only a little revenue to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Voeun C. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy a car to start a taxi business. He hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Chhun Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun Hai C. lives in Krodas village in Kampong Cham province. She is 24 years old and the mother of a three-year-old child. Mrs. Chhun Hai C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because her soil is infertile and produces poor crops. She decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to  make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nim Noeun, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Y

texts.en: Mrs. Y L. is 53 years old and she now lives in Tuol Kvav village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Arm Boeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. They now face an obstacle because they do not enough money to hire laborers to collect their’ products. Thus, Mrs. Y L. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She has three children, two of whom help their parents while the remaining one is a beautician. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To hire laborers to collect their products.

loans.name: Ath

texts.en: Mrs. Ath L. is a farmer and she now lives in Kvet village in Kampong Cham province. She owns 1 hecater of land to cultivate rice. In her plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile and is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Ath L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel for a pump to water the field. She hopes to increase her rice revenue with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Phou Phen, is a fisherman. Mrs. Ath L. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel for a pump to water the field.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mr. Run V. is 28 years old and is married to Oun Shey Touch, age 24. Both live in Siem Reap Province where they own and run a store to sell items including various kinds of drinks like beer and some kinds of foods that their customers eat at their location. They can earn a profit of approximately $16 a day, and have been in business since 2005. The couple take care of one young child. V. hopes to expand the business to fill his customers' requirements and to earn more income to help meet his family's needs. V. would like to request a loan to purchase additional ranges of drinks for re-sale. (V.'s wife is pictured, because he was not available at that day)

loans.use: To purchase additional ranges of drinks for re-sale.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin S. is 21 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She sells used clothes in Banteay Srey Market, and started this business in 2007, earning approximately $2 a day. She is responsible of one young child. Her husband, Kong Sokhean, 24, is a barber. He is running his business very well, and he earns a daily income of around of $4 each day to sustain his family.

S. hopes to enlarge her business to fulfill her customers' needs, so she would like to seek a loan to purchase more used clothes to store and re-sell. (S.'s husband appears in the picture of his barber shop, because S. was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase order more used clothes

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sari

texts.id: Pada periode pertama pinjaman Ni Ketut Sari dipergunakan untuk menambah jumlah barang dagangan yang dijual sehingga pada saat ini Ibu ketut sari dapat meningkatkan omset penjualannya. Tidak sampai disana saja Ibu ketut sari dalam usahanya, tetapi Ibu sari mau meneruskan dan meningkatkan penjualanya sehingga mereka akan melanjutkan pinjamannya yang merupakan  Pinjaman periode kedua deangan jangka waktu 12 bulan dengan pelunasannya dibayar pada akhir periode pinjaman.  Jumlah penjualan pada saat ini sudah menjcapai Rp 300 000,-  dengan keuntungan Rp 20.000,- Per hari NI Ketut Sari ingin meningkatkan persediaan barang dagangan yang lebih lengkap lagi. Dengan keuntungan yang lebih meningkat dia akan bisa menambah penghasilan keluarganya.
texts.en:
In the first period, Ni Ketut Sari's loan were used to add amount of the sales items, so that Mrs. ketut sari could increase he sales volume. Not only that far, in running her business, but Mrs sari like to move further in increasing her sales, and they are continuing their loan for a second period for 12 months, with payment at the end of the loan period. Total sales today are about Rp 300,000,- (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp10,000 to Rp12,000) with a profit of about Rp 20,000,- Daily NI Ketut Sari likes to increase her items selections to something more complete. With increase profit she could add family's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital to buy sales items (Menambah modal usaha dengan membeli barang dagangan)

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhạn tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Sau 13 năm tham gia Quỹ và sử dụng đầu tư cho kinh doanh rất  hiệu quả đến nay chị Nhạn đã là chủ một của hàng chuyên kinh doanh chăn ga gối đệm tại phường Đồng Xuân Thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập ổn định cho gia đình chị Nhạn trong thời gian qua.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Nhạn has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1995. During the 13 years that she has participated in the Fund, Mrs. Nhạn has used her loans very effectively and has become the owner of a store that sells bedding supplies (blankets, pillows, mattresses) in Đồng Xuân ward, Phúc Yên town, Vĩnh Phúc province. This business has been able to provide her family with a stable income. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 12,000,000 VND (725 USD) to invest in the family business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bedding supplies business

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that consists of five members, all residents of Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Rem C., is 33 years old and makes a living selling drinks, such as beers, wines, and cokes. She is a good mother of four children, three of whom are single and one who is married. Her husband is a local photographer who currently earns an income of approximately $4 a day. To help meet family expenses, one of C.'s children is selling souvenirs in her community. C. is applying for a loan to buy a range of soft drinks for sale and the rest to expand her child's existing business.

C. has four other group members in this loan:

Noeum M., 26, sells souvenirs. He is requesting a loan to buy a larger range of souvenirs for sale. (Mr. M.'s wife is pictured because he was not available that day.)

Min S., 26, is a souvenir seller who needs a loan to enlarge her business.

Chek S., 35, is a single woman who makes a living selling vegetables. She is applying for a loan purchase vegetables for sale.

Rat C., 65, is a widow. She runs a small store, making papaya combined with other ingredients to sell to her customers. She requests a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy a range of drinks for sale

loans.name: Jan Baz

texts.en:
Jan Baz lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. His house is near the high schools. He is single and 39 years old. He has worked in the Afghanistan national bank for many years. He is engaged and in the next few weeks he wants to get married and he needs money.

He requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to use for his wedding party and begin his life with his wife and make a better future. He would like to say, "I am working in a bank but until now I haven't such a great program in Afghanistan."

He would like to thank lenders around the world who help those who need money in this poor country. He wants to continue his partnership with Kiva and AFSG.

loans.use: Use this loan for his wedding party

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Khom R. is 20 years old and resides in an area of Ptasrong Commune in Pursat Province, where she has made a living growing rice or vegetable crops since 2007. She now has two children, both of whom are still young and are living in the family home. Her husband, Manh Bou, 26, sells wood carvings. He purchases wood from the forest to carve himself and sells his wares from village to village in his community, earning around $2 a day.

Farming is the main way for R. to earn an income by growing a crop twice per year. R. applied for a loan to buy a buffalo to help her plow her farmland for growing her crop. (R.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to help in plowing farmland

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Mrs. Minu K., 25 years old, is a tailor in the town of Kritipur in Kathmandu. She opened her tailoring shop 5 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, long dresses, makhshi, and others.

Before starting her own business, Mrs K. took a 6 month training course in tailoring. She request a Rs 30000 loan and plans to use the loan to buy materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.

Her husband's name is Mohan and he is also a tailor. She has two sons, 11 and 6 years old. Her older son is studying in grade 6 and her younger son is in grade 1.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Anu

texts.en:
Mrs. Anu Darshan Dhari 32 years old and is a resident of Kritipur. Kritipur is located in Kathmandu district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Anu lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Ram Bhakta Darshan Dhari, is a driver and drives his taxi around Kathmandu valley. Her older son is studying in grade 9 and her younger son is in grade 6.

Mrs. Anu DharshanDhari is engaged in making candles. In Nepal candle-making work is one of the successful businesses because people are now facing 10 hours of electricity blackouts so the demand for candles is increasing rapidly. So Mrs. Anu is requesting Rs 30000 loan to buy raw materials for her candle-making work.

She uses her income to provide a better education for her children and she also fulfills the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her candle-making work

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi M. lives with her husband, one son and one daughter in Kritipur, Kathmandu. Her husband, Mr. Ashok M., is a microbus driver. Her son is studying in grade 3 and her daughter is only 6 month’s old. Mrs. Laxmi M. opened her small restaurant 2 years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She makes Newari foods in her restaurant because Newari food is very popular and tasty to eat. Now she is requesting a Rs 20000 loan to buyingredients for her work.

She wants to use her income to provide good education for her children because in Nepal the cost of education is very high.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly K. is a resident in the Samnak Thboung Village of Kampong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Chhun Chhim, pictured on the right of the photograph, is a sculptor in their village. Mrs. Ly K. is 38 years old, and she is the mother of four children. Three of her children are currently enrolled in the local school, while her youngest child is too young--4 years old--to work or study.

In her village, she sells gravel to earn a living. Because her business is doing rather well, she wants to expand the business. Accordingly, she is seeking a loan in order to buy more gravel to re-sell.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional gravel for resale purposes

loans.name: Bunly

texts.en: Mrs. Bunly K. was born in 1957, and she now lives in Anglong Thnort Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a medicine seller in the local village. In this business she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to purchase medications to treat her patients. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is a widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase medicine to cure her patients.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mr. Chantha N. is a villager in Kor Kosh Village in Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Hi Sokh Meng, are beauticians who have been hired to do make up for wedding ceremonies, parties, and so on They now face a small problem with their business because they have insufficient beauty equipment. So Mr. Chantha N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more beauty equipment to deal with that problem. Mr. Chantha N. is 33 years old and the father of a five-year-old child, who is too young to work or study. His wife is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more beauty equipment for his current business.

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en: The loan to the group, which consists of six people, is located in Trapaing Thmat Village in Kampong Cham Province. The group has chosen Mr. Sen C. to be its leader.. He is a farmer who earns his living cultivating rice on a small piece of land. In addition to growing rice, he is raising four cows. Since the cow breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it. He has decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow. His wife, Mrs. Keov Ny, helps him with the businesses. Mr. Sen C. is 47 years old and does not have any children.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of eighteen members, is located in Chreaek Village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. S. H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members to receive a loan. She owns a small grocery store where she sells grocery products. She is a 45-year-old widow with three children, two of whO. are fishermen while the youngest one attends the local school. Since their fishing business faces some problems, Mrs. S. H. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish line for this business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.
 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Sixteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end-of-the-loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish line for the family fishing business.

loans.name: Mr. Yong Paen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people, who all live in Chreaek Village in Kampong Cham Province, make up the village bank loan. They will use the loans they obtain for different purposes. Mr. Yong P. is a village bank president and a fisherman. His catch of fish is now little because he has insufficient fishing tools. In order to increase his catch of fish, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish lines. He hopes to catch more fish with better fishing tools. His wife, Mrs. Cheam Dam, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Mr. Yong P. is 57 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a sculptor while another one helps him with the family fishing business. The remaining two children attend the local school.

All loans made through this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so recipients are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish lines to catch more fish.

loans.name: Mrs. Chea Kuy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of eleven people, is located in Chreaek Village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Chea K. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members to receive a loan. She is a farmer who earns her living cultivating rice on the 1.5-hectares she owns. Over time, her fields have become infertile, which has resulted in a smaller crop and income. She has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer for the fields to make her crop more productive. In addition, she will use part of the loan to buy more pesticides to kill insects. Her husband, Mr. Thong Theoun, is a fisherman. Mrs. Chea K. is 34 years old and the mother of three children, who all attend the local school.
 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer for her fields to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Roen

texts.en: Mrs. Roen S. lives in Roka Village in Kandal Province. A farmer, she earns her living cultivating a small piece of land that she owns. Her husband, Mr. Yun Thoeurn, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar. He now faces a problem with his palm sugar business because he does not have enough equipment to make palm sugar. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Roen S. decided to ask for a loan to buy all kinds of equipment to make palm sugar. Mrs. Roen S. is 49 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining two attend the local school. Her husband is present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy all kinds of equipment to make palm sugar.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn T. lives in Lvea Sor Kroam Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Thuo Vann, makes big pots which can hold water. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy materials, including cement, to build more big pots to sell. Mrs. Yorn T. is 44 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are big pot makers. Two other children attend the local school while the youngest child, five years old, is too young to work or study. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy materials, including cement, to build more big pots to sell.

loans.name: Hamida Nakkazi’S Group

texts.en: Hamida is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 50-year-old widow with eight children, age 10 through 38 years old. Three of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (three grandchildren and her elderly parents). She owns a two-room house, where she resides with ten people. They have electricity but no piped-in water at home. The family receives two meals a day and rarely takes tea. She works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Her food kiosk is in Kalerwe market, which is located in one of the city's suburbs. Her monthly rent is 25000/=. She doesn’t incur extra transport costs for the food goods she sells because she buys them from the Kalerwe market. Hamida works seven days a week and has been with MCDT for six years. She is servicing her tenth loan. She wants to use the loan book to buy produce for the Christmas season. Hamida aspires to own a permanent place for her business at home.

loans.use: To buy and stock more food for the festive season.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Voeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Voeurn L. is a group leader of four members, who all live in Kampong Boeng village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a grocer, who owns a small store in the local village. Aside from this business, she makes incense sticks to sell. Since these two businesses are going well, she wants to expand tH. so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. She would use the rest of the loan to buy more raw material to make incense sticks to sell. Her husband, Mr. Lao Salim, is employed as a government officer. Mrs. Voeurn L. is 54 years old and the mother of two children, who are all employed in different positions. 

All the members in this group loan are recipients of end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery products and to buy more raw material to make incense sticks to sell.

loans.name: Choukouratou

texts.fr: Née le 10 Octobre 1971 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au Sud du Bénin,Dame O. Choukouratou est marié à ABALIOU Razack. Mère de cinq enfants, elle s'est depuis près de dix ans spécialisé dans le vents de différents articles divers, plastiques, et l'eau. Comfrontés aujourd'hui à des difficultés financières, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour remforcer son activité en ces périodes de fête de fin d'année.
texts.en:
Born on October 10, 1971, in Sakété in the Plateau department in the south of Bénin, Ms. Choukouratou O. is married to Razack Abaliou. A mother of five, she has specialized for the last ten years in the sale of miscellaneous items, plastics, and water. Confronted with financial hardships, she seeks this third loan to strengthen her business during these holiday periods at the end of the year.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two boxes of sugar and liquors for the holidays

loans.name: Madina Nakandi’S Group

texts.en: Madina is a leader of a four-member group. She is 40 years old and married with six children, age five through 28 years old. Four of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives with eight people in a two-room house that she rents. They don’t have electricity and piped-in water at home. The family receives two meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area,  which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She rents her business premises at 60,000/= per month and uses public transport for travel to and from her job. Madina works seven days a week. She has been with MCDT for six years and is servicing her tenth loan. She wants to use the loan to rent another room at her business premises to increase dining space for her customers. Madina aspires to own a permanent place for her business and home.

loans.use: To rent another room to expand her restaurant to increase dining space.

loans.name: Mrs. Samlout Chhum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people, who all live in Kampong Boeng village in Kampong Chhnang province, make up this village bank (group) loan. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Samlout C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fish seller. Because this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Hoet Bunheng, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Samlout C. is 37 years old and the mother of three children, who are all attending the local school.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK (Kiva's Field Partner) has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Catherine Lugo  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Catherine is the leader of this 4-member group. She is a 45-year-old, single mother of 5 children who are between the ages of 6 and 19 years old. She states that two of her children are currently enrolled in school, and that she does not take care of any additional family members.

She rents (and thus resides in) a one-room house, where she lives with five other people. Though they have electricity, they have no piped water at the house. Her family eats three meals per day.

She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Specifically, she fries a wide variety of foods, which she supplies to shops around town. Catherine notes that she works seven days a week. Notably, she has been a client of MCDT for five years, and this is the eighth loan she has sought through the organization. She would like to use the loan proceeds to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder in bulk so as to minimize transportation costs. In the future, Catherine aspires to open up a more permanent bakery shop.

loans.use: To cut down on transportation costs by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil) in bulk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $749 (2007 est.) and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.




Née le 04 Janvier 1957 à Abidjan en Côte d'Ivoire à l'Ouest de l'Afrique, Dame S. Cécile est mariée à COMLAN Elie. Douée dans la distribution des plastiques et la vents de divers articles,dame Cécile S.  dispose d'une boutique à Ekpè au marché Houéssi où elle vend ses articles. Pour renforcer son activité et faire face à la démande de sa clientèle en cette période de fête, elle procède à la démande ce crédit.
texts.en:
Mrs Cecline S. was born on January 4th, 1957 at Abidjan, in the Ivory Coast, west Africa. She is married to Elie Comlan. Skilled in the distribution and sales of plastic ware and assorted articles, Celine maintains a boutique at the Houessi market in Ekpe where she sells her products. She is requesting this loan, to strengthen her business in order to meet her customers needs, during this holiday period.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cartons of sugar, 2 cartons of milk and 1 carton of mayonaise

loans.name: Tith

texts.en:
Mr. Tith B. is a 39-year-old man who lives in the Angk village of Kampong Cham province. He is a laborer, while his wife, Mrs. Meas Chrep (pictured on the left of the photograph), sells soup. In addition, they have five children: two children are employed in a garment factory, one is a motorbike taxi driver, another is a construction worker, and the youngest child attends the local school.

Even though he and his wife work extremely hard at their professions, they nonetheless generate very little income; as a result, they are unable to provide a better life for their family. In order to improve the family's standard of living and living conditions, Mr. Tith B. is seeking a loan in order to become a motorbike taxi driver; more specifically, with the loan proceeds, he would like to buy a motorbike to start a taxi business.

loans.use: To commence a motorbike taxi business by purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Donah Tumusiime’ Sgroup

texts.en:
Donah is the leader of this 5-member group. She is a 25-year-old, married woman with 2 children. One of her children is 5 years old (and attends school), while the other child is 3 weeks old. She rents (and thus resides in) a one-room house, where she lives with three other people. Moreover, Donah takes care of her elderly mother. Although they have electricity, they do not have any piped water at their home. She notes that her family eats three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. In particular, Donah sells secondhand clothes at the Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. On a typical day, she can sell clothes to 10 people. Donah explains that she has been in this business for five years and that she works seven days per week. Formerly, Donah worked as a tea girl in a restaurant near her home. Her major challenges, in both life and business, include the following: weather conditions (e.g., the rainy season), business seasonality, feeding her family during difficult times, and business taxes.

Notably, Donah has been a client of MCDT for 1.5 years, and this is the fourth loan she has sought through the organization. In the future, she would like to expand her business to the point that she can sell her clothes in a wholesale manner.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing clothing in bulk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ida

texts.fr: Née vers 1976  à Lokossa dans le département du mono au Sud du Bénin, Dame T. Ida est mariée  à KOUDOSSODJI noël. elle est mère de cinq enfants. appélé communement Ahonon, elle s'est spécialisée dans la distribution des produits naturels tel que la banane , les oranges et d'autres fruits. pour renforcer d'avantage son activité et faire face à la vente des fêtes, elle sollicite son quatrième crédit avec Kiva.
texts.en:
Mrs Ida T. was born about 1976 at Lokossa, in the district of Mono, in the south of Benin. She is married to Noel Koudossodji and is the mother of five children. Know to her friends as Ahonon, she has specialized the is distribution of natural products such as bananas, oranges and other fruits. To strengthen her business advantage during the upcoming holidays, she is requesting her fourth loan through Kiva.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stems of bananas and 3 baskets of oranges

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng N., a 35-year-old man, lives in the village of Trapaing Thmor in Kampong Cham province. His wife, Mrs. Bin Soeun (pictured on the right of the photograph), is a pig-breeder by trade. They have four children: two children are currently enrolled in the local school, while the others are too young to work or study.

He is a rice middleman: in other words, he purchases rice and later resells the rice at higher prices in order to generate profits. Because his business has been doing rather well, he wants to expand it; thus, he decided to request a loan in order to buy more rice to resell. With the loan proceeds, he is hopeful that he can generate an increase in his income to thereby provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional rice for resale purposes

loans.name: Sok Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Heang S. is 37 years old and she now lives in Angk village in Kampong Cham province.  She is a gas seller.  Her husband, Mr. Phim Phally, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. 

Aside from this plantation, he is also a cow breeder.  Since his cow breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it.  Thus, Mrs. Sok Heang S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two more cows for breeding.  

She has five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.  Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two more cows for a cow breeding business.

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $749 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.




Née le 10 décembre 1970 à Dassa-Zoumè dans le département des colines au centre du Bénin, dame T. Aminatou est mariée à AGBAGNIDE Mathias. Ell est mère de quatre enfants et. elle est revendeuse des articles divers dans le Zone des Ambassades. Ayant actuellement des difficultées financières pour raison de cambriolage, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour renforcer son capital.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminatou T. was born on the 10th of December, 1970, at Dassa-Zoume in the district of Colines, in the center of Benin. She is married to Mathias Agbagnide and is the mother of 4 children. Aminatou is a reseller of assorted articles in the area called the Embassy Zone. She is now experiencing some financial difficulty due to a robbery and is requesting this, her second loan, to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cartons of sugar, 2 cartons of milk and 1 carton of mayonnaise

loans.name: Abdul Zahid

texts.en:
A. Zahid lives in district 8 of Kabul Afghanistan.  He is a married father of 2 children.  He is an educated man, and a very talented doctor.  

He has a drug store where he works part time.  Sometimes, customers ask him about the medicines, but he doesn’t have them in stock because he is unable to complete his stock.  When he found AFSG, he was really very happy and now wants to take out a loan.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for the term of 12 months to import more medicines and start working very hard.  It is one of his greatest wishes and he is sure that after this loan he will achieve this wish.

Doctor Zahid is happy.  He wants to say that if we have such great programs in Afghanistan, he is sure that every worker will be able to use it and make a better future for themselves.  He is happy with this loan process

loans.use: To import more medicines and start working hard

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chorn C. lives in Tnout Bak village in Kampong Cham province.  He is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine.  His wife, Mrs. Phan Tha, is a grocer. 

Even though they have different careers, they still earn less income than is needed to support their household.  In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Chorn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to start motorbike taxi driving business. 

He is 27 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study because that child is only three years old.  His wife and child are shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to start motorbike taxi driving business.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan P. lives in Kna Village in Kampong Cham Province, where she breeds ducks. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand and is therefore requesting a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She hopes to thereby increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Yan Korn, presented on the left in the photo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice, and they have three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is yet too young to study.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Juliet Kirwana ‘S Group

texts.en:
Juliet, the leader of a five-member group, is 42 and the mother of eight children ranging in age from 7 to 26 years, all in school. She also takes care of additional family members and resides in a two-roomed house with seven others. 

Working in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, Juliet rears poultry and is now requesting a loan to purchase more chickens and feed.

loans.use: To buy feed and poultry.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng M. is a villager in An Loung Tnout village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Pech Yin, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a cow breeder and he now wants to expand his breeding business. Thus, Mrs. Heng M. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for the family after she sells her cow. She is 44 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding.

loans.name: Lat

texts.en:
Mrs. Lat H. is 30 years old and she now lives in An Loung Tnout village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. En Ny, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In the plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is far froman irrigation system. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Lat H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump to water the field to make the crop more productive.

She has six children. Five are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one, four years old, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy a water pump to water the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria that has been a multiparty democracy since 1991. GDP per capita stands at $749 (2007 est.) and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.




Sieur V. Daniel est né le 17 septembre 1985 à Adjarra, il est célibataire sans enfant. Il est couturier de formation et à son atelier. Il a loué une boutique non loin de son atelier de couture, dans laquelle elle vend de la mercerie pour subvenir aux petites charges lui incombant. Face à la demande repétée de sa clientèle, il a sollicité un pret pour se ravitailler en produit de mercerie.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel V. was born on the 17th of September, 1985. He is single, without children. He is a trained tailor and maintains is own workshop. Daniel has rented a boutique not far from his workshop where he sells assorted cloth and sewing materials and quotes on the small jobs that he would then undertake. To meet the increased needs of his clients, he is requesting this loan to increase the products in his haberdashery

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread, buttons and other sewing items

loans.name: Abdul Hadi

texts.en:
A. Hadi lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives near the Kabul river. He is 40 years old, married and has 5 children. He has worked in a private company for a long time. He has a private house with two families, including his brother's family. He needs to build two new rooms.

Now he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans for the term of 12 months to buy the necessities that he needs for reconstruction of his house to make their lives easier and make living more comfortable.

Hadi is very happy with this loan process and he wants to thank those who are supporting this loan process in Afghanistan. He hopes to continue his partnership with both AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: Buy necessities for reconstruction of his house

loans.name: Alice Nanfuka ‘S Group

texts.en:
Alice is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 45-year-old widowed mother of 5 children, aged 6 to 19 years. All of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a two-roomed house with six people and she is the only the breadwinner at home They have electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She runs a stall at her home. Alice works seven days a week and has been with MCDT for one month and has applied for her first loan. She wants to use the loan to buy more produce for her stall.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her stall in order to prepare for the Christmas season

loans.name: Hanifan Naseer Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Hanifan Baji is 53 years old and married. She has resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. Hanifan Baji is not an educated woman but she knows the manners of speaking with others. She got married when she was just 18 years old. Her husband's name is N. A. and he works in a company named “WASA”. She is the mother of eight children: three sons and five daughters. Her elder son is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), having 3 years experience. The next to him is a mason. Her younger son is a driver and drives a local bus. Her first three daughters work in a cotton factory. Her younger daughter reads in 8th standard and her youngest daughter reads in 5th standard. Hanifan Baji also works in a cotton factory. She fills the cotton in sacks. She and her daughters each earn 1000 rupees per month. Hanifan Baji invests her income in her younger daughter’s education. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son.

She is a group leader of a few more women of her locality. Sobia Parveen wants a loan to buy tents for her tent business. Jannat Firdous Baji and Shahnaz Baji each want a loan to buy furniture (chairs) for their barber salon. Azra Baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn P., 45, lives in Ka Ort Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she is a housewife who takes care of her five children, one a garment factory worker, another a security guard, two students and one yet too young to attend school. Her husband, Mr. Phan Phorn, is a policeman who makes a small salary.

In order to improve family living conditions, Phorn is requesting a loan to become a poultry middleperson, buying and then reselling chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens to resell.

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria that has been a multiparty democracy since 1991. GDP per capita stands at $749 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.




Dame W. Honorine est née le 16 mai 1979, celibataire sans enfant elle vend des divers dans une boutique sise sur la voie de Agontinkon. Sa spécialité etant les liqueurs et les pattes alimentaires en plus des laits et des boissons en canette, des produits qui coulent lors des fetes de fin d'année, son souci ardent etant de ravitailler son stock en cette période de fin d'année elle a  sollicité auprès de notre institution un pret.
texts.en:
Mrs. Honorine W. was born on May 16th, 1979. She is single, with no children and sells assorted articles from her shop located beside the Agontinkkon road. She specializes in the sale of liquor and basic items including milk, cans of soft drinks and fast moving articles that sell during the end of year holidays. She has requested this loan from our institution as her intention is to increase her inventory for this year end.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dozen bottles of liquor, canned soft drinks and assorted articles for resale

loans.name: Kon

texts.en:
Mrs. Kon N., who lives in An Loung Tnout Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is a Khmer cake seller while her husband, Mr. Bruk Khorn, is a farmer who owns one hectare of land upon which he cultivates rice. Because his field is far from an irrigation system, Kon is requesting a loan to buy a water pump for the field. She hopes to make the crop more productive, which will help to better support the family.

Kon is 47 years old and the mother of six children, one employed in a garment factory while another four are attending the local school and the youngest is yet too young to begin studying.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for the rice field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sakhorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakhorn K. is the leader of this 4-member group, all of whom live in the village of Sre Tachey in Kampong Chhnang province. To earn a living, she makes Khmer cake to sell to her customers. Her husband, Mr. Doet Soeung, is a motorbike taxi driver. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sakhorn K. would like to start a pig-breeding business; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets for breeding purposes. She is 54 years old, and she is the mother of three children. Two of her children are soldiers, while her youngest child is currently attending the local school.

This group loan is comprised primarily of end-of-term ("EoT") loans; indeed, three members are seeking such EoT loans, while the other member is requesting a loan whereby regular monthly loan payments are required. The EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor: it allows the borrower to repay portions of the principal whenever he or she is financially able to do so, meaning that the borrower is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. Even so, most of AMK's clients start making their loan payments many months before the loan's maturity date. Further, nearly all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time; to illustrate, AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva-related loans.

loans.use: To start a pig-breeding business by purchasing three piglets

loans.name: Armandine

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria that has been a multiparty democracy since 1991. GDP per capita stands at $749 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.




Spécialisée dans la distribution des tissus et des platiques en plus de la vente des articles divers,Mlle  W. A, Armandine est née le 25 novembre 1986 à cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud du bénin. Désireuse d'acroitre son activité en période de fête de fin d'année et de donner satisfaction à la démande de sa clientèle, elle démande son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Miss Armandine A. Wachinou was born November 25, 1986 at Cotonou in the district of Littoral, in south Benin. She specializes in the sale and distribution of cloth, plastic ware and assorted items. Armandine is requesting this, her third loan, so that she could expand her business activity during the end of year holidays and better serve her clientele.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two cartons of milk and various cuts of cloth

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria that has been a multiparty democracy since 1991. GDP per capita stands at $749 (2007 est.) and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.
 



Dame Y. Jeanne est née le 20 mars 1970, marieé et  mére de deux enfants tous scolarisés, elle vend des poissons frais. Tot  les matins dame Jeanne Y. va à la poissonnerie du carrefour le belier pour s'approvisonner ou chez les pecheurs  puis passe à la vente ambulante de ses produits. Sa clientèle devenant de plus en plus importante, elle a sollicité un pret  pour couvrir toutes les demandes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanne Y. was born March 20, 1970. She is married, the mother of two children who attend school and she is a seller of fresh fish. Every morning Mrs.Y. travels to the fish market at Carefour le Belier to purchase her stock from fishermen and then resell her products, travelling door to door. Her clientele has increased and she is requesting this loan to meet all the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies of fish for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Kung Neang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kung N. is the village bank president of this 9-member group. All of the group's members live in the village of Srae Siem in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer; more specifically, she owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. On the plantation, she faces serious problems because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to maintain her field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy such seeds and fertilizers. Her husband, Mr. Kum Chea, is a fisherman. Mrs. Kung N. is 49 years old, and she is the mother of five children. One of her children is a shoemaker, two of her children are laborers, and the other two children are currently attending the local school.

One member of this village bank loan is seeking an end-of-term ("EoT") loan, while the other members are requesting loans whereby regular monthly payments are required. The EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor: it allows the borrower to repay portions of the principal whenever he or she is financially able to do so, meaning that the borrower is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. Even so, most of AMK's clients start making their loan payments many months before the loan's maturity date. Further, nearly all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time; to illustrate, AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva-related loans.

loans.use: To increase her crop yield by purchasing additional rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shamshad Akhtar Saleem Safdar Group

texts.en:
Shamshad akhtar baji is 43 years old, and she resides in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has lived for the past 6 years. She completed her education through the 6th standard, and she was married when she was just 17 years old. Moreover, she is the mother of four children (two sons and two daughters), all of whom are currently enrolled in a local school. Shamshad baji’s husband, S. S., is a painter by profession; specifically, he takes orders from his clients, and he then paints their houses.

Meanwhile, Shamshad baji has a clothing sales business. In particular, she buys clothes from the famous city of Multan, and she later sells such clothes in her own city for a profit. She notes that she has 6 years of experience in this business, and that she does this work to pay for her children’s education (i.e., she saves her income in order to cover her children's school fees). Notably, she has already successfully repaid two prior loans from Asasah (a microfinance institution of Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is the group leader of three other members of her community: (1) Azhar batool baji wants a loan to buy materials (e.g., colored threads and sketches) for her carpet-making business; (2) G. khatoon baji seeks a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business; and (3) Fatima bilal baji requests a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). Importantly, this is a group loan: as such, the loan proceeds are distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business; at the same time, the members mutually guarantee one another's loans (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears).

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional clothes for resale purposes

loans.name: Harriet Kamanyi ‘S Group

texts.en:
Harriet is the leader of a 4-member group. She is a 30-year-old mother of 5 children who are between the ages of 6 and 19 years old. All of her children are currently attending school. At the same time, she takes care of additional family members. She rents and resides in a two-room house where she lives with seven other people. Although they have electricity, they have no piped water at their home. She notes that her family eats three meals a day.

She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Specifically, she owns and operates a bar from her home. On average, she sells beverages to 20 customers per day, and she works seven days per week. She explains that she has been a client of MCDT for one month, and that this is the first loan she has sought via the organization. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional crates of beverages (e.g., beer and soda)

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar Muzamil Hussain Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji is a 39-year-old married woman who resides in the city of Borewala in Pakistan. In fact, she has been living in this city for the past 30 years. Naseem baji is an educated lady (she completed her education through the 6th standard), but she could not pursue her studies any further because she showed great promise in stitching and embroidery work. Her husband, M. H., is a watchman at a school. They have seven children (five sons and two daughters): her oldest son, a carpenter by profession, is married to a woman who runs a beauty parlor from home, and her other children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Meanwhile, Naseem baji works at home, where she makes embroidered dresses and stitches clothes. She dutifully saves her income to pay for her children's school/tuition fees. Notably, she already successfully repaid one prior loan from Asasah (a microfinance institution of Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan to buy cosmetics for her daughter-in-law’s parlor.

She is the group leader of three other women in her community: (1) Shama nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery store; (2) Parveen akhtar baji seeks a loan to buy various items (e.g., lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food business; and (3) Lubna baji requests a loan to buy medicines to resell. Importantly, this is a group loan: as such, the loan proceeds are distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business; at the same time, the members mutually guarantee one another's loans (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears).

loans.use: To support her daughter-in-law's business by purchasing additional cosmetics

loans.name: Kavule Effort 1 Group

texts.en: For 15 years, Juliet N. has had a drugstore in Kavule, Mukono. She is married with four children and also cares for two orphans, all of whom are in school. Juliet has never regretted her decision to join her lending group. The loans have helped her to buy more medicine for her drugstore and to renovate her commercial houses. She needs a loan to help with restocking her drugstore with more medicines. Juliet is a jolly and friendly lady and all the people around her area call her ‘musawo’, meaning 'doctor'.

loans.use: More medicines for her drugstore / clinic

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.ru: Шукуфа  Абдуллаева  ей 23 года, Замужем, детей пока нет. недавно устроилась на работу в детский сад  работает в детском саду  бухгалтером, у нее не большая заработная плата. Ей необходимо работа, что бы  был стаж (опыт работы), скоро она должна  выйти на декрет, но стаж будет продолжаться. Кроме того, после обеда Шукуфа торгует  не далеко от дома в маленьком ларьке, она помогает своей свекрови торговать продуктами , например хлеб, сахар, макароны и.т.д. и разными  вещами: носками, шапками, платками и всякой всячиной. Ее свекровь ездит за продуктами в городской рынок, а за товаром в другой город. Шукуфа получает кредит  первый раз, но ей очень хочется помочь получить хорошую прибыль  перед новым годом, если у них пойдут хорошо дела, она будет кредитоватся в будущем, тоже.
texts.en:
Shukufa A. is 23 years old. Married, no children yet. Recently she got a job in a kindergarten, working as an secretary. She has a small salary. She needs a job to get more experience working. Soon she will take a leave of absence, but will remain on the pay-roll. Also, in the afternoon Shukufa helps her mother-in-law sell various goods in a small shop close to her home. They sell such food items as bread, sugar, pasta, etc. and other things including socks, hats, scarves, and all sorts of knick-knacks. Her mother-in-law goes to the town market for the food-stuffs, and has to go to a different town to get the non-edible things. Shukufa is taking out a loan for the first time, but she really wants to make a large profit before the New Year. If everything goes well, she will continue to take out loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for business expansion

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
K. Nasir has been in the photography business for 9 years. He is married and has two children. He has a secondary technical education and was trained as an engineer. Since the local factories are closed, he started a photography business in order to support his family. Now he has many clients, but in order to stay ahead of the competition, he needs to keep his photo equipment up to date. Nasir wants a loan to buy new equipment, which will improve the quality of the photo services he provides. This will allow him to better provide for his family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of computer

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
A. Gavhar is 41 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. Gavhar sells office supplies and school supplies. Her trading place is located in the central market. She has a wide range of goods and the majority of her customers are schoolchildren. In comparison with larger stores selling office supplies, Gavhar’s prices are lower and more attractive. Now she requests $600 USD for the term of 12 months to purchase office supplies to sell. Gavhar has already taken one loan through IMON International and repaid her previous loan successfully without any violations. Gavhar wishes Kiva and all lenders a happy new year and thanks everyone for their support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: N. Grace is the leader of the Kavule women’s group in Mukono. She is a widow with seven children; she also cares for 2 relatives who are orphans. For 2 years, Grace has had a business making liquid soap.  She sells the soap mostly to supermarkets, shops and clinics.  She has also made empombo (traditional chicken) for 3 years, which she sells to different clubs and restaurants. She needs a loan to boost her liquid soap business by buying more powder, as well as to help her in buying more chicken. She is grateful for the loans because they have helped her to support her numerous businesses.

loans.use: More soap powder and chicken for her businesses.

loans.name: Yakhshiboy

texts.ru: Хамроев Яхшибой мужчина в возросте 42 лет , женат имеет 4 детей,проживает в поселке Хамровод Б.Гафуровского  района.сам Яхшибой всё своё время проводит дома , ухаживает за скотом.Откормив скот перепродаёт его на Чайрухском рынке.Он  считает что пока скот дешёвый , то необходимо увеличить колличество скота.Поэтому он решил обратится в Микроинвест. Сейчас у него 30 голов баранов.По бизнесу ему помогают его сыновья.
texts.en:
Yakhshiboy H. is a man of 42 years, married, with four children, lives in the small town of Hamrovod of the Gafurskii region. Yakhshiboy spends all of his time at home, tending to his livestock. He feeds and raises it, then sells it at the Chairuhsk market. He thinks that now, while the livestock is cheap, it is absolutely necessary to increase the amount of livestock he has. This is why he's turned to Microinvest. Currently he has 30 rams. His sons help him out with his business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle purchase

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en: K. Rebecca is a member of the Kavule Effort in Mukono. She is married with four children and also cares for thirteen grandchildren. Rebecca makes delicious half cakes, donuts, and other baked goods that she supplies to shops, supermarkets, and schools. The loans help her buy flour and cooking oil, so she can earn the money to cover the school fees for all her dependents.  It is because of the loans that she has managed to save enough to buy animals that she keeps at her home in Mukono.

loans.use: More baking flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Tohira

texts.ru: Дустабоева Тохира(Абдуллаева) окончив первый кредит подаёт заявку на второй займ и хочет также продолжить расширять свой бизнес.Она хочет получить ту же сумму и купить две коровы.После первого займа у неё улучшилось семейное положение.Тохира говорит большое спасибо всем инвесторам.
texts.en:
Tohira D. (Abdullaeva), having repaid her first loan, is filing for a second loan and also wants to continue expanding her business. She wants to take out the same amount, and buy two cows. After the first loan her family situation improved. Tohira sends a big thank-you to all of the investors.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Hakiba

texts.en:
Hakiba has a small business selling office supplies at the Farovon market in Gafurov, Tajikistan. Her little kiosk is filled with attractive, reasonably priced items that appeal to many customers. Hakiba has been in business for about 18 years. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. Currently Hakiba has requested a loan of $600 USD to help purchase a new supply of items to sell. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months and thanks everyone for supporting her.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
