To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: Sophie B., célibataire avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bignona B. depuis 7 ans. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du poisson fumé, des balaies et du citron pour renforcer son petit commerce. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Sophie B. is single and has two children to support. She's been a member of the Bignona B. village bank for 7 years. She wants to buy palm oil, dried fish, brooms, and lemons, in order to bolster her small business. The loan she's seeking will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm oil, dried fish, brooms and lemons

loans.name: Amita

texts.en: Mrs. Amita Mandhir ((.) is a tailor in the town of Kirtipur in Kathmandu. She lives with her husband and two daughters. Her husband's name is Mr. Tilak (. and he works in the Nepali army. Her daughters are in primary school.  She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She likes to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. Amita took a 6 month training course in tailoring.  Now Mrs. Amita is requesting Rs 10000.00 (USD $150) to buy raw materials for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en:
Barikisu A. is 32 years old, married, with three children. Barikisu lives with her family in a town called Goaso. Goaso is a farming community in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. The inhabitants produce food crops like maize, yam, millet, beans, etc. Her first two children are currently in elementary school while the youngest has not started school yet.

For nine years, Barikisu has been selling products like beans, soya beans, groundnut, rice, vegetable oil and other food items in the neighborhood market. Barikisu buys her goods from farmers in her town and surrounding villages. She says that food vendors buy in large quantities from her. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy bulk goods and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes the loan will help her save money to support her children's education. 

Barikisu is a member of the community group called “Do Good” Trust Bank group. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support and assistance to one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk goods

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina M. is 40 years old, from Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives together with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Ashok M. works in a private bank. Her older son is studying in grade 6 and her younger son is in primary school. Five years ago, Mrs. M. opened a grocery store selling a variety of goods. 

From her previous initial loan with KIVA, she was able to purchase a variety of grocery items. She is now requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 to buy other grocery goods such as noodles, rice, and biscuits. She wishes to use her income to provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice T. is 51 years old, married, with three children. Alice lives with her family in the suburb of Teshi located in the capital city of Accra. Her first born completed high school, while two children remain in junior high school. For 10 years, she has been selling vegetables like tomatoes, egg plant and onions; spices; and fish. Alice gets her vegetables and other goods from the major markets in Accra and then sells them to her customers. She says that food vendors come to buy in large quantities. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy goods in bulk and meet the demand of her customers. 

Alice is in the Awake Trust Bank group. The group members provide guarantees for one another as collateral. This allows them to access loans and provide support and assistance to one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, spices and fish

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony P. is a 30 year old businessman who is married, with three children. For four years, he has owned a boutique shop that sells men suits, shirts, trousers, shoes, belts and caps. Tony says he purchases his stock from major wholesale outlets in Accra and sometimes travels to China. He wants to have more working capital to enable him to purchase in bulk quantities during his trips. With the loan, he believes he would be more resourced to purchase good quality stock to satisfy his customers. He hopes that he can increase his profit margin substantially to enable him support his family, especially the education of his kids. 

Tony is in a loan group called Shadrack Trust Bank. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access loans and to provide assistance to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Ram Maiya

texts.en:
30-year-old Mrs. Ram Maiya M. lives in the town of Thecho, located in the district of Lalitpur, Nepal. Most people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. M. lives with her husband, two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is studying grade 8, her youngest son is studying grade 4, and her daughter is in preschool.

Her husband's name is Dharma Lal M.. He is a carpenter who opened his furniture-making business five years ago. All the living expenses of their family need to be covered by the shop income. Therefore Mrs. M. is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy timber to fill their customer orders for furniture. Her husband makes different varieties of furniture from beds, tables, chairs, to wardrobes.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin A. is married and has 11 dependents. He has received schooling until the end of junior high. Since 1995, Godwin has been a taxi driver, uses his own vehicle to pick up passengers at a fee. Godwin using his income to pay for utility bills, school fees and other financial needs of the family. Godwin is requesting a loan to buy some spare parts for repairing and maintaining his vehicle. With the new profits from his expanded business, Godwin plans to invest in his children's education.

loans.use: To buy spare vehicle parts

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas A. is married and has 6 dependents. He has received schooling up until the end of junior high. Since 1998, Thomas has been a taxi driver who uses his own vehicle to pick up passengers in Shama. Thomas uses his income to meet his family's financial needs. He will use the loan to buy a few spare parts to repair and maintain his vehicle. With the new profits from his expanded business, Thomas hopes to improve his children's education and also do things he has not been able to do because of his financial constraints.

loans.use: To buy spare vehicle parts

loans.name: John Attah

texts.en:
John Attah M. is married and has five dependents. He has received schooling up until the end of junior high. For six years, John Attah has sold second-hand clothing and shoes at King Aggrey Street in Cape Coast. He uses his income to pay for his family's living expenses.

John Attah will use the loan as additional capital to help him buy more used clothing and footwear to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, John Attah plans to buy cement to start building a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy used clothing and footwear  for re-sale

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: La dame Khadidiatou B. est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son capital d’embouche bovine. Elle va ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khadidiatou B. is married and the mother of 3 children, who are in her care. She is requesting this loan to bolster her working capital for her little business fattening livestock for re-sale. In this way, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and health situation, and keep all her children enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sheep and raising them for re-sale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina E. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high. Regina operates a local restaurant, which is popularly known as chop bar hear. She serves a variety of local dishes, such as "fufu" which is made out of cassava and plantain pounded together. She has operated her restaurant at Idan Hill in Cape Coast for the past 5 years. Her husband is a trader. Regina uses her income to support her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

Regina will use the loan to purchase more ingredients, spices, and food items for food preparation at her restaurant. With the new profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to add to her husband's savings in order to acquire a piece of land on which to build their family house.

In the photo, Regina is pounding the ingredients to make "Fufu".

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients, spices, and food items for food preparation at her restaurant.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en: Eleanor M. sells ladies wear and footwear in the area called Cape Coast. Eleanor has received junior high school education. She is a single parent and has 1 child. Eleanor has been selling ladies wear and footwear for 2 years. She is responsible for paying the utility bills and the child's school fees. Her loan will be used as additional capital to buy more clothing and footwear for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a piece of land she wants to acquire on which to put up a house to live in, so that she can stop paying rent.

loans.use: To be used as additional capital to buy more clothing and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina owns a small retail business. She sells women's underwear and clothing at one of the city markets. Her monthly gross income is 10,000 UAH (1 UAH = 0.124USD), and her profit is 3,000 UAH.

Katerina started this business 7 years ago. At that time, there were a few vendors selling the same type of goods and the competition was low. Later more people came in, but Katerina learned the rules of succesful business - good quality, large variety and excellent client service. As a result, her business grew.

Katerina would like to get a loan to increase her inventory. She wants to offer her clients the best choice of goods at this market.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Olga Decire

texts.es: La señora Olga Fernández Espinosa tiene la edad de 45 años,  habita el barrio santa Rosa ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, tienen a su cargo dos hijos los cuales estudian , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida para que sus pequeños no les haga falta nada , ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosmético desde hace cinco años y vende al contado y al crédito,  , entrega  sus productos de encargos  a diversos clientes de personas que trabajan en empresas privada, ella inicio su negocio con sus propios esfuerzos , la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento ,  la señora Olga solicita un financiamiento para poder incrementar su negocio y obtener mayor demanda de productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Fernández Espinosa is 45 years old and lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood in Masaya city with her husband who works to help her with the household expenses. They have two children who are in school. Her future plans are to improve their living conditions so that their children’s needs are met. She has been selling clothing and cosmetics for 5 years and she sells on both a cash and credit basis. She delivers her orders to various customers of people that work in private businesses. She began her business with her own efforts, the greatest difficulty has been the lack of financing. Olga is asking for a loan in order to grow her business and have a greater demand for products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Ansatou

texts.fr: Ansatou B. est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans, mère de 04 enfants. Elle veut, avec ce prêt renforcer son capital d’embouche bovine. Elle souhaite acheter un bœuf,  l’élever afin de le revendre à un meilleur prix. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Ansatou B. is a married woman. She's 44 years old and the mother of 4 children. With this loan, she wants to buy an ox, in order to raise it and to resell it for a better price. Her goal is to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an ox, in order to raise it and to resell it

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has two children. She sells women's clothing at the local central market. Her income is 2,500 UAH per month (1 UAH =~ 0.124 USD). 

Svetlana has been in this business for 8 years. She likes selling women's clothing and believes this is what she can do the best. Svetlana is a kind person and treats her clients well. She also is a hard working person and wants to work more to develop her business further.

Svetlana would like to get a loan to increase the assortment of her goods. She believes that the loan would help her to increase sales and develop her business.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita Es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaqcha que significa Hermoso en quechua.

Margarita es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Margarita vende comida en su casa, da pensión a personas extranjeras que pertenecen a la iglesia mormona, para lo cual participo en diferentes capacitaciones para la preparación de los alimentos. Además su esposo junto a un socio tiene un taller de carpintería, también tienen un carro con el cual realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite.

Los sueños de Margarita son comprar un terreno para construir su taller, terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Sumaqcha Communal Bank. "Sumaqcha" means "beautiful" in the indigenous language, Quechua. Margarita is married. She is 35 years old and has two children. She sells meals out of her home and provides boarding to foreigners who are part of the Mormon church. She has participated in various trainings on the preparation of meals. Her husband is part of a group that owns a carpentry workshop, and the couple have a car that they use as a taxi in the city of Ayacucho. Margarita needs a loan of 2000 soles (~$650), which will be used to purchase rice, sugar, and cooking oil. Margarita's dreams are to buy a plot of land on which to build a shop, finish building her house, and send her children to school.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: El señor Roger Espinosa García tiene la edad de 58 años, habita en el barrio santa Rosa ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposa y hijos la señora trabaja para poder compartir los gastos del hogar ; ya que tiene a su cargo un hijo que actualmente estudia su secundaria y se gasta mucho, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar su negocio para poder brindarle el apoyo a su hijo que pronto ira a la universidad , él trabaja como artesano y a la vez elabora zapatos desde hace treinta años , con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado mantener esta pequeña mico- empresa la cual carece de materia prima para poder elaborar producción . El solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para poder crecer en su empresa y comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando bonitos y variados zapatos.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Espinosa García is 58 years old, lives in the neighborhood Santa Rosa, located in the city of Masaya, together with his wife and sons. His wife works to help share the household expenses because they have a son dependent on them who is currently studying in secondary school and costs them a lot. His family plans to improve his business to provide support to his son who will go soon to university. He works as an artesan and has produced shoes for 30 years; with his efforts he has maintained this small microenterprise which lacks raw material for production. He asks for support from Afodenic to grow his business and purchase raw material to continue producing varied and beautiful shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material to make shoes

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi M. is a trader and also a seamstress who specializes in both men's and women's clothing in the area of King Aggrey Street in Cape Coast. Naomi has received a junior high school education. She is married with 2 children, and her husband is a security man. Naomi has been a seamstress for 7 years ago. She assists her husband in taking care of the children's needs and other financial duties. Her loan will be used as additional capital to buy more, and a greater variety of, sewing materials to improve the quality of service to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards buying a piece of land she wants to acquire on which to put up a house to live in so that she can stop paying rent.

loans.use: To be used as additional capital to buy more sewing materials.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huaraqac que significa Abundancia en quechua.

Elisa es casada, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos, Elisa viaja a las ferias de la región los días sábados y dependiendo de la oferta de cereales viaja a mas ferias, en donde compra cereales, animales menores, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. 
Elisa necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales y quesos.

Los sueños de Elisa son que sus hijos sean profesionales, salir adelante y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elisa is a member of the Communal Bankl Muchuy Huaraqac, which means abundance in Quechua. Elisa is married, 47 years old and has 5 children. She works at the fairs in the region on Saturdays and depending on the supply of cereals she goes to the fairs where she purchases cereals, small animals and products that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Elisa needs a loan of 2100 soles (US $675) that will be invested in the purchase of cereals and cheeses. The dreams of Elisa are that her children become professionals, get ahead and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elisa needs a loan to invest in buying cereals and cheeses

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huaraqac que significa Abundancia en quechua.

Agustina es viuda, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Agustina tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García, en donde vende arveja, haba, tubérculos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Además Agustina tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donde vende cereales variados.
Agustina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales variados.

Agustina sueña con seguir trabajando, estar siempre junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the communal bank Muchuy Huaraqac, which means abundance in Quechua. Agustina is widowed, 58 years old, has 6 children and has a stall in the Nery García market where she sells peas, beans, tubers, which she does everyday with the help of her daughter. Agustina also has a stall in the Playa Grau market where she sells various cereals. Agusinea needs a loan of 3,000 soles (US $975), money that will be invested in the purchase of various cereals. Agustina dreams of continuing to work, always with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agustina needs a loan that will be invested in the purchase of various cereals

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort M. B. is a married woman with five children. She is forty-seven years old. Her first child has completed senior high school, while the rest are still in elementary school. She works to support her husband in giving their children the best education, and also providing for the family's basic needs. Comfort lives in Obuasi with her family. She produces palm oil during the day, and sells “kenkey” in the evenings on the street in her community. Kenkey is a local delicacy made from cooked corn dough. It is served hot with pepper and fried fish. Comfort sells the kenkey in the evening with the help of one of her daughters. She purchases the maize from the farming communities in the area, and buys the fish and other ingredients from the town she lives in. She wants to use the loan to buy goods in bulk, especially when prices are lower. Comfort is in a group called “Osenkafo”, (Evangelist). The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support to each other in handling repayments. She was in attendance at her group meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy corn, fish, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huaraqac que significa Abundancia en quechua.

Emilia es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Emilia es odontóloga de profesión y tiene una clínica dental en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, cuenta con 2 asistentes que le ayudan.
Emilia necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de insumos.

Emilia sueña con tener una clínica grande, local propio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the “Muchuy Huaraqac,” which means Abundance in quechua, Communal Bank Emilia is married, 38 years old, and has 3 children. She is a dentist and has a dental clinic in a rented locale located in the center of Ayacucho city. She has two assistants who help her. Emilia needs a loan for 2100 Soles to invest in purchasing consumables. Emilia dreams of having a large clinic, her own locale, and of her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase consumables for her dental practice

loans.name: Sara Obdulia

texts.es:
Sara es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huaraqac que significa Abundancia en quechua.

Sara es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Sara se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de una persona, cuenta con un carro con el cual reparte los materiales a domicilio. Además Sara alquila equipos de ingeniería.
Sara necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos.

Los sueños de Sara son construir su casa en Lima para que sus hijos vivan allá mientras estudian y comprar otro carro para repartir su producto.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Communal Bank called “Muchuy Huaraqac,” which means Abundance in Quechua. Emilia is married, 42 years old, and has 3 children. She sells construction materials, work that she does with the assistance of one person. She has a car with which she delivers materials to homes. In addition Sara rents engineering equipment. Sara needs a loan for 2400 Soles to invest in purchasing bricks. Sara dreams of building houses in Lima so that her children live there while they study and of buying another car in order to deliver products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alberto de  29 años de edad esta soltero y vive con sus padres. Tiene tres hermanas de los cuales dos de ellas están trabajando en el exterior y ayudando a sus padres en los gastos de la unidad familiar. Alberto se encuentra al frente de un cotillón el cual inició hace 3  años con un ahorro que contaba de su antiguo empleo. Actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada.  
Como sueño personal desea ampliar su negocio y ofrecer un servicio mas variado y completo a su clientela, para que estos queden satisfechos con los que él ofrece. 
El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de sillas y cubiertos para su posterior alquiler en eventos como; quince años, bodas, cumpleaños y colaciones.
texts.en:
Alberto is 29 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He has three sisters, two of whom are working outside of the country and helping their parents with the family expenses. Three years ago Alberto started a party supply business with the savings that he had from a previous job. Today he has a very good customer base. He dreams of expanding his business and offering more varied and complete services to his customers in order that they be satisfied with everything that he offers. Alberto is seeking a loan to buy chairs and place settings that he can subsequently rent at events such as quinciñeras (special birthday party for 15 year old girls), weddings, birthdays, and catered events.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic chairs

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha O. is a forty-five year old married woman with two children. Both of her children are still in school. It is Martha’s heartfelt desire to help her husband sponsor their two children through to the highest level of academics. They live in Obuasi Township. Martha enjoys trading, and sells bags of rice, crates of eggs, and other food items. She has been in business for over fifteen years. Martha purchases her goods from the villages around Obuasi. She distributes to the local ‘chop bar’ operators in Obuasi. Chop bar is a local term used to refer to restaurant. She wants a loan to be able to procure the goods in large quantities so that she can distribute to a number of clients. Martha is in a group called “Osenkafo”, (Evangelist). The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs, bags of rice, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is 26 years old. She is married with no children. She owns a small business at the central market in Khoost city. She sells women's clothing in her small kiosk, and her income is 4,500 UAH (1 UAH =~0.124 USD)per month.

Ludmila has been in this business for 2 years only. She has worked hard to have enough goods to offer her clients for each season. Ludmila would like to get a loan to increase her inventory. She knows that good client service and a good assortment of clothing are key to her business growth.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Paula Marina

texts.es:
Paula es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huaraqac que significa Abundancia en quechua.

Paula es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Paula vende ropa de niños que vende a amigos, familiares y conocidos, sus ventas en mayoría son al crédito, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Paula necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos y conjuntos.

Los sueños de Paula son tener casa propia, local propio y estable, que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the Communal Bank called “Muchuy Huaraqac” which means Abundance in Quechua. Paula is married, 32 years old, and has 3 children. Paula sells children’s clothing to friends, family and acquaintances. Her sales are primarily on credit, and she acquires her products in Lima. Paula needs a loan for 1500 Soles to invest in buying shirts and outfits. Paula dreams of having her own home, her own stable locale, and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shirts and outfits

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary T. sells second hand clothing in an area called Cape Coast. Mary has received a junior high education. She is a single parent and has 1 child. Mary has been selling second hand clothing for 10 years. She is responsible for caring for her child's basic needs and paying the utility bills. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more bails of used clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a piece of land she wants to acquire, on which to put up a house to live in so that she can stop paying rent.

loans.use: To be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more bails of used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Nancy Vanesa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=34342&_tpos=9&_tpg=1

Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio.

Nancy es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Nancy junto a su hermana tienen una marisquería llamada Conchas Negras en donde venden comidas preparadas a base de pescados y mariscos siendo la especialidad de Cebiche, su local esta ubicado en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 5 personas.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 2250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales para comenzar a construir su casa.

Nancy sueña con comprar una casa, salir adelante, tener ahorros y casarse
texts.en:
Nancy’s first loan Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Imperio.” Nancy has a partner, is 27 years old, and has 2 children. Along with her sister, Nancy has a seafood market called “Conchas Negras” (Black Shells) where they sell fish and seafood-based prepared food, specializing in ceviche. Her locale is located in a busy avenue, and she runs this business with the help of 5 people. Nancy needs a loan for 2250 Soles to invest in buying materials to begin building her house. Nancy dreams of buying a home, being successful, having savings, and getting married.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to begin building her home

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El Sr. Alcides Báez de 29 años, es separado, el tiene 3 hijos, los 3 están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
   Don Alcides después de haber cursado sus estudios secundarios, empezó a estudiar para su profesión, el es  peluquero, gracias al apoyo de sus padres; en la actualidad ya tiene una gran clientela formada.
   El Sr. Alcides invertiría este crédito para la compra de un aire acondicionado y un juego de living, para que todos sus clientes se sientan a gusto en su local.
texts.en:
Mr. Alcides Báez is 39 years old, separated, with 3 children, all of whom are in secondary school. After finishing secondary studies, Alcides began studying for his profession – he is a barber. Thanks to the support of his parents, today he has a very large customer base. Alcides will invest this loan in buying an air conditioner and comfortable waiting area furniture so that his customers will feel comfortable in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an air conditioner and comfortable waiting area furniture

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Mary sells fabric, shoes, and bags in an area called Cape Coast, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is an auto electrician. Mary uses her income to pay the utility bills and to feed the family. Mary will use the loan to purchase more fabric, shoes, wrist watches, jewelry, and other items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest back in to the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric, shoes, wrist watches, jewelry, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Magdiel

texts.es:
Magdiel es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio.

Magdiel es casada, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Magdiel vende golosinas variadas en la puerta de su casa, que se ubica cerca de la posta de Licenciados, actividad que realiza diariamente. Magdiel tiene proyectado cambiar de negocio por la venta de ropa.
Magdiel necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.

Magdiel sueña con tener una casa propia, local estable y tener un taller de confecciones.
texts.en:
Magdiel is a member of the Imperio communal bank. She is married, is 21-years-old, and has one son. Magdiel sells various candy at the entrance of her house, which is located near the lawyer's office. She does this every day. Magdiel plans to change her business and to start selling clothing. She needs a loan of 900 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of various clothing. Magdiel dreams about having her own home, a stable locale, and having a dressmaking shop.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Magdiel needs a loan of 900 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of various clothing

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca  de 55 años de edad esta, felizmente casada hace 35 años con el Señor Ramón Fleitas   de 69 años. El matrimonio tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales uno  de ellos ya esta casado. Los otros cuatros viven con sus padres, todos están trabajando y ayudan en los gastos de la casa.
 Doña Francisca se encuentra al frente de una tienda de ventas de telas  en el cual se inició hace 20 años. Actualmente cuenta también con cinco salones que esta alquilando.  Como sueño personal desea remodelar dos salones que tiene en la avenida principal de la ciudad, para alquilar. 
La clienta solicita el crédito para la compra de tela para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Francisca is 55 years old and happily married for 35 years to 69 year old Mr. Ramón Fleitas. The couple has 5 children, one of whom is now married. The other four live with their parents, they are all working and help with the household expenses. Francisca can be found at a fabric store she opened 20 years ago. Today she also has five locales that she is renting. She dreams of remodeling two of the locales she has on the city’s main avenue in order to rent them. She is seeking a loan to buy fabric for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different types of fabric

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.

Rosaura es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Rosaura es profesora de profesión, actividad que no realiza, Rosaura es directora de una línea de cosméticos llamada Esika y tiene 72 vendedoras a su cargo, también vende los cosméticos por catalogo, que ofrece a amigos y familiares.
Rosaura necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos variados.

Rosaura sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales e implementar un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a member of the communal bank, "Amaquella," which means "Don't be Idle" in Quechua. She is married, is 32, and has 2 children. She is a teacher by profession, but this is not what she does. Rosaura is the director of a line of cosmetics called Esika. She is in charge of 72 saleswomen. She also sells cosmetics by catalog, which she offers to friends and family members. Rosaura needs a loan of 1050 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of various cosmetics. Rosaura dreams about seeing her children become professionals and starting her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosaura needs a loan of 1050 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of various cosmetics

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.es:
Gliceria es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.

Gliceria es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 1 hija, Gliceria es profesora de primaria, Gliceria se dedica a la curtiembre de cueros, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que ahora realiza con la ayuda de obreros en su domicilio, las pieles los adquiere en los camales, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Lima.

Gliceria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pieles.
Los sueños de Gliceria son tener una fábrica y producir zapatos.
texts.en:
Gliceria is a member of the Communal Bank called “Amaquella,” which means Don’t Be Lazy in Quechua. Gloria has a partner, is 39 years old and has 1 daughter. Gliceria is an elementary teacher. Gliceria tans hides, a profession she learned from her parents and now completes with the help of workers in her home. She acquires the skins from the slaughterhouses, and sells them in Lima. Gliceria needs a loan for 1050 soles to invest in buying hides. Gloria dreams of having a workshop and producing shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hides to tan

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with one son, Igor. She sells children’s clothing items in the local Osipenkovskyi market in Zaporozhye. She has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, her gross income is about 6000 Grivnas. She has 12,000 Grivnas in inventory. 

Alla is lucky to have a convenient vending kiosk in the local market. She always has many customers who keep coming back to her kiosk for she has very reasonable prices. Loans through Nadiya Ukraine have stimulated consistent growth of her business. Alla would like to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas to increase available products in her kiosk. We believe her hard work, natural friendliness, good customer service and self-discipline will help Alla use the funds received wisely and repay her loan on time. 

This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro B. de 41 años de edad está casado con la señora Antonia Oviedo de 35 años de edad, ambos son padres de dos hijos; una nena de 6 años y un varón de 17 años y desean que sean médicos.
 El Cliente trabajó como empleado en Argentina por más de 10 años  y  luego de reunir un pequeño capital, volvió a  Paraguay, emprendió su propia microempresa que consistía en una despensa que fue  progresando poco a poco y hoy día ya es un mini mercado.
 El monto del crédito será destinado a la compra de sidras en cantidad,  para aprovechar las ofertas y luego venderlas a buen precio cuando lleguen las fiestas de fin de año. La sidra, es una bebida muy consumida en festejos especialmente en las fiestas de fin de año, en donde se registran altas ventas de este producto en todo el país.
 Más adelante quiere tener un local propio ubicado en la Avda. Principal de esta ciudad, para seguir con el mismo negocio.
 Espera que nuestro país mejore y que haya más fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Genaro B., 41 years old, is married to Antonia Oviedo, 35 years old and are parents of two children, a six year old girl and a 17 year old son whom they would like to become doctors. He has worked in Argentina for more than 10 years and after raising a small amount of capital returned to Paraguay and started his own small business that began as a really small store and progressed to the point that today it's a mini-market. The loan will be used for purchasing cider in bulk, to take advantage of the prices and later sell at a good price when the year-end festivals arrive, during which lots of this product is sold throughout the country. In the future, he would like to have his own store located on the main street in the city. He hopes that his country improves and that there are more opportunities for work.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cider to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora  es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.

Nora es conviviente, tiene 31 años y aun no tiene hijos, Nora tiene una farmacia en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 3 personales. Además Nora es farmacéutica de profesión y tiene un laboratorio en donde produce medicinas naturales.
Nora necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos farmacéuticas.

Nora sueña con tener una cadena de boticas, un local propio para su laboratorio.
texts.en:
Nora is a member of the Communal Bank called “Amaquella,” which means Don’t Be Lazy in Quechua. Nora has a partner, is 31 years old and does not have any children yet. Nora has a pharmacy in a rented locale located on a busy avenue. She has 3 people helping her in this business. In addition, Nora is a professional pharmacist and has a laboratory where she produces natural medicines. Nora needs a loan for 3000 soles to invest in buying pharmaceutical products. Nora dreams of having a chain of pharmacies and her own locale for her laboratory.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia labora para un centro comercial reconocido en la ciudad, en el área de la cocina, su esposo  el señor Mario trabaja como mecánico independiente, ellos son personas muy trabajadoras que luchan por salir adelante, brindándoles a su familia y hogar un mejor futuro, están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de las protecciones en puertas y ventanas para mayor seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
Patricia works in a well-known department store in the city, in the kitchen department. Her husband Mario works as an independent mechanic. They are very hard-working and fight to get ahead, providing their family and home a better future. They are seeking a loan to install security bars on the doors and windows for greater security for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install security bars on the doors and windows of their home

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Esther sells groceries and fabrics such as lining at Cape Coast, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Esther uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Esther will use the loan to purchase more groceries and varieties of fabric for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her capital base

In the picture, Esther is in her grocery store.

loans.use: Esther will use the loan to purchase more groceries and varieties of fabric for re-sale

loans.name: Sor Erlinda Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Sor Erlinda tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Omar Torrijos en la capital de Managua, estado civil casada su esposo es ingeniero civil, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad ambos están estudiando, sus planes para su familia  es ofrecerle un mejor futuro, un patrimonio a sus hijos. Doña Sor Erlinda posee su pequeño negocio de ropa usada desde hace seis años, que brinda diferente variedad de ropa y otros productos a sus clientes los clientes comprar mucho la ropa de segunda mano por que es de buena calidad y accesible al bolsillo de las familias, inicio con fondos propio. Sus metas para su negocio es incrementar el volumen de venta con nuevos productos y mayores cantidades que  generarán mayores ganancias. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar productos como: zapatos, juguetes, materiales escolares, productos que aumentaran las ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sor Erlinda is 42 years old and lives in the Omar Torrijos neighborhood of Managua. She is married and her husband is a civil engineer. She has two children ages 12 and 15, both of whom are in school. Her plans for her family are to provide a better future and a legacy for her children. Sor Elinda has owned a small used clothing business for 6 years, providing a variety of clothing and other products to her customers. Her customers buy a lot of second hand clothing because it is good quality and economical for families. She began this business with her own savings. Her goals are to increase her volume of sales with new products and greater quantities that will result in larger profits. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans she will be able to buy products such as: shoes, toys, school materials, and other products that increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes, toys and other products

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia T. is forty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to six children. Two of her children have completed high school and desire to go further to the tertiary level. The rest are still in the basic school.

Afia works to help her husband to provide for the family. As hard-working as she is, Afia runs two different types of businesses concurrently. She works in palm oil production and at the same time, fries ripe plantains. She has been able to combine these two businesses for thirty good years, long before she got married. 

Afia buys palm fruits from the surrounding villages to prepare the oil and distributes it to other oil dealers at wholesale prices. She also buys plantains from the farmers in her locality, keeps them till they get ripe, fries them in the afternoon and sells the fries to the people in her community. 

Afia wants a loan to buy her materials such as palm nuts, plantains, etc. in bulk to be able to serve a number of people. She belongs to the All Nation Trust Bank group where the members guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access the loan. She was in attendance during her group meeting when her photo was taken.

loans.use: To procure palm fruits, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married. Her children are grown. They live separately. Lubov sells computer parts and accessories in the local mall in Kahovka. She owns a vending stall in one of the sections of the mall. Lubov says she started her business because lack of finances forced her to seek ways to provide for herself and her family.

Lubov has been running this business for seven years. Currently, she has 15,000 Grivnas of turnover capital. Her monthly net profit is about 3,500 Grivnas. Lubov has requested a loan of 4000 Grivnas to help increase profit from sales at her sales location. With assorted merchandise, she will be able to increase her sales and continue working to make a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To increase profit

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce S. is married and has 3 children. She completed school through junior high. Since 1996, Joyce has sold groceries in Cape Coast. Joyce uses her income to support her husband in paying utility bills and covering other basic expenses of the family. Joyce will use the loan to purchase more groceries to increase her shop's inventory. Joyce will invest the new profits into her expanded business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: To increase her grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Amoako

texts.en:
This client has a passionate story to tell; Amoako I. is his name. He is thirty-two years old, married and a father with two kids. Fortunately, both his kids are in school through the help of government free basic compulsory education.

Amoako lives at Atebubu with his immediate family where he was born and bred. He is a teacher and also sells bags of charcoal. He has been in this business for five years now, earning income to care of his household.

Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. He obtains his supply of charcoal from Awaso which is two towns over from Atebubu where he lives, and he retails it to his customers who come from Kumasi to buy.

Amoako is a very clever person. He was a student at the University of Development Studies (UDS) in the Northern part of Ghana. He deferred when he was in second year because of financial constraints, thinking that he could get a job that could fetch him high sums of money to pay his fees and other expenses. Unfortunately he could not make it and finally dropped out of school.

Amoako says he has been affected psychologically. He wants the loan to buy more bags of charcoal to meet his customers' demand and use part to further his kids' education. He is member of the group called ‘Ahobrase’ meaning Humility Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. He has registered with the health insurance which takes care of his medical problem in the mix of sickness.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to restock his inventory before the rainy season

loans.name: Sematu

texts.en:
Sematu A. is married with four children. She is a 53-year-old entrepreneur. She runs a mother care shop and has been selling assorted kiddies' wear and mother-care materials like diapers, napkins, Pampers, soaps, etc. for three years now. She lives with her family at Atebubu.

Atebubu is a farming community; people there are mainly into farming crops such as maize, beans, and groundnuts. Sematu identifies mother-care products to be the things most mothers require. Her business started on a small scale, as she was thinking that her market size would be static. Upon the advice of an officer on how to treat and retain a customer, she has lived on that advice which is working for her business. And now she can boast of an increase in her market size.

Sematu does not have sufficient working capital to run the business as her customers are increasing. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance when it is given to her, and she says this would help her to save more for taking care of her kids in school. She is member of the group called ‘Ahobrase’ meaning Humility Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more napkins, diapers, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.es: La Sr. Juana tiene 59 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Villa Reconciliación de la capital de Managua, estado madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos ya son independientes, los planes para su familia es mejorar su vivienda. Doña Juana se desempeña como costurera, vende comida y venta de cosmético desde hace cinco años, sus objetivos para su pequeño negocio incrementar sus ventas de comidas con nuevos y variados platillos, también espera tener más encargos de  cosméticos, en el ámbito de costura perfeccionar trajes y venderlos al  público en general. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar materias primas como: telas, maquina de coser, cosméticos y otros productos para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, como captar mas clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Juana is 59 and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is single and has 4 children, who are independent. Her plans for her family are to improve her home. Doña Juana is a seamstress and has also sold food and cosmetics for 5 years. Her goals for her small business are to increase her sales of food with new and varied dishes. She also hopes to have more cosmetic orders. In the field of sewing, she would like to make suits and sell them to the general public. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she will be able to buy materials like: fabric, a sewing machine, cosmetics, and other products to offer better service to her customers and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric to make her sewing orders

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes S. is thirty-five years old, married, and has five children who are all in elementary school. She lives with her husband and children in Obuasi. Agnes sells fashion accessories such as pomades of all kinds, ready made wear for women, cloth, and other textiles. Agnes has been in business for seven years. She buys her goods in the cities such as Kumasi and Accra. She sells her goods door-to-door and also sells in the local market. She wants to use the loan to make bulk purchases in order to sell to surrounding villages. Agnes belongs to the All Nation Trust Bank group where the members guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access the loan.  She was attending her group meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy textiles, pomades, etc. on a large scale to sell.
